story:
It takes nearly 15 YEARS to bring just ONE new drug to market...

ALS/MND patients can't wait 15 years! 

Every 90 minutes ALS/MND claims another life. There is currently no cure or effective treatment for ALS/MND. We need to transform the way scientific research is funded to speed up the process. 

That's why ALS Worldwide, a nonprofit organization based in the United States, has launched this grassroots fundraising campaign to give the global community the opportunity to accelerate the preclinical testing of a new and promising ALS/MND drug compound called MicroNeurotrophins. 

Several prestigious universities have enthusiastically joined an international consortium convened by ALS Worldwide to study MicroNeurotrophins and quickly bring the molecules to an Investigational New Drug (IND) Trial in just 12-18 months.

The ALS MicroNeurotrophin Research Consortium includes Harvard University/Massachusetts General Hospital; Virginia Commonwealth University; Penn State Hershey; The University of Sheffield’s Institute for Translational Neuroscience (SITraN) UK and the University of Crete.

Experts from these leading universities believe that this ALS/MND drug is cutting edge. It could have a massive affect on ALS/MND patients - and it may well be able to help people with other neurodegenerative diseases too. 

The Ice Bucket Challenge showed us that people want to contribute directly to research. You want to see your money actually making a difference in treatments available to patients. There’s only one FDA-approved option right now, and it only extends life by a couple of months. The"Crowdfunding Campaign for a New ALS Medication” is a way for you to contribute directly to bring a specific treatment—vetted by experts and supported by a consortium of research teams—into a clinical trial in just 12 to 18 months.  This is a concrete way for you to make a difference.

You can donate online or you can make your check payable to ALS MNT Research Consortium and send C/O ALS Worldwide, 5808 Dawley Drive, Fitchburg, Wisconsin 53711. 

Let's fund an ALS/MND drug that
could
save thousands of lives!

About MicroNeurotrophins

Developed by Dr. Achilleas Gravanis, Professor of Pharmacology at University of Crete’s School of Medicine, MicroNeurotrophins appear to mimic the beneficial properties of neurotrophins—naturally occurring proteins that help motor neurons develop, grow, function, signal, and even repair themselves—but are also small enough to pass through the blood brain barrier and reach the motor neurons affected by ALS/MND. By contrast, ALS causes motor neurons to degenerate and die and ALS/MND patients experience a profound loss of neurotrophins as the disease progresses.

MicroNeurotrophins have proven highly effective and non-toxic in experimental animal models of three major human neurodegenerative diseases: Multiple Sclerosis, Parkinson’s disease and Alzheimer’s disease. This initial research indicates that MicroNeurotrophins hold great promise for treating ALS/MND because they target the multiple pathways of motor neuron degeneration that are characteristic of the disease.

How do MicroNeurotrophins address the multiple pathways of ALS/MND?

Anti-Apoptotic
Apoptosis, programmed cell death, is responsible for motor neuron degeneration in ALS/MND. In both in vitro (cell culture) and in vivo (animal model) studies, MicroNeurotrophins have been shown to combat apoptosis by protecting and strengthening neurons. 

Anti-Inflammatory and Autoimmune Inhibitor
Inflammation is the immune system’s defense against bacteria, viruses, and substances that are foreign and harmful. However, there is increasing evidence that inflammation accompanies the death of motor neurons in ALS/MND. MicroNeurotrophins’ powerful anti-inflammatory properties may help reduce, prevent, or even reverse this destructive autoimmune response.

Glutamate Modulator
ALS/MND patients are unable to properly regulate glutamate, a chemical that carries messages throughout the brain and spinal cord. Too much glutamate in the brain can be toxic and cause motor neurons to die. MicroNeurotrophins serve as an indirect protectant against excess glutamate through their ability to promote cell survival processes, increase neuronal signaling strength and as an autoimmune modulator.

Neuronal Signaling
In ALS/MND, loss of neurotrophic signaling causes neurons to die. MicroNeurotrophins prevent cell death by increasing neuroprotective signals that help neurons survive, differentiate, and grow.


What We Need 

It will cost $4.5 million dollars to bring this medication to human clinical trial in just 12-18 months. ALS Worldwide has already raised $600,000 and is leading a fundraising effort to raise the additional $3.9 million needed for the FDA and EMA required efficacy and safety studies.

Participating universities have generously agreed to waive their facilities and administrative fees to show their shared commitment to the research effort and to reduce the total project budget.  By doing so, the partnering institutions have collectively contributed roughly $1.3 million to the overall fundraising campaign.

We are asking the global community to help us raise $1.4 million in the next 2 months. That’s a little more than one-third of what’s needed. At the same time, we will continue to pursue traditional philanthropy and institutional grants to reach our overall funding goal of $3.9 million. 100% of all donations are tax-deductible (in US) and go directly to the efforts of the ALS MicroNeurotrophin Research Consortium.

  1. Contribute today. Please donate whatever amount you can most afford
  2. Share, Share Share! Please share our campaign through email and on Facebook and Twitter (Check out Indiegogo's easy to use share tools above)
  3. Be a Fundraiser! Please ask your family, friends, and co-workers to donate and spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign.
  4. Stay connected. Check back often as our story and campaign unfolds!

Together, we can make something truly historic happen!

What You Get

This grassroots fundraising campaign is led by ALS Worldwide, a small nonprofit organization based in the United States, so there is no fancy website, no motivational wristband and no rock concert. 

We have lined up some amazing perks from having your name published in the research papers to an invitation to one of the consortium partner's labs to meet the scientists and receive an exclusive tour and presentation.

Everyone who donates will receive the benefit of knowing you're helping to bring us one step closer to an effective ALS/MND treatment. 


About the Consortium

(Left to right) Barry Wein, Sarah Byer, Barbara Byer and Stephen Byer

Stephen and Barbara Byer co-founded ALS Worldwide in 2008 to honor the memory of their son Ben who died that year from ALS/MND at the age of 37. In 2013, their daughter, Sarah Byer, and her husband Barry Wein, whose grandfather also died from ALS/MND, joined the nonprofit organization to contribute their professional expertise and personal experience to ALS Worldwide’s mission.

Today, ALS Worldwide advances scientific breakthroughs by fostering collaboration and innovation among leaders from all sectors of medical research. ALS Worldwide provides free personalized support via videoconference, email, phone and in-person visits to ALS/MND patients and their loved ones in more than 85 countries. To learn more, please visit www.alsworldwide.org or connect with us on Facebook and Twitter. 


                                 
Dr. Achilleas Gravanis

After rigorous testing in my laboratory, our team discovered that MicroNeurotrophins hold great promise for treating ALS because they target the multiple pathways of motor neuron degeneration that are characteristic of the disease. However, without scientific collaborators with expertise in ALS, I knew that my discovery would never advance to a clinical trial. That’s why I am grateful to ALS Worldwide for assembling the consortium and leading the fundraising effort to underwrite our collective research.

-- Dr. Achilleas Gravanis, December 2014

Dr. Achilleas Gravanis, Professor of Pharmacology at University of Crete’s School of Medicine will continue his work as principal investigator of MicroNeurotrophins, leading his team of scientists while providing technical assistance to the other members of the consortium.

Dr. Gravanis has served as vice-president of the Hellenic Pharmacological Society, the Hellenic Biochemical Society, and as a member of the steering committee of the European Pharmacology Network. He is a member of the Board of the Hellenic Quality Assurance Agency for Higher Education and serves as the Chairman of the Biosciences Committee of the Hellenic Research and Technology Council. He is a member of the Hellenic Council of Public Health. 

Dr. Gravanis has published 120 papers in peer-reviewed journals, cited in PubMed. He is the co-founder of Bionature, established in 2003, as a spin-off of the University of Crete.

   

Dr. Ghazaleh Sadri-Vakili

I believe that MicroNeurotrophins are one of several new exciting avenues in ALS research. Specifically, MicroNeurotrophins show considerable promise as they readily enter the brain and target multiple pathogenic pathways that lead to neuronal death in ALS/MND.

I am excited to be a part of the ALS MicroNeurotrophin Research Consortium, which includes my colleagues at Harvard University and teams from Virginia Commonwealth University, Penn State Hershey, The University of Sheffield’s Institute for Translational Neuroscience (SITraN), and University of Crete.

The Consortium provides us with a rare and wonderful opportunity to work closely with other experts from all across the world, each with numerous years of experience. It is an honor to be a part of this dynamic team working collaboratively in order to determine the therapeutic potential of MicroNeurotrophins. I am grateful to ALS Worldwide for assembling the Consortium and leading the fundraising effort to underwrite our collective research.

 -- Dr. Ghazaleh Sadri-Vakili, December 2014

Dr. Ghazaleh Sadri-Vakili, the Director of the NeuroEpigenetics Laboratory at Massachusetts General Hospital and Assistant Professor of Neurology at Harvard Medical School will oversee the testing of MicroNeurotrophins using an ALS/MND mouse model.


                          


Dr. James Bennett Jr., Bemiss Professor of Neurology, Psychiatry and Physiology/Biophysics at Virginia Commonwealth University’s School of Medicine will lead the testing of MicroNeurotrophins in stem cells genetically modified and used to generate motor neurons in a dish.


             


Professor Dame Pamela Shaw, Professor of Neurology at the University of Sheffield and Director of the Sheffield Institute for Translational Neurosciences (SITraN), one of the world leading centers for ALS/MND research, will oversee testing of MicroNeurotrophins in both ALS/MND mouse and zebrafish animal models.


                      


Glenn S. Gerhard, M.D. is a Professor in the Departments of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology and Pathology and Laboratory Medicine at the Penn State College of Medicine and Co-Director of the Institute for Personalized Medicine. Professor Gerhard will oversee testing of MicroNeurotrophins in ALS/MND zebrafish animal models and in tissue samples from ALS/MND patients.


ALS/MND Patient Videos





About ALS/MND

In the United States, Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) is commonly known as Lou Gehrig’s disease, named after the legendary Yankees baseball player who died from ALS in 1941. In the United Kingdom and other parts of the world, ALS is often called Motor Neurone Disease (MND). ALS/MND is a neurodegenerative disease that causes the neurons in the brain, brain stem and spinal cord to degenerate and die, which leads to muscle weakness, paralysis, and death. ALS can strike anyone and is typically fatal within 2-5 years of diagnosis, but about 10 percent of individuals survive for 10 or more years.

Contact Us

For more information, please contact Barry M. Wein, ALS Worldwide's Director of Philanthropy and Communications at barrymwein@alsworldwide.org. Please note, you will not be able to contribute more than $50,000 in a single transaction. If you'd like to contribute more than $50,000, we recommend splitting your contribution up into multiple transactions or please contact Indiegogo directly at support@indiegogo.com. To mail your donation, please make your check payable to ALS Worldwide, 5808 Dawley Drive, Fitchburg, WI 53711.

Please visit us online at www.alsworldwide.org and on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
How it all began...

My mother, who is 75 years old, purchased a Siberian cat from a breeder earlier this year and made the fateful decision to have him declawed. As you may know, sometimes declawed cats become biters out of frustration. We do not know whether this is why he bit my mother, but he did. She required treatment in the emergency room and follow up wound care. This experience made her fearful of the cat, and she began to struggle with what to do with this beautiful cat who bit her: euthanize him? find him a new home?

This is where I got involved. I had a new kitten of my own and my family was not prepared to add another cat, but my co-worker Matt and his girlfriend, Jackie, agreed to take Winter and give him a home with their two other cats. They had an elaborately constructed system of ramps and perches for their cats on their porch out in the country, and it seemed an ideal place for Winter to chill out and hopefully learn to live without his claws with an understanding family.

Unfortunately, just a month later, Winter (now named Putin--he's a Siberian cat, remember), was chased across the yard by a dog, tried to climb up a tree, and was struggling with no front claws when Matt reached up to grab him. Putin bit Matt's right index finger all the way into the bone and tendons.

Matt sought treatment right away, but a serious infection ensued requiring surgery to clean out the wound. In the process, a tendon was cut that will reduce Matt's range of motion. He has also required follow up wound care and a picc line to deliver antibiotics daily directly into his bloodstream. 

Matt is such a kind guy and a really good sport. He would never blame the cat for his injuries, and he still loves and wants to keep him. However, I feel so badly that his kindness toward this cat has cost him so much. Matt is a paralegal at our office and must write and type using this injured finger all day. Matt is also an accomplished guitarist, and I know that his injury has affected both his work and guitar playing. 

Matt has health insurance but his deductible is $5,000 in network and $10,000 out of network. His emergency room visit cost $2,200, his surgery cost $3,800 (his orthopedic surgeon and follow up care providers are out-of-network), and these two big ticket items plus all his other doctor visits will certainly exceed his deductible, which at the time of this injury had not been met at all. I have set up this campaign to help Matt pay his deductible. My family, colleagues and I will contribute, and I hope other cat lovers will contribute too.

Thank you for helping Matt (and his cat Putin)! 

Lauren Richardson (attorney in Gainesville)

story:
Greetings!

Welcome to our Crowdfunding Campaign.  

PointNurse is an on-demand virtual visit nursing App and community providing primary, urgent care, prescription management, and one-on-one real-time health coaching to help consumers develop and maintain healthy living habits.

Our Ethos

  • PointNurse = Digital Health App+People
  • PointNurse replaces "1-800 Nurselines" 
  • PointNurse fosters inclusion through our member-owner program
  • PointNurse reduces hospital, emergency room, and urgent care visits
  • Support victims of domestic violence, child abuse, human trafficking, and sexual exploitation. 5% of future profits to go towards programs supporting such victims.
Need

  • Low cost, accessible urgent care for consumers who have financial and other challenges visiting urgent and primary care clinics
  • Consumers getting and staying healthy post-discharge, post-chronic illness diagnosis, and when socially isolated

"Frequent, and real-time communications are important in supporting individual health related behavior change". ~ McKinsey & Company 

Our Success to Date

  • Completed iPhone and Web Prototypes
  • Development Team in Place
  • Organically Growing Provider Network 
  • Established Advisory Board
  • Two Private Investors

Our Funding Needs ($275,000)

  • Continue building our network of licensed healthcare professionals across the United States
  • Develop production-ready mobile and web communications App including integration with wearable devices such as FitBit
  • Develop strategic business relationships with government entities, insurance companies, and health systems

Our Perks - Virtual Visit "Access Codes"

  • Video/Audio/Text Virtual Visit Access to NP, RN, or other provider
  • Access Code can be used by contributor or given to friend, family member, or someone in need
  • Access Codes are entered into our App for live access to provider
  • Perks will be delivered six to nine months after the completion of our campaign

Thank you for your interest in PointNurse!  Please share our story with your friends, family, and associates. 

(Even small contributions raise our popularity and give us more visibility!)

story:
Le premier masque THERMOFORMABLE , avec des designs élégants, étudié pour une filtration parfaite et sans fuite d’air.

 

Ce masque en cuir haut de gamme se décline en différentes couleurs et s'adapte parfaitement avec les casques jet.  

Le premier masque THERMOFORMABLE :

A l'aide d'un sèche cheveux, il va prendre la forme exacte de votre visage :

- Diminution des fuites d'air

- Meilleur Confort

- Dimunution de la buée sur les lunettes

  

Contact en douceur : Sa surface antibactérienne est recouverte de trous anti-transpirants pour éviter la transpiration et l’inconfort.

 

 


 

 

Nos filtres sont fabriqués en France par une entreprise spécialisée dans la fabrication d'équipements individuels de protection médicaux et industriels.

Ils sont constitués de plusieurs couches filtrantes qui offrent une protection contre les particules (PM10, PM2,5), le pollen, les virus et les bactéries.

 

 

 Nos filtres nouvelle génération n’ont pas besoin de soupapes d’expiration tout en améliorant le confort respiratoire. Une fois saturé, le filtre se changé en quelques secondes, pour une qualité de l’air constante. Ainsi vous pouvez remettre votre masque en toute tranquillité.

 

 

 

 

Suivez nos nouveautés

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risques et défis

Getting every MASK generation order to our backers is our utmost priority and focus. 

Product Evolution 
Our team has extensive experience in designing, developing and manufacturing advanced consumer products and we are confident in our ability to provide you with an innovative, effective and stylish product. 
For the last two years we’ve been developing and testing our mask before selected the final design. This process has helped us identify the risks. As we finalise the design and move into mass production, the product’s details may evolve slightly and unforseen demand could impact on our delivery times . 
Because each product is made-to-order, we're not able to return / refund if a user changes their mind about the design, once delivered. 
Every change we make will be done with the aim of delivering the highest quality product. Our commitment is to keep you updated through the project on all changes.

We hope you will support us on this wonderful journey.

Our commitment is to keep you updated through the project on all changes.We hope you will support us on this wonderful journey.

story:
SELF-DEFENSE FOR EVERY WOMAN

Black Belt In Heels is an online self-defense curriculum for women developed by three friends who are longtime martial arts practitioners and instructors from various disciplines. Combining elements of Taekwondo, Russian Systema, and Krav Maga, we formulated 8 self-defense techniques that every woman should know. These techniques will be demonstrated in 8 online videos, where they will be broken down and drilled for maximum efficacy. The entire curriculum will be accessible through media devices registered by a subscriber. 

 

GET $35 FOR $25

The entire Black Belt In Heels package (8 videos) costs a one-time payment of $35. That's roughly the same price as a cup of your favorite coffee per lesson. However, if you make a $25 donation to its Indiegogo campaign now or before its launch date of May 15, you get a single access to the entire package once its up. That's $10 off the original price. 

 

OUR DRIVE

The project came out of our desire to provide an accessible platform for women to learn basic self-defense. As longtime practitioners and instructors of different martial arts disciplines, it has been our collective frustration that not more women are enrolling themselves in self-defense classes. We identified 3 main impediments:

1. Lack of Accessibility
- The venues and schedules of most self-defense classes are not easily accessible.
2. High Cost
- A regular self-defense class would cost an average membership of $100 per month or $25 per lesson.
3. Overwhelming Atmosphere
- Many women, specially those who don’t have any previous experience picking up a martial arts discipline, find the atmosphere of self-defense schools overwhelming.

To address these, we developed BLACK BELT IN HEELS as an ACCESSIBLE, AFFORDABLE, and EFFECTIVE alternative. 

 

SHARE IN OUR DREAM OF MAKING BASIC SELF-DEFENSE ACCESSIBLE TO EVERY WOMAN RIGHT NOW

Be one of the first contributors to our Indiegogo campaign! Again, a $25 donation gives you single access to the online curriculum by May 15. Any amount in excess gives you multiple accesses, which you can give as a gift to your loved ones (where amount divided by $25 equals the number of access).


ONE LAST THING

Please spread the word to female family members and friends who would benefit much from being part of the Black Belt In Heels community... which is all of them!   
 

We look forward to working with you! =)

THE BLACK BELT IN HEELS TEAM

Geraldine Guese

Drew Fernandez

Rogelio Peñaverde Jr.

story:
We've taken the brain hacks from NEUROPLANNER and have put it in this book.  Master instant productivity, creativity, and happiness through a habit of weekly brain hacking.  

From our planner into a book

 

 Want a planner instead?  Get it here.

 

Includes a guide and weekly contents

 

Weekly content and worksheet

 

 

You can use an ink pen on this beautiful, thick paper

  

 

 

Available in hardbound and softcover

 

#PlanGeek is our online supplement to weekly brain hacking.  You get updates from the latest discoveries in neuroscience and how to use it in your life.  It's also an awesome think tank community that you are most welcome.    

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
From the team that brought you the original Shock Clock wearable device on Indiegogo in 2015...

...we bring you a new spin on an already successful product that helps you do one thing better than any other:

We make you wake up!

Enjoyed by:

 

The Problem?

You know the feeling – you set an alarm the night before, sure you're going to wake up. But when you hear the alarm....and well – you just can't help hitting the snooze button.

You lay in bed too long and end up feeling rushed, frustrated, and tired your whole day.

But what if you didn't have to feel that way? What if you could get up, effortlessly and naturally, at the time you desired?

What would you do with that extra hour? Would you eat breakfast? Would you meditate? Would you exercise?

 

 

The Pavlok Shock Clock 2 isn't like other alarm clocks you've tried. Other alarms rely on annoying you until you give up and get out of bed – awake -- but now in a terrible mood because of your annoying alarm.

That is NOT how you want to start your day.

Often, a simple touch can work much better than the sound of an alarm.

The Pavlok Shock Clock 2 is the first device that uses effective, tested sensory inputs to wake you up and keep you alert.

As Seen In

 

How Does It Wake Me Up?

The Shock Clock 2 uses three sensory stimuli to ensure you wake up.

 

 

 

The Shock Clock 2 Wake Up Trainer is the Next Evolution of the Pavlok Alarm Clock

 

In 2015, we launched an IGG for the original Shock Clock. The Device was designed to GUARANTEE that you wake up in the morning, at the precise moment you choose, using 3 different sensory stimulus, beep, vibe, and zap.

The campaign was a huge success, and we successfully fulfilled all of the units to our IndieGogo backers in 2015 (how many times has that NOT happened!!).

Along with shipping the Shock Clock hardware we launched a very simple app – the Pavlok Alarm Clock app. It was (and still is) very basic: one alarm, choose your stimulus, and press save, along with Snooze Lock, a feature that disables your ability to snooze the alarm and makes you do jumping jacks to shut it off.. It's not fancy, but holy @#$% is it effective!

This isn't just some crazy idea – we've had thousands of Pavlok users use the original Shock Clock to wake up quickly and feel alert every morning, and their stories are inspirational to hear. Here is what just a few Shock Clock users had to say about the basic alarm feature:

 

 

 

 

If the Shock Clock Is So Successful, Why Build A Shock Clock 2?

 

We started with the Shock Clock, but users wanted much, much more.

The Shock Clock is SIMPLE. It only lets you set alarms and lock the snooze.

So we're back on IndieGogo, developing the features to make this the world's BEST alarm clock.

With your help and support we can add these new features:

Snooze Lock: The original Shock Clock introduced the Snooze Lock, the ability to lock the snooze and keep your alarm running until you get out of bed and do jumping jacks. Our advanced motion tracking forces you to get on your feet and get your body moving. Imagine waking up alert and ready for your day by doing 10-15 jumping jacks in order to shut-off your alarm. It might sound crazy, but man is it affective!

 

 

Advanced Snooze Lock: Shock Clock 2 will use motion tracking to know when you’re out of bed and won’t let you cheat. Advanced Jumping Jack shut-off, along with new features like QR/UPC code scanner that will make you get out of bed and leave the room to go scan a QR/UPC code in order to shut off the alarm.

 

Accountability: Shock Clock 2 will let your friends know if you don't wake up----and if you don't get out of bed, optionally give them the ability to zap you awake.

 

Sleep Cycle Analysis: Shock Clock 2 will have automatic sleep tracking using advanced motion detection from a 9-axis accelerometer so you can track your sleep and learn what patterns and habits you can develop to get the best night’s sleep possible!

 

Morning Routine: Shock Clock 2 will come with a built in Morning Routine schedule so you can set the tasks that are most important for your day and make sure you get them done first thing. If you don’t do your routine, watch out, a zap is coming!

 

Evening Routine: One of the main requests we get from Pavlok and Shock Clock users is help getting to sleep at night. Shock Clock 2 will feature an evening routine reminder that will alert you when it is time to start getting ready for bed and provide you with a checklist of items you choose to prepare for your best night’s sleep.

 

 

What Do I Get With The Shock Clock 2 Wake Up Trainer?

The Shock Clock 2 comes boxed with the Shock Clock module, a wristband, and a charging cable. The wristband is a magnetic milanese band for ease of use and a stylish look. You can also order from a complete line of silicone wristbands available in 6 different colors: pink, black, blue, grey, red, and white.

 

How Do I Use The Shock Clock 2 Wake Up Trainer?

The wristband and module of the Shock Clock 2 are meant to be worn to bed at night. You set the alarm from the app (available in Android and iOS) and choose how you want to be woken up.

There are four types of wake up options:

1. Beep

2. Vibrate

3. Zap (mild electric stimulus)

4. Or a combination of all three

 

When the alarm goes off, the Shock Clock 2 will alert you to wake up using the stimulus you selected. We recommend starting with a beep or vibration to wake up, with a Zap if you don't get up with the beep or vibrate.

How Do I Turn Off The Alarm?

With Snooze Lock off, You can snooze/turn off the alarm from within the app, or you can short press (snooze) or long press (disable alarm) on the lighting bolt of the Shock Clock module.

With Snooze Lock on, the device will require that you do jumping jacks, or scan a QR/UPC code in a different room. If you try to go back to sleep? Well...ZAP.

 

Campaign Timeline

 

Will the Shock Clock Wake 2 Up Trainer Help Me Get To Sleep Earlier?

Dozens of our users tell the same story --- the act of using the Shock Clock makes them become morning people. They naturally begin to fall asleep earlier in the evening, converting them from night owls to morning people.

If that isn’t enough we have a new Evening Routine feature that can alert you when it is time to start getting ready for bed and provides a list of items you need to do to get the best night’s sleep you’ve ever had!

 

Why We Aren't Like Other Indiegogo Campaigns (hint: you'll actually receive your product on time)

Unlike other projects we have a proven product and we have a proven team. We have built devices before, and we have already engineered this tech. With Indiegogo's support, we'll build the SOFTWARE to make this device the best alarm clock ever.

 

The Team Behind Pavlok Shock Clock Wake Up Trainer

Founder Maneesh Sethi has a solid track record as an entrepreneur: he ran the website Hack the System and invented the "big brother" of Shock Clock, the Pavlok which successfully raised over $280,000 in 2014 on Indiegogo, and now has been shipped to over 30,000 people globally.

He also headed up the design and manufacturing of the Original Shock Clock and its successful indiegogo campaign in 2015. The Original Shock Clock raised over $300,000 and has been shipped to over 30,000 users worldwide

He has also written four programming books (including an international bestseller), and helped launch numerous New York Times Bestsellers (such as The 4- Hour Chef by Tim Ferriss).

Behavioral Technology Group (parent company to Pavlok and now Shock Clock) has grown to include 10 all-star team members specializing in software design, engineering, marketing and customer service.

 

Perks!!!

 

Shock Clock 2 Mobile App - $29 (Regular $49)  ***SOLD OUT***

If you already own 2nd Generation Pavlok Hardware this perk will let you upgrade your Shock Clock module to Shock Clock 2. 

***HARDWARE NOT INCLUDED IN THIS PERK***

 

 

Shock Clock 2 Silicone Band - $79 (Regular $149)

This perk gets you the 2nd Gen Pavlok hardware with a black silicone wristband as well as access to the Shock Clock 2 mobile app for Android and IOS

 

Shock Clock 2 Milanese Band - $89 (Regular $159)

This perk gets you the 2nd Gen Pavlok hardware with a black milanese wristband as well as access to the Shock Clock 2 mobile app for Android and IOS.

 

Add A Milanese Band - $25 (Regular $49)

Add a single, black, Milanese band to any other perk we offer! ***Pavlok Module Not Included***

 

 

Shock Clock 2 Friends Bundle - $149 (Regular $298)

Shock Clock 2 is more fun with a friend! Back this perk and get TWO of the Shock Clock 2's, one for you and one for a friend! Comes with two each of the Hardware, black silicone wristbands, and mobile app codes.

 

 

Shock Clock 2 Retail 5 Pack - $395 (Regular $745)

Shock Clock 2 for retailers! Think you have an audience that can benefit from this product? Back this perk and we will send you FIVE Shock Clock 2 bundles for 50% off! Comes with FIVE each of the Hardware, black silicone wristbands, and mobile app codes.

 

 

Shock Clock 2 Retail 10 Pack - $750 (Regular $1490)

Shock Clock 2 for retailers! Think you have an audience that can benefit from this product? Back this perk and we will send you 10 Shock Clock 2 bundles for 50% off! Comes with 10 each of the Hardware, black silicone wristbands, and mobile app codes.

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I set the Alarm?

Via Bluetooth and the included iOS/Android App.

 

Will the alarm still go off if Shock Clock 2 disconnects from my phone in the middle of the night?

Yes the alarm will still work because when you press "save alarm" in the app it actually saves the information to the Real Time Clock memory in the Shock Clock 2, meaning you don't have to keep your phone connected for the alarm to work. Likewise you'll be able to shut off the alarm without connecting to your phone in the morning – only connect when you need to change one of your alarms.

 

What is the difference between the $145 Shock Clock that ships from Pavlok.com and the Shock Clock 2 that ships when the campaign ends?

The hardware from Shock Clock, if purchased after April 2018 is the same. The main difference will be access to new features in the Shock Clock 2 app. If you buy a Shock Clock from Pavlok.com you will have the option to upgrade to Shock Clock 2 features within the campaign, or after the campaign ends for $29. To make sure we hit our goals and develop Shock Clock 2 we recommend supporting it here, in the Indiegogo campaign and not waiting until later.

If you are excited and want to get your hands on the original Shock Clock to start waking up in the morning GUARANTEED, go to Pavlok.com and make your purchase and come back here to back the Shock Clock 2 software so you can access the upgrade when we go live.

 

The feature that I want the most is a stretch goal. If you don't reach the goal, does that mean it will never get developed?

Not necessarily, but it will definitely take us longer. We're hoping that this campaign will be super successful so that we can afford to hire the software engineering talent to develop all of these features quickly & have them work great. The more money we raise, the more features we can commit to by the delivery date in September.

 

How Can I Choose to Be Woken up?

The Shock Clock will wake you up with haptic feedback:  beep, vibration or zap.

 

How uncomfortable is the zap?

The electrical stimulus is carefully designed so that it is enough to be uncomfortable, but not so strong that it hurts (and nowhere near dangerous – the Shock Clock is CE/FCC certified and 65,000 Pavlok users have proven it is safe and effective). It's a lot like a static shock you get when you touch a doorknob after rubbing your feet on the carpet.

 

What is the Battery Life?

The battery life ranges from 7-10 days and charges through micro USB.

 

What Devices are Compatible with the Shock Clock App?

Apps support Android 4.3+ iOS 10+

 

Is There a Warranty?

Yes, we offer a 6-month manufacturer’s warranty against defects.

 

What is The Prospective Delivery Date for the Shock Clock?

If you buy the 'Get Shock Clock 2 NOW' perk your Shock Clock will ship once the campaign ends. If you've selected any other package expected delivery is October 2018

 

Have any other questions? Feel free to reach out by posting a question in the public comments section, or by sending us an email at support@pavlok.com.

Comes with two each of the Hardware, black silicone wristbands, and mobile app codes.  Shock Clock 2 Retail 5 Pack - $395 (Regular $745)Shock Clock 2 for retailers! Think you have an audience that can benefit from this product? Back this perk and we will send you FIVE Shock Clock 2 bundles for 50% off! Comes with FIVE each of the Hardware, black silicone wristbands, and mobile app codes.  Shock Clock 2 Retail 10 Pack - $750 (Regular $1490)Shock Clock 2 for retailers! Think you have an audience that can benefit from this product? Back this perk and we will send you 10 Shock Clock 2 bundles for 50% off! Comes with 10 each of the Hardware, black silicone wristbands, and mobile app codes.  Frequently Asked QuestionsHow do I set the Alarm?Via Bluetooth and the included iOS/Android App. Will the alarm still go off if Shock Clock 2 disconnects from my phone in the middle of the night?Yes the alarm will still work because when you press "save alarm" in the app it actually saves the information to the Real Time Clock memory in the Shock Clock 2, meaning you don't have to keep your phone connected for the alarm to work. Likewise you'll be able to shut off the alarm without connecting to your phone in the morning – only connect when you need to change one of your alarms. What is the difference between the $145 Shock Clock that ships from Pavlok.com and the Shock Clock 2 that ships when the campaign ends?The hardware from Shock Clock, if purchased after April 2018 is the same. The main difference will be access to new features in the Shock Clock 2 app. If you buy a Shock Clock from Pavlok.com you will have the option to upgrade to Shock Clock 2 features within the campaign, or after the campaign ends for $29. To make sure we hit our goals and develop Shock Clock 2 we recommend supporting it here, in the Indiegogo campaign and not waiting until later.If you are excited and want to get your hands on the original Shock Clock to start waking up in the morning GUARANTEED, go to Pavlok.com and make your purchase and come back here to back the Shock Clock 2 software so you can access the upgrade when we go live. The feature that I want the most is a stretch goal. If you don't reach the goal, does that mean it will never get developed?Not necessarily, but it will definitely take us longer. We're hoping that this campaign will be super successful so that we can afford to hire the software engineering talent to develop all of these features quickly & have them work great. The more money we raise, the more features we can commit to by the delivery date in September. How Can I Choose to Be Woken up?The Shock Clock will wake you up with haptic feedback:  beep, vibration or zap. How uncomfortable is the zap?The electrical stimulus is carefully designed so that it is enough to be uncomfortable, but not so strong that it hurts (and nowhere near dangerous – the Shock Clock is CE/FCC certified and 65,000 Pavlok users have proven it is safe and effective). It's a lot like a static shock you get when you touch a doorknob after rubbing your feet on the carpet. What is the Battery Life?The battery life ranges from 7-10 days and charges through micro USB. What Devices are Compatible with the Shock Clock App?Apps support Android 4.3+ iOS 10+ Is There a Warranty?Yes, we offer a 6-month manufacturer’s warranty against defects. What is The Prospective Delivery Date for the Shock Clock?If you buy the 'Get Shock Clock 2 NOW' perk your Shock Clock will ship once the campaign ends. If you've selected any other package expected delivery is October 2018 Have any other questions? Feel free to reach out by posting a question in the public comments section, or by sending us an email at support@pavlok.com.

story:
The Casper Board is the only platform that promotes weight loss, heart health, and a mental boost when you sit and stand during the workday. It is a BALANCE BOARD with full range ankle mobility + FOOT REST with 360° rotation IN ONE DEVICE.

Burn More Calories While You Work

According to the Mayo Clinic, too much sitting increases the risk of obesity, cardiovascular disease, and cancer. However, studies have shown that "active sitting" can increase blood circulation, boost oxygen levels in the body, and burn 20% more calories. Casper Boards makes it easy to sit or stand actively throughout the day. 

 

 

Move During The Workday For A Healthy Heart 

Without movement, too much sitting increases the risk of cardiovascular disease, obesity and cancer. With the Casper Board, you can easily introduce movement into your day so you don't have to be sedentary and immobile. You can sit or stand and be moving.  

 

 

 

 

Unconscious Movement When Sitting Or Standing

Casper Boards promotes unconscious movement, offering a new and unique way to stay active while sitting down at your desk and burn calories. PLUS in just a few seconds, you can attach our patent-pending module to switch your board from an active sitting device to an active standing device to work your core. 

 

A Compact Fidget Toy For Your Feet

Ah…so familiar. The restless feeling that gets us roaming the office for a cup of coffee at 2pm. The Casper Board is a fidget toy for your moving feet. Movement increases oxygen levels which has been shown to improve cognitive function - Find focus naturally while you pivot, twist, and move the board up to 360 degrees in any direction.

 

Durable & Easy to Use

The wood platform was inspired by a skateboard. It's designed it to be stylish, functional and sturdy, and it's made from the highest quality of wood to ensure it can withstand anything. Components are easy to switch out and lock into place, making it the perfect companion to standing desks that lift and lower at the press of a button. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Testimonials


 

 

We’re a team of skateboarding, Crossfit, and wellness enthusiasts who have come together to create an active workplace device that lets us keep moving throughout the day. As leaders in our respective fields, we want to maximize our focus and attention while we’re at work AND enjoy better health outcomes so we can spend more time enjoying the outdoors and fitness activities we love when we’re off the clock. 

If you would like to reach us or have any questions, email us at info@casperboards.com. 

For media inquiries, contact elizabeth@casperboards.com.

 

Inspired by Skateboarding, Bringing Freedom and Fun to Work Every Day

The evolution of the Casper Board...

My love of skateboarding inspired the concept behind the Casper Board. I used to ride my skateboard to work and use it as a movable footrest under my desk. It wasn’t the perfect solution, but I loved how it gave me a sense of motion throughout the day. Soon, I got an adjustable standing desk. I loved it, but found myself in a similar position. I was feeling even more stiff and restless as I stood still all day. That's when I wondered why there wasn’t a device that could help people whether they were sitting or standing.

I decided to take a stab at solving the problem. A week later, I had designed and built a rough prototype of the original Casper Board. It was a skateboard with plastic balls zip-tied to the bottom and I liked how it let me move my feet in any direction. For the next few weeks, I focused on testing and improving the design. I made my own custom board out of maple in the perfect shape and size. Then I designed a base that could convert from a movable footrest to a standing balance board. I worked with a friend who helped me design and 3D print the components. I started taking the new and improved Casper Board to work to test it out, and soon all my co-workers wanted one!

 

Outsite Partnership

We're thrilled to announce that we have teamed up with Outsite an incredible network of co-working/co-living spaces around the world, to promote active working, no matter what your working style might be. Look out for our boards coming to their Venice Beach locations soon!

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We know the importance and value of a solid durable product. That’s why we’ve been working with supply chain experts and creating relationships with manufacturers that will allow us to move quickly post-campaign. We have done our homework and believe we have the best production team possible.

We are confident we will meet our planned schedule, but there are risks that may be out of our control. If there are any delays, we promise to communicate with our backers right away. 

After the campaign, we will share the steps of our journey towards manufacturing, packaging, and shipping, allowing each backer to stay in the loop and know where we are at in our timeline. Our goal is to make Casper Boards the new standard device for active movement in the workplace.

story:
Our Story

Active Minds at Saint Joseph's University has been recognized as a student run organization as of November 3rd, 2011 and as a chapter of the National Active Minds organization in late November, 2011. The organization was founded in 2001 by Alison Malmon, then a junior at UPENN, following the suicide of her older brother, Brian, one year earlier.  Brian, also a college student, had been experiencing depression and psychosis for three years but had concealed his symptoms from others around him.  In the middle of his senior year, he returned to his hometown in Maryland and began receiving treatment for schizoaffective disorder.  A year and a half later, as Alison was wrapping up her freshman year at Penn, Brian ended his life.  Alison became motivated to change the culture of mental health issues on campus and wanted to combat the stigma of mental illness, encourage students who needed help to seek it early, and prevent future tragedies like the one that took her brother's life.

 

This is the only organization working to utilize the student voice to change the conversation about mental health on college campuses.  Through campus-wide events and national programs, Active Minds aims to remove the stigma that surrounds mental health issues and create a comfortable environment for an open conversation about mental health issues on campuses throughout North America.

 

Specifically this year Saint Joseph's is hosting the very powerful Send Silence Packing exhibit, during which we will display 1,100 donated backpacks representing the 1,100 college students whose lives are lost each year to suicide.  The backpacks were donated in honor of loved ones.  Many of them are accompanied by personal stories to help put a "face" to the lives lost to suicide.  This program is an interactive, day-long exhibit that opens minds, raises awareness and educates the public about the harsh realities of suicide.  

 

In addition to our event, our guest speaker, Jordan Burnham will share his personal story of a suicide attempt during his senior year of high school and his miraculous survival in order to educate students about depression, suicide, and coping mechanisms for young adults.  He was honored as one of the "2010 Best of Philly" for his work with mental health and speaking, and has been telling his story and inspiring others to speak out about mental health throughout the country for over two years.

 

The Impact:

In the words of participants:

"The display showed me that even though people have issues and problems they might not understand that there is always someone who you can talk to about your issues and they will help you get through them and become stronger."


Send Silence Packing starts a Dialogue and encourages help seeking:

"83% of participants talked to others about the display after seeing it.  The majority of participants talked to three or more friends, family members or others about the program."

"Over half the participants said the display increased their interest in learning more about mental health."

"One third of participants said the display encouraged them to reach out to a friend."


 

What We Need & What You Get

Each display for the Send Silence Packing Event costs about $5,000 in order to pay for renting, transporting, and storing of the backpacks and the truck, the program materials, the program staff and travel accommodations and project management. We welcome all and any donations.  There is a sense of urgency to accelerate our impact.  Every day we don't, three more students die by suicide, and more will drop out of college from their depression.  The highest numbers will not seek treatment, which according to evidenced based research, is the gateway to mental health.  Please help us meet our goal amount and beyond to be able to successfully pull off this event and continue to raise awareness. Your contribution is tax deductible.

story:
It’s no secret that smoking is a huge health epidemic. Chances are that you or someone you know has been affected by nicotine addiction. While smoking rates are dropping in most countries, there are still huge numbers of people with serious addictions, unable to quit on their own.

Technology has the capacity to aid in this process of helping smokers quit. As the mobile phone becomes a more intimate part of our everyday life, it presents opportunities to assist in providing support when smokers need it most. 

Spyre aims to be a persistent source of support to those going through the quitting process. It is a mobile application that provides contextual support and meaningful, data-driven feedback loops to help smokers better understand their cravings and how to avoid relapse.

Spyre is built on the following principles and insights:

  • contextual design: smokers need support at the moment of craving, timing is everything
  • behavioral/persuasive design: studies on how technology can influence behavior
  • peer-reviewed smoking cessation research
  • cognitive psychology

There are some other apps that aim to help smokers, but none of them account for context and time of craving. Spyre wants to tackle this problem by being there when needed, and disappearing when not. 

Spyre was designed by Surrounding Signifiers, a product development and UX consultancy based in NYC and run by Thomas Wendt--a man whose love/hate relationship with nicotine lasted over a decade.

What We've Done and Where We Want to Go

We have been spending the last couple months doing research, customer development, and designing the application. We’re now ready to begin the development phase. Your contribution will go to hiring a developer for the first iteration of the product. We plan on using this first round to test with users and gain more insight into their needs. 

The Impact

The potential impact of this project is twofold: 

  • We want to use the power of mobile technology to battle a serious, worldwide problem. 
  • We also want to advance the process of contextual design, as it has the potential to help with many common problems individuals face in their day to day lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not in a position to contribute, please spread the word to friends and loved ones who want to quit smoking. You can direct them to the Spyre website where they can sign up for updates.

story:
I am very pleased to announce that I will be going on the next Healer2Healer trip to the Paititi Institute in the Amazon rain forest of Peru. Healer2Healer is a non - profit group founded by Frederic Lim whose purpose is to -
1) Provide free Chinese medicine, acupuncture and Reiki services to indigenous populations worldwide.
2) Learn about indigenous spiritual, healing and ceremonial traditions from their wisdom keepers.
3) Give students of Chinese Medicine, acupuncture and Reiki an opportunity to learn from indigenous wisdom keepers and assist in free clinics.
We will be spending our first week at Paititi Institute learning about the Amazon and Incan medicine traditions, participating in ancient medicine ceremonies and visiting a tribe in the rain forest. In the second week, we will be providing 5 days of free services at a local clinic which serves 2500 - 4000 patients a week.
This will be my 3rd trip with H2H. I am one of the founding members and our clinic format was inspired by the Third Root free acupuncture / Reiki clinics for recovery from addictions in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn, which was created by Peter Panken LAc and of which I am the Reiki team leader. In the Third Root clinic we give the patients community style acupuncture and the N.A.D.A detox protocol ear acupuncture, then after the needles are placed, the patients are given Reiki by one of the many Reiki practitioners who volunteer. This format has been successfully adapted and employed in the many free clinics H2H has provided on 4 separate missions to Guatemala so far in which we have given free treatment to over 1000 patients in various locations including the communities around Lake Atitlan, Antigua, Quiche, and EL Remate. We have also provided training in Reiki and Chinese medicine techniques to the women of the Q'anil Women's Center in Quiche, Guatemala.
Our goal of connecting with the indigenous wisdom keepers has been met far beyond our expectations. We have participated in traditional Mayan ceremonies and learned much from the elders on every trip, including attending the 7 days of the annual Unification Maya Winter Solstice ceremonies at sacred sites in the ancient temple / pyramid complex of Tikal.
The people of Guatemala have welcomed us warmly on every trip and we have received honored visitor certificates from the Mayors of Antigua and Guatemala City.
The 2 trips I have participated in so far have been incredibly rewarding and enriching experiences for me and I look forward to the upcoming trip to Peru with great anticipation and excitement!
Healer2Healer is a young organization and we have not yet cultivated corporate or private funding streams, therefore all costs of the trips are borne by the individual members. I am inviting you to help me with my expenses by gifting me with a donation. Your donation will not only help me give healing assistance to 100's of under - served indigenous people, but will enable me to bring home the teachings and spirit gifts received at Paititi and share them with my community!
Love & Gratitude,
Geordie Numata
ICRT Certified Reiki & Karuna Reiki Master Teacher
VortexHealing Practitioner
Counseling Astrologer
NADA Certified Acupuncture Detox Specialist
deerspiritreiki.com
healer2healer.org
Facebook

story:
My Story

My name is Sue and I began my weight loss journey in June 2008. After a car accident in 2001, I began gaining weight quickly. In 2008, I decided enough was enough and jumped in with both feet to start getting rid of my extra baggage. 3 years have passed and I have lost over 100 lbs! I have dedicated myself to this lifestyle change and I will NEVER go back to where I was. 


The only thing holding me back from reaching my goal is the large amount of extra skin left on my abdomen. This skin keeps me from being able to run and exercise freely and is extremely uncomfortable.. Clothes that I have worked so hard to fit into, don't fit right because of it. No amount of diet or exercise will free me of this "scar". After speaking with numerous plastic surgeons, my only option is to have it removed surgically, but the cost, ofcourse, is not covered by insurance. 



So that is why I am here. Asking that you help me raise the money needed so I can have this surgery. So I can reach my goal of running a half marathon! To fit into a beautiful wedding dress, to feel comfortable in my new healthy body that I continue to work so hard to get and keep.


I realize that although this may not be necessary to everyone, it is extremely important to my quality of life.


                           Before 6/2008



                     After 4/2011


                

The Impact

Having this surgery will make me feel that all the hard work and effort I have and continue to put in has actually paid off. Without having this surgery, I will always see myself as and feel like an obese person. I  would be forever in debt to everyone that contributes because this surgery will free me of my old body finally and allow me to get fit to my full potential.


What We Need & What You Get

I need $7,500 to pay for this surgery. The full cost is $12,000 and I have been able to get together $4,500 on my own. If I do not raise the full $7.500 I will still have the surgery but, it will not be for a very long time and will delay  my plans of getting married and moving out.

 

For every donation, there are perks! You can choose one or none, but they are to show my gratitude for supporting me!

 

 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to anyone and everyone who can help! Every donation makes a difference, even $5! And please share my story and page with others!
story_txt:
My Story
My name is Sue and I began my weight loss journey in June 2008. After a car accident in 2001, I began gaining weight quickly. In 2008, I decided enough was enough and jumped in with both feet to start getting rid of my extra baggage. 3 years have passed and I have lost over 100 lbs! I have dedicated myself to this lifestyle change and I will NEVER go back to where I was. 

The only thing holding me back from reaching my goal is the large amount of extra skin left on my abdomen. This skin keeps me from being able to run and exercise freely and is extremely uncomfortable.. Clothes that I have worked so hard to fit into, don't fit right because of it. No amount of diet or exercise will free me of this "scar". After speaking with numerous plastic surgeons, my only option is to have it removed surgically, but the cost, ofcourse, is not covered by insurance. 


So that is why I am here. Asking that you help me raise the money needed so I can have this surgery. So I can reach my goal of running a half marathon! To fit into a beautiful wedding dress, to feel comfortable in my new healthy body that I continue to work so hard to get and keep. 

I realize that although this may not be necessary to everyone, it is extremely important to my quality of life. 

                           Before 6/2008




                     After 4/2011

                 The Impact
Having this surgery will make me feel that all the hard work and effort I have and continue to put in has actually paid off. Without having this surgery, I will always see myself as and feel like an obese person. I  would be forever in debt to everyone that contributes because this surgery will free me of my old body finally and allow me to get fit to my full potential. 



What We Need & What You Get
I need $7,500 to pay for this surgery. The full cost is $12,000 and I have been able to get together $4,500 on my own. If I do not raise the full $7.500 I will still have the surgery but, it will not be for a very long time and will delay  my plans of getting married and moving out.
 
For every donation, there are perks! You can choose one or none, but they are to show my gratitude for supporting me!
  


Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word to anyone and everyone who can help! Every donation makes a difference, even $5! And please share my story and page with others!

story:
Short Summary

Founded in 2007, Brooklyn Rugby Club is a community organization that is committed to the growth of rugby union in New York City’s most populous borough.

As you can imagine New York is an extremely expensive and difficult city to establish a sporting club. As a young organization that is fully self-funded with very little sponsorship or alumni, we struggle to keep afloat.

We are a highly successful club, consisting of Men’s and Women’s 15s and 7s teams. The Men finished 4th of 11 teams in D3 and our Women’s team made the D2 playoffs. Last summer, our Men’s 7s came 3rd of 15 teams in the tri-state area, and our Women’s 7s won the Princeton 7s Cup. 

We are reaching out for funding because we need some essential training equipment plus help to subsidize our administration and running costs. 

This includes tournament and league entry fees, field hire, purchasing equipment (balls, tackle bags, cones, medical kits etc), transportation, player registration, coaching, creating marketing and sponsorship materials for the club. 

Fundraising Milestones

To help people understand the types of things we are looking for financial help with, we have created the following milestones for this fundraising campaign. 

Milestone 1: $3,000
Home Jerseys
A new set of home jerseys for Brooklyn Rugby Men and Women 15-a-side teams. The ones we have are very outdated and are becoming increasingly unfit for purpose. We need new ones!

Milestone 2: $5,000
Home and 7s Jerseys
Brooklyn Rugby has men and women's 7s sides and this venture is creating a lot of successes for the club, not just in actual tournament wins but also in generating publicity and driving player recruitment. We feel strongly that Brooklyn Rugby 7s should have its own unique identity, on a par with the more fun aspect of 7s rugby. Reaching this goal will allow us to pay for a unique set of 7s jerseys for our men and women's teams.

Milestone 3: $8,000
Home, 7s and Away Jerseys
A new set of away jerseys for Brooklyn Rugby Men and Women's 15-a-side teams. The men's away jerseys are in even worse shape than the home ones, and our women's side don't even have them. Reaching this goal will help us fix the jersey problem for our 15-a-side teams.

Milestone 4: $12,000
All of the above + a new scrum sled!
As the old saying goes "forwards win the game, backs decide by how much". Well, to prove this, our forwards need this very essential piece of kit for scrum training. A scrum sled is one of the most basic - but expensive - pieces of equipment for a club yet we still don't have one. 

Milestone 5: $20,000

All of the above + portable floodlighting and a generator
Getting permits for a field to practice rugby in New York City is incredibly tough. Rugby is a sport that is very low on the priority list for the Department of Parks & Recreation. So, we train where we can, literally on dirt and rock covered soccer pitches in the dark and - when we're lucky - the grassy outfields of a baseball field. Needless to say, practicing rugby in the dark can prove incredibly frustrating and unproductive. We need portable floodlights and a generator to help this situation.

What You Get (Rewards)

To reward you and your generosity, we have put together a list of Brooklyn Rugby swag that we are looking to give back as a thanks for your donations. Check out the "Perks" to see what your donation gets you, but the full list of available items is:

  • Brooklyn Rugby Jerseys: Your very own Brooklyn Rugby jersey, with a number of your choosing! Which designs become available depends on the milestones we hit i.e. if we just $3,000, we can only offer home jerseys. If we hit the other milestones, more designs will become available. Designs will be published soon.
  • Rugby Fitness Bootcamp: A fitness class that uses strength and cardio conditioning exercises used by rugby players the world over for a great workout. LIMITED AVAILABILITY!
  • Brooklyn Rugby Social Membership: With a Brooklyn Rugby social membership, you get all the perks of being a player without having to bother with all that pesky rugby stuff. Eat and drink at our match-day drink ups for free plus entry to all our other social events for a calendar year!
  • Limited Edition "Backers" t-shirts: See your name in cotton! A specially designed t-shirt with the Brooklyn Rugby Crest and a list of our generous donors on the reverse. Designs will be published soon.
  • "Men of Brooklyn Rugby" 2015 Calendar: After the great success of last year, the Men of Brooklyn Rugby Calendar is BACK. Count down the days with shots of your favorite rugby team, topless, against a backdrop of the borough they represent. We are also offering SIGNED editions of the calendar.
  • Brooklyn Rugby Bumper Stickers: A 3" x 9" Brooklyn Rugby Bumper sticker - much better than any political message!
  • Brooklyn Rugby Christmas Card: A Christmas card to you (or a friend), from the Brooklyn Rugby Club, signed by selected players and staff.
  • Digital goodies: Specially created wallpapers for your laptop, smartphone and tablet, plus thank you shout outs on our website and social media channels.

+ this very special reward for businesses:

  • Calendar Sponsorship: Have a business or service to promote? Get a spot in the Men of Brooklyn Rugby 2015 calendar, sure to be hung up on walls across the city and beyond. You'll also receive a window sticker for your business and regular promotion on brooklynrugby.com and our social media channels (an audience of thousands). LIMITED AVAILABILITY!

The Impact

Your generous donations will have an immediate impact on Brooklyn Rugby Club in helping us with very important running costs in relation to essential equipment in kit. However, our ultimate vision for the club is to start a youth team for the Borough and have multiple teams in different divisions for both Men and Women representing Brooklyn. Having these funds will put Brooklyn Rugby in good enough shape so that we can start working towards these loftier goals and grow Brooklyn Rugby to the same stature as our more established rivals.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please show your support by following us on social media and sharing this campaign with your friends and family

    www.facebook.com/brooklynrugby

    www.twitter.com/brooklynrugby

    www.brooklynrugby.com

    Corporate Sponsorship

    For corporate sponsorship opportunities, please contact Simon Fong: sfong@brooklynrugby.com


    Jersey Designs

    The Canterbury Everest Jersey was introduced for the Rugby World Cup in 2007 helping South Africa power to victory. The international design incorporates fabric to offer a tight fitting jersey that moves and flexes with the body. A comfortable yet high performance jersey, designed to be worn tight to the body.

    Men's Home / Women's Away


    Men's 7s


    Women's 7s

    Men's Away / Women's Home

    Please note: The above designs are preliminary and are subject to review.

story:
After playing college and professional basketball, I found my passion as a coach. For the last 4 years, I have been blessed to train and work with thousands of young men and women. 

Murrer22 is more than just basketball. We get to wake up everyday and make a difference in the lives of young people. Drive, Discipline, and Team Work are just a few of the things we instill in our players. 

Murrer22 wants to create a safer, more inspiring space for our athletes to continue to thrive. With your help, we believe we can easily accomplish our goal- We hope you are as excited about the future as we are!!


PRICE BREAKDOWN: 

2 Baskets: Spalding A8s Portable Backstop,  $12,099

http://www.basketballproductsinternational.com/portable-backstops-and-parts/main-court/spalding-a8s-and-a10s-portable-backstops/details.php

1 Floor: MVP Robbins College, NBA Full Court with 3 FT Boundary @ $14.00/sqft 

                                      100ftx56ft = 5600 sqft = $78,400

                              http://www.robbinsfloor.com/2012/04/mvp/

story: Hi, I'm Elena. I am seventeen years old and want to make a significant change in my community: our health. I am starting my own, non-profit summer camp called Camp Cauliflower. For a week, elementary school children will be able to exercise their culinary skills by working in a large-scale kitchen, learn about the importance of a balanced diet and nutrition, cook a delicious lunch every day, and engage in many more activities surrounding health. I am working with the director of NUSD’s Food and Nutrition Services program, Miguel Villarreal, to promote my camp. As this camp is free, I will be receiving food donations from local grocery stores, hosting a fundraiser, and utilizing the FANS program’s appliance kits and kitchens. My initial idea for this camp could not have been possible without the amazing team of support I am receiving right now.

story:
How often do you sleep while traveling?


When we sleep while traveling, we lean against the window, rest our head on the table, or use a special pillow. But this doesn’t help neither does it protect our neck or preserve our hairdo.

What is Sleeper?


We have invented a sleep mask called Sleeper. It is designed to make you sleep comfortably on a flight, train or bus. The sleep mask holds your head steadily on the seat, enabling you to enjoy a comfortable sleep while on a long haul flight.

Using Sleeper is as easy as ABC:


Sleeper would help you sleep comfortably in a sitting position. The sleep mask would give you a nice rest and increase your productivity after a long flight or crossing a highway. It’s small in size and costs just $7.

With Sleeper, you can sleep comfortably the whole night on the plane, train or bus. It doesn’t take up much space in your luggage.

Benefits of sleeping while traveling


Even a 20-minute nap increases productivity by over 30%. And what of long journeys, when you spend 3 or even 9 hours on a plane, train or bus? After the journey, you sometimes don’t have enough energy and enthusiasm to go for sightseeing, and rather prefer to just go and catch a sleep. But Sleeper would help you recover yourself after a long flight. If you sleep well on the plane, you will have more time to enjoy your holiday at once, receive new experiences and emotions.

How does it work?


Sleeper will confortably hold your head on a headrest. You need a backrest of 35 inches (90 cm) or higher, or a special chair with a headrest. And don't forget to fasten your seat belt to double your safety.


Specification:

Sleeper's strap is 1.5 meters long. With such length, you will be able to wrap the Sleeper on any chair. The sleep mask 10.6’’ x 4.3'' (270 x 110 mm) is made of hypoallergenic material, suitable for a sensitive skin. Sleeper is very easy to use.


The inner part of Sleeper is made of fleece, which is known to have the following properties:



Testimonials:



Who are we?


We are a young and cohesive team with solid experience in various types of projects. Some of us were once owners of design studios, some were PR directors for international music festivals, etc.



Sleeper Timeline


Why Indiegogo?


The Indiegogo audience is made up of active people who love to travel. These people will surely enjoy the benefits from Sleeper. Our aim is to launch mass production, but without help from the Indiegogo community, we won't be able to achieve this goal.

Developing the project using Indiegogo, we can estimate our requirements, build stronger relations with our early followers and use customer feedback to make our product as convenient and comfortable as possible.


Risks and challenges


Our commitments towards participants: 

- We will always inform our participants about the progress we have made

- We will be transparent wjen it comes to our achievements, unexpected problems and how we plan to solve them.

Prototype: Our conceptual model is based on safe technologies and standards; so we know that the model will surely work, but our challenge is to make sure it gives you comfort when sleeping in a sitting position!

Proven efficiency: the inner part of Sleeper is made with a soft fabric; the material doesn't cause allergies and is pleasant to the skin. We received positive feedback from customers surveys. Please, support us and then just sit back, use Sleeper and enjoy every second of the features of this remarkable product! THANK YOU!


Notice: for safety reasons, Sleeper should be used only with fastened seat belt!


FAQs


Q: How do I use Sleeper?


A: - Buckle the fastener on the strap

- Tie the strap on the backrest of the seat

- Tighten to match the diameter of your head

- Pull the mask on the eye or forehead

- Tighten the strap until it fully fixes the head to the chair

Or just watch the video with detailed instructions on how to use Sleeper.


Q: Does the mask press the eyes?


A: If the Sleeper is fixed firmly for a long time, the mask can put pressure on the eyes. However, in this case, you can move the mask to the forehead or just above the eyes.


Q: How safe is it for children?

A: When sleeper is used together with a seat belt, your child will be well protected against hazardous events. When sleeping with Sleeper, the child feels much more comfortable, he is protected against backbone and neck deformations, and sleeps a lot longer. Our experiments also revealed that the child falls asleep much faster if he wears sleeper before sleeping. To prevent the child from being frightened when he wakes up, it is recommended to wear the Sleeper on his forehead, just above the eyes.


Q:  What material is Sleeper made of?


A: Sleeper mask is sewn from two fabrics: the inner part is made of fleece (detailed information about the properties of fleece can be found above); the outer part is made of tarp.

The Sleeper strap is made of belting. That is why it holds firmly on any chair, be it fabric, plastic, or leather, and does not slide off during sleep.


Q:  Can it be washed?


A: Sleeper can be washed in a washing machine at a temperature no higher than 30 degrees Celsius (86 degrees Fahrenheit). It dries quickly and does not lose its external features.


Q:  How many hours continuously can one sleep comfortably with Sleeper in a sitting position?


A:From 4 to 7 hours.


Sleeper's Press-Kit


More info, tons of pics and videos are available here

Sleeper's Press-Kit

More info, tons of pics and videos are available here

story:
Greetings all,

On Friday, February 5, 2016 at 6pm, a tremendous light went out. Our beloved, Joanette Quinn, friend,  dedicated pillar in the community, sister, and activist passed away in the hospital surrounded by family and friends due to health challenges.

  As you can imagine, our worlds have sadly stopped. As we try to piece our lives back together, I kindly ask that you donate to this wonderful family in this time of tragedy as she did not have insurance. 

As a few of you may know, she lost 4 family members prior to her own demise.   This left her family with a heavy financial burden and very little resources to continue on.

In order to show support for Joanette's family, we have set up this page. The funds will help cover funeral expenses and other basic needs to help the family get through this very difficult time.

Thank you to all for your love and support of Joanette Quinn and her loved ones.

story:
About this project

The BuildingBlock is a simply designed exercise product focused on allowing any individual to maximize their workout in a short period of time. By consolidating multiple products in one, the BuildingBlock is designed to deliver the most efficient workout from basic rehab to fat loss and athletic performance. The simple design results in a product that anyone can use, no matter your current level of fitness or goals.

See our website for more exercise demos and and complete workouts, here are just a few exercises you can do with the BuildingBlock:

  Basic Block

     BuildingBlock Step-up

    BuildingBlock Squats - Block Squats 

   BuildingBlock Jump

   Integrated Handles

     BuildingBlock Pushups

     BuildingBlock Burpee

   Attachments

    The Stability Pole

    BuildingBlock Core - Leg Raise with Reverse Crunch

    The Elastic Band

     The Harness

You can use the BuildingBlock for any type of workout... 

  from yoga

    to athletic Performance

Specs: 12" x 16" x 20" (25lbs, able to add up to 500 lbs)

 *Patent Pending

The BuildingBlock combines over $1,000 of products into 1 compact unit (plyometrics block, pushup handles, push sled, pull sled, stability platform, farmer carry sandbag, elastic bands, etc). No one piece of equipment can deliver what the BuildingBlock is designed for. With hundreds of different exercises already created, the simple design allows for any user to achieve their goals. Our clients range from great-grandparents focused on increasing their mobility to athletes and everyday home users looking to get fit.

Risks and challenges

Final engineering with FEA testing is complete, and we have selected all of our manufacturing partners - all we need now is the funding to purchase the plastic mold to begin our rotomold production. The videos here were taken with our prototype BuildingBlock so the final product will look slightly different. There are possibilities of delays with any project however, we have sourced the best partners to ensure the production begins on time. All of our manufacturers are local and we guarantee the BuildingBlock is 100% made in America.

We will provide constant updates as our progress continues.

*Disclaimer: BuildingBlock recommends consulting a physician before using or performing any exercises or exercise programs displayed or recommended on this website. Use at your own risk. It is your responsibility to evaluate your own medical and physical condition, or that of your clients, and to independently determine proper use. This page is for informational purposes only, any exercise may result in injury. By voluntarily undertaking any exercise displayed on this web site or by use or misuse of the BuildingBlock, you assume the risk of injury and specifically disclaim BuildingBlock Fitness Co. for liability and damages inherent to the product and any related physical activity.
