story:
The problem is real

The average human sleeps about 200,000 hours during his or her lifetime – over 22 years in total. This is too much for sleep to be taken lightly!

Let's not leave 1/3 of our lives unattended and unprotected.

The solution is radical

This is why we’ve created the Slumberjack’s toolbox. It consists of an sleeping mask (or a face blanket if you will) that uses the ancient powers of wild animals to supercharge your dreams. And. A dream journal to keep track of your adventures in the night-o-sphere.

We are a team of four creatives and meticulous snoozers with over 100 years of combined sleeping experience. Our mission is simple. To delight and amuse the chronically sleepy and help them reclaim the missing 22 years of their lives.

Your support is crucial

Up until now, we've been saving dreams one at a time. We need your help to bring sleep and delight to every part of the known habitable universe – starting with Earth.

The goal

We are looking for $30,000 to make the production powerful enough to help sleepers on a global scale.  So far we’ve been able to produce the sleeping masks with only a small army of lovely ladies but there’s only so much animal-magic that can flow through their hands.

The perky perks

Our supporters will be the first ones to get their hands on the Slumberjack’s toolbox.

But there are plans to cover more and more aspects of sleep. We have a surprise for the early birds – ability granting socks. If you’ve ever struggled with monsters under your bed, lack of daydreaming prowess or reaching a desired level of depth in your sleeping, these socks will try their best to overcome these issues.

Why now?

The problem of sleep deprivation has actually reached epidemic levels. It’s estimated that around 50% of the population is sleep deprived according to Nature Magazine. Multitude of studies have proven links between the lack of sleep and various health issues – including heart disease, depression and obesity.

How does it help?

We believe that when tackling the issue of sleep, you cannot only address the functional side. Our sleeping products aim to please and delight humans. To highlight the emotional side in something already as soft and cuddly as your dreams.

We feel that sleeping ought to be more of an active part of one's life. We achieve this through creating emotionally captivating, relatable and lovable sleeping paraphernalia. If you love your sleeping masks, it will remind you of your love of sleep.

Please, support us, if you’re serious about sleeping.

If you can’t contribute, you can still support us by sharing the word, liking us on Facebook and talking about it by the water-cooler, or in your sleep to your significant other.

If you are among the lucky few who already has their own animal powered face blanket, take it out for a walk, wear it as an accessory to raise awareness about sleeping.

If you read though the whole page, you have just earned a nap! Congrats!

story:
Greetings my name is Guillermo and I'm here to present you the story of Maria Antonia, my aunt who's currently suffering from kidney failure.

 

 Over the past year despite the different treatments and hopes of recovery, her situation has really taken a turn for the worst with her disease to a current point, where she can barely do her daily activities without some odd symptom affecting her. You might not notice it at first, but when you look closely, even her facial expression shows the decay of the disease, and now she is fast approaching a hospital deadline.

 

The said deadline for sometime in December states that she needs to be treated and given a transplant. Otherwise she crosses a point in her disease in which transplant is impossible and she'll be forced to spend the rest of her life in dialysis.

 

The problem is not only a donor, but also her financial situation. And now that there are no more options, she desperately needs a stipend to not only cover monthly costs while she's incapacitated after surgery, but also to cover part of the operation itself, as her insurance won't pay the whole procedure. Any and all help will be forever appreciated. Thank you for your time. God bless.

story:
Update, Oct 2, 2013

We're all chipping in where we can and http://podcastingforcancer.org/ is coming along nicely. Trevor and Josh recently stepped in on the vSoup podcast to talk a little bit about where the SMB lives in the IT world and naturally, about vPodcasting & Podcasting for Cancer. Give it a listen!

New Perk! ($1000)

vSoup has also kindly offered a few perks of their own. At the $1000 level, you can convince them to talk about anything. Anything! Best hairstyle in IT, favorite flavor of bacon salt, anything your imagination can summon. We do ask that you keep it clean, but if you really want them to talk about adult entertainment websites or their favorite local burlesque establishments who are we to stop you?

Another New Perk! ($1500)

The vSoup crew has also offered up a 125x125 banner on vSoup.net for 6 months. Advertise your product to the entire vSoup audience! 

Update, Sept 24, 2013

We have almost reached $10,000 just passed $10,000 (mind=blown) with a total of 5 companies contributing $1000 to the cause so far.  There are 61 64 total funders as of the $10,000 mark, and every one of you is awesome!  We are adding a new perk level in the hopes of not merely breaking the $10,000 mark, but pushing past $15,000 in the 49 days that remain.  

New Perk! ($500)

We have had several offers of time and assistance from numerous prominent vBloggers.  As such, we have stood up http://podcastingforcancer.org/. Anyone donating $500 will get to pick a topic and have a blog written by a vBlogger.  This will be posted on the Podcasting For Cancer website and can also be posted on the desired website of the donor.  These are the best and brightest in our industry, why not have them write for you?

Update, Sept 20, 2013
Sadly, Gabe's mum passed away last night.  Our condolences to the entire Chapman family in this difficult time.

Thank you to all who have donated - and all those who will donate - for helping to make this difficult time for our friend that little bit less horrible.

Update, Sept 17, 2013

Ladies, Gentlemen and Kerbals everywhere, we have surpassed our $5000 goal.  This is truly amazing - I can't believe we did that in under 3 days! - but this isn't over yet.  We're going to see just how far we can take this!  We are going to be adding new perks over the next few days as more and more vPeeps volunteer their time and resources to keep this project moving forward!

New Perk! ($5000)

Two of the true powerhouses of our industry - Scott Lowe and David Davis - have generously donated a 125x125 advertisement slot for 1 year on virtualizationsoftware.com.  What better way to advertise the podcast and webex you get at the $1000 level?

New Perk! ($2500)
The $5000 perk offer was followed very shortly thereafter by Luigi Danakos offering up a similar avertising slot on nerblurt.com.  Nerblurt is a rather popular blog within the VMware community and well respected.  Thank you to Luigi for giving donors yet another way to help Podcasting for Cancer!

Podcasting for Cancer

One of the more prominent (and well-loved) members of the VMware community, Gabriel Chapman (@Bacon_Is_King), recently tweeted "Just a year after losing Dad to cancer, Mom's has now spread from lung to other areas. Too soon for this shit."

It's always too soon for cancer, sir.

After this unfortunate tweet an idea was bounced around the vBlogging community: vExperts and vBloggers will get together with vBrownbag and VMUG folks to put on a series of top-notch podcasts on relevant upcoming technologies that affect the virtualisation industry.  We would stand up a fundraising site with the proceeds going towards a cancer donation in the Chapman family name. 

The response to this idea has been overwhelmingly positive.

Several virtualisation experts have committed to crafting top notch content for this event.  What we need is you!  Toss some money in the kitty and let's make a collective dent in this whole cancer thing.  The VMware community has proven that when we put our minds to it, we can do anything.

Let's do this.

eGeek Consulting will be donating the time and resources to do the production and hosting of the podcasts.  The VMware community is already stepping forward with experts ready to man the microphones.  So please join us in Podcasting for Cancer.

The details:

Donors will get advanced access to the podcasts, which will be recorded in November and December.  This gives us time to get things funded, for topics to be chosen and for the experts to have spun up and worked with the technologies in question.

Podcasts will be released to the community at large shortly after they are first released to donors.  We are aiming for a total of 8 podcasts, with up to four webexes, depending on how many $1000 donors we get.

Blog posts about Podcasting for Cancer 

Official Blog: http://podcastingforcancer.org/
On Spiceworks: http://community.spiceworks.com/topic/386636-podcasting-for-cancer

Gabriel Chapman
Jon Harris
Trevor Pott
Jonathan Frappier
Philip Sellers
Christian Mohn

Notes:

1) I typoed the vCancer Elite perk.  It *should* read "virtualization" where it currently reads "visualisation."

2) Steve Kaplan (@ROIdude) wanted to be able to pay by cheque.  As that isn't possible, I asked him to donated directly to the American Cancer Society Inc.  He is sending them $350 in the name of Podcasting for Cancer and the Chapman family.  As such, we are inventing a ninth podcasting slot for this fine sir and he gets to pick the topic.  So add $350 to the number you see on the "amount raised" bar!

story: ~ ~ ~

**UPDATE 3/6**  The $2800 goal we set was from the estimate provided by UCLA dental school before she actually had any work done.  Now that Willow has completed the deep cleaning, xrays  and fillings, she has been given a more detailed, accurate estimate, which brings us to $3300 for the actual goal.  So even though the goal shown here has been met, we are going to continue to raise funds until we hit $3300!  So keep sharing the link!  Let's do this!

 

Short Summary

My sister-in-law, Willow, was born with 32 teeth in her face.  They were bad, bad teeth.  She grew up hearing horror stories, like the battle of MomTeeth versus BabyRob, where BabyRob dealt a swift blow to MomFace and MomTeeth were killed on impact.  Willow tried to keep her teeth from going down the wrong roads in life.  She read them stories, she gave them uplifting peptalks, she even took them to Disneyland and convinced them that ToonTown was actually called ToothTown and was built solely for the enjoyment of her teeth.  One day, Willow's front tooth, Toothy, succumbed to the pressure.  He just couldn't handle being the only one out of 32 to look... different.  You see, he was cracked.  And finally, he snapped.  Like, in half.  Willow, being under employed, could not afford dental healthcare, so she called every friend, every government agency, and every televised motivational speaker she could find to get poor Toothy fixed, but alas, none could help her.  So she stopped smiling.  Immediately after she stopped smiling the world grew colder.  Winter Storm Nemo came and devastated the East coast.  The pope stepped down.  Seth McFarlane became unfunny at the Oscars.  Willow couldn't handle watching the world collapse, so she contacted the UCLA school of dentistry.  They evaluated her face and informed her that Toothy didn't snap suddenly, oh no, he was planning it.  He staged a revolt of epic proportions.  11 of her teeth had joined his monstrous plan and had to be pulled immediately, lest they release their evil upon the world and bring with it such dental abominations, not even the British could comprehend. 

It is important to note that Toothy and his fellow accomplices were born with their propensity for evil, they are not a result of drug use.

What We Need 

UCLA school of dentistry has offered to

  • do a 6 hour deep cleaning (taking place 2-26-13)
  • do a 6 hour filling marathon (taking place 2-27-13)
  • pull all 11 of the unsalvagable teeth (taking place mid-april)
  • replace them with partial dentures (date TBA once extraction sites heal)

But Willow needs to come up with $2800 out of pocket before the extractions take place in mid April.  

What You Get

With every $10 you donate, Willow will think pleasant thoughts about you

With every $100 you donate, Willow will draw you a picture of a happy tooth (she is an artist)

With every $200 you donate, Willow will name a tooth anything you want.  You want her front tooth to be named "Sharktopus the Angry Squid Avenger?!"  YOU GOT IT!

In addition to these things, you can rest easy knowing you are protecting the world from the horror that is an unsmiling Willow.  You would be a hero.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're saying to yourself, "SELF! You do not want to donate to this poor, sad, helpless Willow!  You work hard for your moneys, you must only exchange these moneys for things you want!" then head on over to Wrongathon, http://www.etsy.com/shop/Wrongathon Willow's Etsy shop and buy something from her!

If you're saying to yourself, "SELF!  You is poor!  You can't spare any moneys right now!" Then just do us a favor and promote this campaign.  Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Livejournal, or your AngelFire website full of super sweet blinkie graphics.  Do it for the Karma points!

**UPDATE 3/6**  The $2800 goal we set was from the estimate provided by UCLA dental school before she actually had any work done.  Now that Willow has completed the deep cleaning, xrays  and fillings, she has been given a more detailed, accurate estimate, which brings us to $3300 for the actual goal.  So even though the goal shown here has been met, we are going to continue to raise funds until we hit $3300!  So keep sharing the link!  Let's do this!
 
Short Summary
My sister-in-law, Willow, was born with 32 teeth in her face.  They were bad, bad teeth.  She grew up hearing horror stories, like the battle of MomTeeth versus BabyRob, where BabyRob dealt a swift blow to MomFace and MomTeeth were killed on impact.  Willow tried to keep her teeth from going down the wrong roads in life.  She read them stories, she gave them uplifting peptalks, she even took them to Disneyland and convinced them that ToonTown was actually called ToothTown and was built solely for the enjoyment of her teeth.  One day, Willow's front tooth, Toothy, succumbed to the pressure.  He just couldn't handle being the only one out of 32 to look... different.  You see, he was cracked.  And finally, he snapped.  Like, in half.  Willow, being under employed, could not afford dental healthcare, so she called every friend, every government agency, and every televised motivational speaker she could find to get poor Toothy fixed, but alas, none could help her.  So she stopped smiling.  Immediately after she stopped smiling the world grew colder.  Winter Storm Nemo came and devastated the East coast.  The pope stepped down.  Seth McFarlane became unfunny at the Oscars.  Willow couldn't handle watching the world collapse, so she contacted the UCLA school of dentistry.  They evaluated her face and informed her that Toothy didn't snap suddenly, oh no, he was planning it.  He staged a revolt of epic proportions.  11 of her teeth had joined his monstrous plan and had to be pulled immediately, lest they release their evil upon the world and bring with it such dental abominations, not even the British could comprehend. 
It is important to note that Toothy and his fellow accomplices were born with their propensity for evil, they are not a result of drug use.
What We Need 


UCLA school of dentistry has offered to

do a 6 hour deep cleaning (taking place 2-26-13)
do a 6 hour filling marathon (taking place 2-27-13)
pull all 11 of the unsalvagable teeth (taking place mid-april)
replace them with partial dentures (date TBA once extraction sites heal)

But Willow needs to come up with $2800 out of pocket before the extractions take place in mid April.  


What You Get
With every $10 you donate, Willow will think pleasant thoughts about you
With every $100 you donate, Willow will draw you a picture of a happy tooth (she is an artist)
With every $200 you donate, Willow will name a tooth anything you want.  You want her front tooth to be named "Sharktopus the Angry Squid Avenger?!"  YOU GOT IT!
In addition to these things, you can rest easy knowing you are protecting the world from the horror that is an unsmiling Willow.  You would be a hero.  


Other Ways You Can Help
If you're saying to yourself, "SELF! You do not want to donate to this poor, sad, helpless Willow!  You work hard for your moneys, you must only exchange these moneys for things you want!" then head on over to Wrongathon, http://www.etsy.com/shop/Wrongathon Willow's Etsy shop and buy something from her!
If you're saying to yourself, "SELF!  You is poor!  You can't spare any moneys right now!" Then just do us a favor and promote this campaign.  Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Livejournal, or your AngelFire website full of super sweet blinkie graphics.  Do it for the Karma points!

story:
Our workplace shouldn’t be killing us.

We’ve become sitting ducks in our chairs.



Become a Chuck that Chair advocate!

We’re spending more time glued to chairs in a sedentary lifestyle. Sitting for hours a day, even on expensive chairs and at well-designed workstations, contribute to problems that just keep getting worse year on year. Back and neck pain, frequent headaches, winding up with more serious health issues, namely obesity and the much publicized

Sitting Disease

Sitting is the ultimate passive activity. When we sit, the electrical activity in our muscles flatlines. Powering down our body like that for long periods of time leads to a cascade of negative effects - heart rate, calorie burn, insulin effectiveness, and levels of good cholesterol all drop. Molecules that play an important role in processing fats and sugars stop working, and without them, our metabolism suffers. It’s no wonder that those who sit for long periods of time each day have larger waistlines and worse blood sugar and blood pressure profiles, and are at higher risk of heart disease, diabetes, obesity, and cancer, than those who sit less.

Don’t think you’re off the hook because you get in some vigorous exercise each day … you’re not. Exercise does not counteract the negative effects of sitting. It’s like thinking you can snack on chips all day, and then offset that by running for an hour.

It's time to Take a Stand


Switching from chairs to upright workstations reduces obesity and improves circulation. Standing up for three hours will consume 144 calories.

“People are sitting down at work, then sitting in the car and then sitting down in front of the television. It isn’t natural. Humans are designed to stand up and keep moving.”  - John Buckley, the University of Chester.

In response to a study that warned that a sedentary lifestyle could be causing as many deaths as smoking, Dr. Buckley says that regular changes in the workplace can mean long-term improvements. “It’s little changes in behavior… such as standing at your desk that can add up to quite a big difference to your health.”

“OK, I know sitting down is killing me - but if I stand all day, that kills me too.”


Here's how you can help


Introducing the Next Big Idea

The remarkable STANZ workblade

The STANZ workblade posture-correct workstation is designed for all day comfort and energy, while providing a more productive alternative to prolonged sitting at work and at home. With this amazing upright station, you’re not standing all day, you’re ‘stanzing’- you won’t believe the stamina you develop. Stanz workblades reduce weight on the legs by 10% as they angle the body into a most relaxed and efficient upright position. You’ll be burning more calories before you know it and, by being more active, you just might lose extra weight. All you need is a pair of comfy shoes.

Stanz workblades are the intelligent, ergonomic way to get all your work done and feel refreshed at the end of the day. They make prolonged sitting and tiresome standing relics of the past. Besides, the workblade looks cool and futuristic. Raise your worktable or desk any way you like and slide in a STANZ. People will start looking up to you.


Workstations of the future

Ergostanz is innovation that promotes ideal human interaction to a given environment.

Drawing on human biology, psychology, engineering and design, Ergostanz patent-protected products optimize system performance through wellness of individuals.


Developing the workblade

Under the watchful eye of Voltaire, JC designed and tested the first prototype of the STANZ workstation over a 2-year period, constantly streamlining the design features.




Highlights of the workblade


The STANZ Highrise model is sturdy & lightweight, with a welded aluminum or steel frame, powder coated with choice of colors, strong vinyl adjustable backrest, ideally angled for all day comfort, and crafted by hand into a simple, elegant shape. STANZ products are built to last a lifetime and extend yours accordingly.

A new workstation for people who value their health.

The idea for the STANZ workblade came after JC realized how comfortable leaning against a sloping surface can be, and decided to build a workstation model. After 2 years of testing and designing, it became clear that no workstation arrangement combines the workblade’s unique comfort and productivity with wellness at work.  


"Every office and workplace should have a few workblades available as part of their worksafe / wellness program."


Fashion Meets Function

The workblade is simple to use – slide it into place and get to work. It takes up a small space while its classic / modern aesthetic blends easily into an office or home environment.

Stanz developer: JC Beauchamp


* University lecturer;

* Published author;

* Inventor;

* Wellness enthusiast.   I am dedicated to eliminating 'sitting disease' - prolonged and unnecessary sitting in the workplace - during my lifetime. And I need your support.


Special Thanks

Don Carmichael, Kinesiologist, for his enthusiasm and advice.

Leslie Graham, for her support with user testing of the prototypes.

The 3000 people who attended the PNE Maker’s Faire, tried the workblade and loved it.

How the Indiegogo funds will be used

The funds we raise on Indiegogo will be used for the STANZ’s first round of production and promotion. After more than 2 years of designing and testing, we have completed two prototypes, the Electra for home and the Highrise for the office. 

The STANZ workblade series is ready for production!  We need your support to meet the minimum order quantity to bring this exciting project to life.

Production Timeline:
October ~ November: additional design touch-ups, such as adding the STANZ logo to packaging designs, and final quality test.  
November ~ December: we're going to place an order with the funds we raised from Indiegogo. Production will be done locally in the Fraser Valley’s light manufacturing area.
December ~ January: products will be shipped out, and it shouldn't take more than a few weeks for the shipped products to reach you wherever you are. 


Risks and challenges

Over 2 years of designing and rigorous testing with feedback from consumer groups and the general public at exhibitions and conferences. We wanted to make sure that the prototype was complete with rigorous performance and durability tests before we started our Indiegogo campaign. We're very confident that we will deliver our quality products by the projected dates. 

MANUFACTURING
We have established relationships with experienced contract manufacturers in BC to mitigate the risk of delays by material suppliers and to ensure quality control is implemented to the highest level. While we know there will still be unexpected challenges along the way, we will always be transparent and inform our backers of potential hurdles as we go.

SHIP DATE
We have built in extra time for the manufacturing process and are confident we will ship by the projected dates. We will always keep you informed if things take longer than planned.

PRODUCT
We have taken the following steps to ensure that we deliver the best quality product:
- Built working prototypes with the established contract manufacturer.
- Extensively tested prototypes for performance and durability.

Please take a look at the perks to see how a contribution can make a major difference to your life.

story:
Short Summary

I love these shoes! Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. are my own patent-pending design for a barefoot golf shoe, and every golfer needs to try these shoes. My small company needs to grow, and for that I need to raise funds for a 30-second commercial to run during one of the 2014 Major golf tournaments on NBC or The Golf Channel. In return, contributors will receive a pair of Barefoot B.E.R.B.S., a hat, or a pair of special edition golf shoes.

My name is Jeremy Berbert, a professional golfer on the cusp of success with big aspirations. I love the game of golf, but I found that my feet, knees, hips, and back would start to ache half-way through a round. So one day it occurred to me that no one had yet designed a barefoot style golf shoe.

Being barefoot is the best thing for the human body. Our bodies were not meant to wear shoes with thick, padded heels, especially while golfing. Invented in 2012, Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. is the first golf shoe of its kind. With these shoes, I regularly play 18 holes of pain-free golf without worrying about taking my shoes off for the 19th hole.

I want to let everyone know that there is a better golf shoe out there! One that will help every golfer play better. Practicing barefoot is endorsed by Sean Foley, Tiger Woods's swing coach, and now every golfer can play barefoot golf with Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. This campaign will help introduce Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. to the golfing world, assist us in getting launched in retail locations around the country, and educate golfers about the benefits of barefoot golfing.


What We Need & What You Get

Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. needs to raise $50,000 to produce and run a 30-second commercial during one or more of the first Major golf tournaments of 2014 (Masters, Players, and U.S. Open).

For your help in funding our commercial I'm offering several perks, including a Barefoot B.E.R.B.S.-branded hat, a pair of B.E.R.B.S. golf shoes, or a pair of Limited Edition Major Tournament B.E.R.B.S. golf shoes.

  • Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. Hat: Green bear print logo on black golf cap.
  • Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. Golf Shoes: Available in multiple styles (all black, black & white, pink & white) and sizes (men's 7-14 and women's 5 1/2 to 11 1/2).
  • Limited Edition B.E.R.B.S. Tournament Golf Shoes: Available in multiple styles with special tournament colors, either green and yellow (The Masters) or red, white, and blue (U.S. Open).

Here's how Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. will spend the money, if we reach our goal:

  • $20,000 - Cost of Perks, shipping, and Indiegogo fees
  • $20,000 - Produce 30-second commercial
  • $10,000+ - Every dollar over and above our goal will be spent to run the commercial during upcoming golf tournaments

If we exceed our goal, we'll increase our commercial run for greater exposure, and add additional televised tournaments. If we don't meet our goal, we'll fulfill all Perks and use the money to build the Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. brand in other ways.

The Impact

Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. is David going up against the Goliaths of the golf apparel industry. We've developed a better golf shoe, and we need your help to compete against large corporations like FootJoy, Nike, and TaylorMade-Adidas. As a new company we do not have the resources to do a big marketing campaign. Every contribution will get Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. one step closer to becoming a household name. 

Other Ways You Can Help

On behalf of Barefoot B.E.R.B.S., I'd like to personally thank you for taking time to view our campaign. Even if you are not able to make a contribution, I'd ask you to pass this on to someone you know who enjoys golf. I'd appreciate it if you'd just share this campaign with all of your friends -- even those who don't play golf -- because maybe they know someone who can benefit from playing in Barefoot B.E.R.B.S. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!  Regards Jeremy Berbert

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!  Regards Jeremy Berbert

story:
My cousin Samantha Louise Lofton was diagnosed with Stage 3 throat cancer in July of 2013 at the age of 21. After intense chemotherapy and radiation, Samantha found out that she was in remission on November 20th, 2013. However, due to circumstances she is struggling to pay for her medical bills. She also wants to raise awareness about the cancer that she had to help other people who may be experiencing something similar. Anything will help and I know that it will mean the world to Samantha and her husband Andrew if they can raise the money they need to pay off these bills.

To learn more about Samantha and her Journey, you can visit her facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/theloftonjourney

story:
Please watch the video of a Houstonian's Testimony

We apologize as the video is displayed sideways, but this is a man's testimony about how hard it is to get adequate healthcare in Houston!, even with a Gold Card, It took him 7 months to see a doctor. There is no such thing as same day visits with the Gold Card and to make an appointment to see a doctor, one would have to call early in the morning daily to find a spot. So, what is one supposed to do when they are severely ill and need to be seen right away?

Short Summary 

We believe that healthcare is very important for everyone. Unfortunately, many choose to go without healthcare being that they are unable to afford it. We are here so at least when it counts, they can go to a clinic when their symptoms are severe, so that they can get a prescription to get better.

  • Hi! We, Berenice, Christina, Greg, and Alexa are Social Work students at the University of Houston - Downtown who are here raise funds to aid others in financial need.
  • We have personally dealt with or know someone close to us who chose to use at home remedies to get well, and sometimes that does not work. This is where we kick in for our community.
  • We, as a community, are in a great need for outside supporters to aid Progressive Medicine Associates Clinic serving Houston, which is the clinic that we chose for this campaign . They provide non-urgent medical visits for 40 dollars, but because many individuals are unable to afford even that we'd like your help providing services for those in need.

Please, think about how you would feel going to school, work, caring for your children when in need of a prescription. What is scary is that infections can get worse if not treated. Everyone needs a leg up now and then!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We would like to raise at minimum 500$ to support free clinic visits that will be going to Progressive Medicine Associates on 8811 Westheimer Rd., 77063. We trust this clinic, especially since, I, Christina have personally been there to get well.
  • When you donate, no matter how much of an amount, you fund someone to get well!
  • Even if we do not reach our goal, funds will be given to Progressive Medicine Associates to help cover some patients who are in need. Please remember that clinic visits are 40$ per person....

Other Information!

The clinic that we are funding and backing is Progressive Medicine Associates located on 8811 Westheimer rd in Houston, Texas 77063, Suite 101.

  • You can email them at info@progressiveclinic.com or call 713-978-6337 if you have any questions about their clinic.
  • You can also visit their website at http://www.progressiveclinic.com
  • You may also contact me personally about funding questions or concerns at Kelleyc@uhd.edu or Kelleyc07@yahoo.com. Responses are usually quick!
  • We are senior and junior students at the University of Houston- Downtown giving back to our community as a final project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Like us on Facebook and share our link so that others can possibly help our cause.
  • Do not forget our Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

We would like to raise at minimum 500$ to support free clinic visits that will be going to Progressive Medicine Associates on 8811 Westheimer Rd., 77063. We trust this clinic, especially since, I, Christina have personally been there to get well.
When you donate, no matter how much of an amount, you fund someone to get well!
Even if we do not reach our goal, funds will be given to Progressive Medicine Associates to help cover some patients who are in need. Please remember that clinic visits are 40$ per person....
Other Information!The clinic that we are funding and backing is Progressive Medicine Associates located on 8811 Westheimer rd in Houston, Texas 77063, Suite 101.
You can email them at info@progressiveclinic.com or call 713-978-6337 if you have any questions about their clinic.
You can also visit their website at http://www.progressiveclinic.com

You may also contact me personally about funding questions or concerns at Kelleyc@uhd.edu or Kelleyc07@yahoo.com. Responses are usually quick!
We are senior and junior students at the University of Houston- Downtown giving back to our community as a final project.
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Like us on Facebook and share our link so that others can possibly help our cause.
Do not forget our Indiegogo share tools!
And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Help Us Fight Lyme

Last fall my brother Gregory was diagnosed with Lyme disease. Before discovering he had Lyme he was misdiagnosed over the course of fours years. Lyme and the misdiagnosis have taken a toll on my brother’s health. 

The lack of awareness to Lyme and years of no treatment led to Neuropsychological Lyme Illness, which has completely altered my brother’s brain. Although our relationship has been strained I still call my brother one of my best friends and believe that he will return. 

I have faith that he will overcome Lyme.  Please help my brother fight Lyme by donating to this fund, which will go towards his medical expenses, Lyme research, and Lyme awareness. Thank you!

Gregory is a talented photographer. To thank those who donate, I will be sending photographs and calendars of his photography. 

For more information about this condition please visit 

http://www.psychologytoday.com/articles/200804/lyme-disease-the-great-imitator

and watch the documentary 'Under Our Skin'

story:
Short Summary

Our goal is to raise enough money for my Mom to have an Endless Pool installed -- these are designed for water aerobics, and this is the only form of exercise my mom is able to do. Her knees have zero cartilage left and she is unable to walk at all. The Endless pool would provide much needed water therapy, without the social stigma and awkwardness of being overweight and disabled at a public pool.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Endless Pools are unique "small" pools that can be installed indoor or outdoor, require very little maintenance, and include a "swimming machine" to swim against a current. Some models also include a treadmill, making water walking fun and easy.
  • While we don't have much in the way of rewards at this time, I'll be looking into options. If you have any ideas or requests, please feel free to reach out!
  • If we do not fully reach our goal, the funds will be kept in an account for mom's medical care, while she saves up money to put toward the pool. Even a small amount will be helpful because it will reduce the amount of money mom has to save up on a limited income.

The Impact

My mom worked hard her whole life to provide for her family. She spent over 15 years in a job that was hard on her, both physically and emotionally, just to put food on the table and keep a roof over our heads.

In 2007, my Dad, mom's life partner and soul mate, passed away. She has struggled for years with chronic pain and disability. Since losing her husband, she has gained more weight and become even less mobile than before. 


Mom's income also took a drastic hit when we lost Dad -- most of their income was from his retirement and disability. Mom is surviving on a small fixed income and is unable to fund a project like this on her own.

If Dad were still alive, the VA would have been able to help have a pool installed. Unfortunately, it was a struggle just to get the accessible features in their home finished, as the VA-financed remodel was incomplete when he passed away. 

Mom was recently diagnosed with stage 3 kidney disease, and her doctor said the only way for her to improve her kidney health is to lose some weight. Because of her knees, water therapy is the only means of exercise she has. 

As you might imagine, there is a lot of anxiety as an overweight, disabled woman exercising in public, especially in a bathing suit.  Mom and I did take an aquacise class, but it became difficult dealing with the looks and whispers we would get while she was being lifted into the pool.


If Mom is able to exercise in the pool, she will be able to lose the weight needed to be eligible for a knee replacement so that she can walk again, and hopefully reverse or prevent further damage to her kidneys.


In short -- my Mom is the kindest and most amazing woman I know, and she deserves to have this dream come true. With this pool she will be able to exercise daily, in the comfort of her own home. As an added bonus, the rest of our family will have access to the health benefits of aqua therapy as well. (I myself am also overweight, and you can bet I will be at mom's pool as often as I can be!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to donate, please consider sharing this on your social networks, and asking your friends to share as well. Getting this around is our best chance to help a wonderful Mom spend more time with her family.

story:
Twisted Pink is a 501(c)3 organization that is twisting the model of fundraising for a cure to breast cancer.  Twisted Pink is different than other organizations because we raise money exclusively for research to cure breast cancer.  We do not fund education, awareness or medical treatment.    

Caroline Johnson of Louisville, KY, completed her  treatment for stage III Breast Cancer in February of 2014.  During her year in treatment, Caroline participated in many fundraising events for breast cancer and began to become aware that at best 25% was being directed to research.  After several friends were diagnosed with stage IV breast cancer and she learned that only 2-3% of the 25% for research was going to research stage IV breast cancer, she decided to take action.    

Here are some current facts about Metastatic Breast Cancer:

1. Metastatic breast cancer is the leading cause of death in women 35-55

2. 155,000 women are living with metastatic breast cancer 

3. 40,000 women will die this year from metastatic breast cancer. A statistic that hasn't changed much in 30 years.  Cancer within the breast is not fatal. It is only when it metastasizes that it kills. 

4. The average length of survival of metastatic breast cancer is 3 years. 

5. Early detection does not = cure.   Any stage of breast cancer can metastasize. 20- 30% of early stage breast cancer patients will experience metastasis.

6. Only 2% of breast cancer funding goes to research to help stop this disease from killing women. The majority of funding goes to "awareness" and early detection programs. 

The following video clip describes some of Caroline Johnson's breast cancer journey.  

http://www.whas11.com/home/Pearls-and-Pumps-offers-fasion-shopping-with-health-awareness-250370081.html

To learn more go to www.twistedpink.org

story:
Simply stated, Yoga has helped me out of depression, unhealthy habits and given me the ability to believe in myself again.

I love that Yoga can work for anyone - any body type or any physical condition, It has helped the disabled, the very young all the way up to the very old.  That is why I love Yoga it has helped me focus on what matters the most in life. To love yourself and the body that you have. I want to be a teacher that helps bring people to yoga in warm and welcoming way. I want to help people - and my way is through yoga. 

I am trying to raise funds that would enable me to complete a 200+ hour yoga teacher training over the course of seven months.

My Training starts October 3rd 2015 at Ahimsa Yoga.

I hope my honest and open message will impact you in some way, either contributing to my campaign or gained interest in practicing yoga yourself.

Thank You


Namaste  

"The most important pieces of equipment you need for doing yoga are your body and your mind."

story:
I am running the Tokyo Marathon 2016 as a charity runner for the Japan Association for UNHCR (United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees). The money donated will go towards installing shelters to save the lives of refugees forced to flee their homes due to conflicts.

I have pledged ¥100,000 (SGD1162 or £542) to this cause, and would really appreciate your support in helping me fund this. There is no such thing as too small an amount; every yen/dollar/quid that is contributed to the charity will go a long way in helping refugees who are in need.

I do not expect to raise the full amount, but I will still be donating ¥100,000 to the charity if the target is not reached. If in any case the target is exceeded, I will donate the money in excess of the target to another charity (you can help me decide which!). A million thank yous!

story:
Hi there,
My name Is Cheryl Howe I am holding a charity ladies night in aid of 3 female cancer charities.
I would just like to take a moment to speak a little bit about what the charities entail;
Gynaecological Cancers
The term 'gynaecological cancer' refers to the five cancers that start in the female reproductive system:
•Womb (also known as cancer of the uterus, endometrial cancer, or uterine cancer)
•Ovarian, Cervical, Vulval and Vaginal
With the exception of cervical cancer, most are found in women aged over 50. But the incidence of some of the other gynaecological cancers in younger women has been rising. Over 1 million women each year worldwide are diagnosed with a gynaecological cancer.
Awareness of these cancers - or even knowing the names of all five - is very low.
I myself have had the misfortune of having to fight cervical womb and ovarian cancer which is why I am devoted to rising as much awareness and money as possible for these charities.
Please help me raise money for these 3 different charities that help so many women each and every day.
The 3 Charities I have chosen are:-
The Eve Appeal charity registration number is 1091708
Target Ovarian Cancer registration number is 661998
Ovarian Cancer Action registration number is 1109743
All three charities are 100% behind me and are doing all they can in order to ensure that this evening is fully supported.

story:
For 28-year-old Nadyne Moldowan, co-owner of Femme Natale’s Pole Fitness Studio in the Comox Valley, there’s no place like pole.

Pole Dancing is growing because it is a very physically challenging sport. The stigma associated to the stripper communtiy is slowly being dismissed and for good reason. This sport is a combination of gymnastics and dancing. It is graceful,powerful and beautiful. It has the ability to trancent peoples self image issues especially in young women and men.  Our society teaches womenand men to be ashamed of there bodies. We are always being told our hair and skin is not perfect our bodies are too big or too small, even the most aesthetically pleasing young men and women are  prone to self-esteem issues.

Pole Dancing for fitness cuts through all that negative energy and helps release feelings of confidence and builds love for one-self.

Climbing off the couch and onto the pole was a liberating experience for the pharmacy technician, who says pole fitness combined all the elements she was looking for – a head to toe workout for the outside, while feeling like a goddess on the inside.

Nadyne has been practising pole fitness for over four  years now and got her first taste of competition at Miss Pole Canada in 2011, taking home People’s Choice in the Pro-Division

With the title of 2012 B.C. Pole Fitness Champion (2012), and Canadian Pole Fitness Championship runner-up under her belt, Nadyne has proven she has what it takes to win.

 She hopes to continue that success at the 2013 World Pole Sports Championship (WPSC) being held in London on July 10. This is a very different kind of event, the first of its kind which is dedicated to the athletic performance and technical aspects of pole. Nadyne has already been selected to compete in the qualifiers for this event, and also has been selected as a semi-finalist in the International Pole Championships 2013 being held in Singapore on Novemeber 30, 2013.

 

It is our sincere hope that you will join us in our efforts to promote the growth of pole fitness and support Nadyne on her journey to Singapore and London. Femme Natale’s has a goal to fundraise up to $2500 to help make Nadyne’s endeavor to compete a reality this year. 

All moneys will go to purchase flight ,accomodations and ensure nadynes compititon fees,costume, food,will be taken care of.

All donations are greatly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Please share the news along and get the word out find and add us on facebook https://www.facebook.com/#!/groups/45148898178/
  • make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools
  • visit our website and keep informed on nadynes progress www.comoxvalleypolefitness.com

 For further information, please contact us  at Femmenatale @hotmail.com. 

We cannot express the utmost appreciation and respect to you for supporting nadyne along this journey .

"I am so humbled by all that I have recieved so far.  Thank you so much to everyone for the opportunity to truly focus on my passion.  I wouldn't have come this far without you, and I will dedicate everything I have to making you proud." Nadyne

Thank you

story:
The Healthy Feet Clinic’s

“Save a Senior — Donate Compression Socks Campaign”

Healthy Feet ~ Happy People!

Purchase our compression sock perk => and we’ll donate a pair of socks to a senior who has no medical coverage. Click on the perk you like + make your contribution + then go to this electronic form on our website to indicate the size and color. Save A Senior today! Click on a perk now to get started =>

The Healthy Feet Clinic is committed to providing our customers with the highest quality of products and services for healthy feet and legs. Our compression socks are designed to help improve health. Our services are delivered by trained and certified staff backed by a group of medical professionals.

Your feet and legs are your body's foundation. They provide you with the ability to move freely and enjoy your independence.

What happens when that mobility is no longer possible?

Here’s a real life example

Dale, on our team, watched his elderly father lose his independence because he could no longer walk. Once that occurred, the quality of his father's life changed, his ability to move freely was curtailed, and his interest in life was lessened.

This had a direct effect on his father, his family and the medical system that cared for him.

This is one of the main reasons for this campaign.

Joe, also on our team, experienced on many occasions people coming to him at "Healthy Leg Days" (and at our clinic) who badly need compression socks, and who -- even if he offered them socks at cost -- could not afford them.

Sadly, this has occurred on too many occasions.

Another reason why this program is important.

Who should wear compression socks?

Pilots ~ Teachers ~ Seniors ~ Hospitality ~ Nurses ~ Bank Tellers ~ Retailers ~ Students ~ and more!

  • Do you sit or stand for long periods of time?
  • Do you have swollen/tired/heavy ankles, feet and legs?
  • Are you prone to varicose or spider veins?
  • Do you travel long distances?

Why compression socks?

  • Alleviate tired aching legs, swollen feet, ankles and legs.
  • Promote good blood flow from legs back to the heart.
  • Prevent pooling and back flow of blood which causes aching legs, feet and may lead to other serious venous conditions (varicose veins, blood clots).

How do compression socks work?

  • Veins in a person's legs carry blood back to the heart.
  • The calf muscle, when walking, aids as a pump to push blood through the veins up to the heart.
  • Because blood is working against gravity the veins house one-way valves which open & close when the heart pumps, thereby ensuring blood does not flow back down the leg.
  • When a person sits or stands for long periods of time the calf muscle is not contracting and relaxing, resulting in blood pooling on the valves and pushing on walls of the veins.
  • This causes swollen feet, ankles and legs, and in the long term can cause varicose veins or other venous disorders.

Our campaign attempts to begin an effort to keep more people walking, pain free, for a longer period in their lives.

SAVE A SENIOR ... GIVE THEM COMPRESSION SOCKS!

The Healthy Feet Clinic wants to help as many people as possible!

We educate staff on the importance of good blood circulation management and the science behind how compression socks can help. The response of our clients has been exceptionally positive and satisfying.

The "Healthy Feet & Leg Days" are for staff who are on their feet or sit for long periods of time (e.g. teachers, nurses, and hotel staff.)

Meet Our Team

110+ years of combined experience

  • Dale
  • Joe
  • Tony
  • Jim
  • Marty
  • Jack

Joe Abdlimasih

20 years of management and hospitality experience. Joe is highly trained and certified in the medical compression sock industry, and is very passionate about helping people maintain a healthy lifestyle!

Dale Warick

20+ years of business experience. His background? Import/export, business planning, product feasibility studies, procurement, regulatory administration, product distribution and marketing. Very familiar with the processes of taking a product from the idea stage to market.

Dr. Tony Abdlimasih

  • Medical advisory to our company
  • Owns his own Chiropractor clinic
  • 10+ years treating a wide variety of conditions

Our certified fitter sales team and "Healthy Leg Days"

  • Jack
  • Marty
  • Jim

Campaign Budget

Compression socks and Compassion are two ways we can help!

  1. Select our Compression Socks Perk
  2. We'll donate socks to a Senior in need!

They will thank you.

While browsing our perks check out our custom-branded T-Shirts! You're going to love them--and they make a great gift too!

SAVE A SENIOR

The challenge is to educate people on the "benefits of compression socks" and to get a pair of socks to seniors who may not have health care coverage or funding.

We urge you to click on a Perk at the right to help someone in need! Thank you!

Credits

"Walking Oz"

Music Production: www.jeffgoldmusic.com/hear_music

@2013 Jeff Gold Music. All Rights Reserved

Thank you!

Top Questions

How do I order my size? Once this campaign has ended you simply log-on to our website and select your size, color and style. Do your compression socks come in different colors for men and women? Our compression socks are available in an array of colors and patterns for casual or business. wear. Do you ship internationally? Please add $15.00 CAD to your order for international shipping (with the exception of the Kwik Bandit® Package which is $3.00 to ship). Who should wear compression socks? -you sit or stand for long periods of time -you have swollen/tired/heavy ankles, feet and legs -you're prone to varicose or spider veins -travel long distance travel. Why compression socks? -alleviate tired aching legs and swollen feet, ankles and legs -promote good blood flow from the legs back to the heart. -prevent pooling and back flow of blood which causes aching legs/feet and may lead to other serious venous conditions (varicose veins/blood clots) How do they work?
  • Veins in a person’s legs carry the blood back to the heart.
  • Calf muscle, when walking, aids as a pump to push the blood through the veins up to the heart.
  • Because the blood is working against gravity the veins house one way valves which open and close every time the heart pumps, thereby ensuring blood does not flow back down the leg.
  • When a person sits or stands for a long period of time the calf muscle is not contracting and relaxing, resulting in blood pooling on the valves and pushing on the walls of the veins, causing swollen feet/ankles/legs and in the long term can cause varicose veins or other venous disorders.
  • Compression socks gently squeeze the vein walls together allowing the valves to close effectively and carry blood efficiently back to the heart.
Please taken a moment to browse our Perks and share this #cause for #seniors with your friends on social media. Come back here every few days for updates, and follow on Twitter @HealthyFeetClnc ==> thanks, have a good week!

ADVISORY: We recommend that you and/or the person you are donating to consult with their physician prior to utilizing compression socks.
story_txt:
The Healthy Feet Clinic’s
“Save a Senior — Donate Compression Socks Campaign”
Healthy Feet ~ Happy People!
Purchase     our compression sock perk => and we’ll     donate a pair of socks to a senior who has no medical coverage. Click on the perk you like + make your contribution + then go to this electronic form on our website to indicate the size and color. Save A Senior today! Click on a perk now to get started =>
The Healthy Feet Clinic is committed to providing our customers with the highest quality of products and services for healthy feet and legs. Our compression socks are designed to help improve health. Our services are delivered by trained and certified staff backed by a group of medical professionals.
Your feet and legs are your body's foundation. They provide you with the ability to move freely and enjoy your independence.
What happens when that mobility is no longer possible?
Here’s a real life example
Dale, on our team, watched his elderly father lose his independence because he could no longer walk. Once that occurred, the quality of his father's life changed, his ability to move freely was curtailed, and his interest in life was lessened.
This had a direct effect on his father, his family and the medical system that cared for him.
This is one of the main reasons for this campaign.
Joe, also on our team, experienced on many occasions people coming to him at "Healthy Leg Days" (and at our clinic) who badly need compression socks, and who -- even if he offered them socks at cost -- could not afford them.
Sadly, this has occurred on too many occasions.
Another reason why this program is important.
Who should wear compression socks?
Pilots ~ Teachers ~ Seniors ~ Hospitality ~ Nurses ~ Bank Tellers ~ Retailers ~ Students ~ and more!

Do you sit or stand for long periods of time?
Do you have swollen/tired/heavy ankles, feet and legs?
Are you prone to varicose or spider veins?
Do you travel long distances?

Why compression socks?

Alleviate tired aching legs, swollen feet, ankles and legs.
Promote good blood flow from legs back to the heart.
Prevent pooling and back flow of blood which causes aching legs, feet and may lead to other serious venous conditions (varicose veins, blood clots).

How do compression socks work?

Veins in a person's legs carry blood back to the heart.
The calf muscle, when walking, aids as a pump to push blood through the veins up to the heart.
Because blood is working against gravity the veins house one-way valves which open & close when the heart pumps, thereby ensuring blood does not flow back down the leg.
When a person sits or stands for long periods of time the calf muscle is not contracting and relaxing, resulting in blood pooling on the valves and pushing on walls of the veins.
This causes swollen feet, ankles and legs, and in the long term can cause varicose veins or other venous disorders.

Our campaign attempts to begin an effort to keep more people walking, pain free, for a longer period in their lives.
SAVE A SENIOR ... GIVE THEM COMPRESSION SOCKS!
The Healthy Feet Clinic wants to help as many people as possible!
We educate staff on the importance of good blood circulation management and the science behind how compression socks can help. The response of our clients has been exceptionally positive and satisfying.
The "Healthy Feet & Leg Days" are for staff who are on their feet or sit for long periods of time (e.g. teachers, nurses, and hotel staff.)
Meet Our Team
110+ years of combined experience

Dale
Joe
Tony
Jim
Marty
Jack

Joe Abdlimasih
20 years of management and hospitality experience. Joe is highly trained and certified in the medical compression sock industry, and is very passionate about helping people maintain a healthy lifestyle!
Dale Warick
20+ years of business experience. His background? Import/export, business planning, product feasibility studies, procurement, regulatory administration, product distribution and marketing. Very familiar with the processes of taking a product from the idea stage to market.
Dr. Tony Abdlimasih

Medical advisory to our company
Owns his own Chiropractor clinic
10+ years treating a wide variety of conditions

Our certified fitter sales team and "Healthy Leg Days"

Jack
Marty
Jim

Campaign Budget

Compression socks and Compassion are two ways we can help!

Select our Compression Socks Perk
We'll donate socks to a Senior in need!

They will thank you.
While browsing our perks check out our custom-branded T-Shirts! You're going to love them--and they make a great gift too!


SAVE A SENIOR
The challenge is to educate people on the "benefits of compression socks" and to get a pair of socks to seniors who may not have health care coverage or funding.
 
We urge you to click on a Perk at the right to help someone in need! Thank you!
Credits
"Walking Oz"
Music Production: www.jeffgoldmusic.com/hear_music
@2013 Jeff Gold Music. All Rights Reserved
Thank you!
Top Questions
How do I order my size?
Once this campaign has ended you simply log-on to our website and select your size, color and style.

Do your compression socks come in different colors for men and women?
Our compression socks are available in an array of colors and patterns for casual or business. wear.

Do you ship internationally?
Please add $15.00 CAD to your order for international shipping (with the exception of the Kwik Bandit® Package which is $3.00 to ship).

Who should wear compression socks?
-you sit or stand for long periods of time
-you have swollen/tired/heavy ankles, feet and legs
-you're prone to varicose or spider veins
-travel long distance travel.

Why compression socks?
-alleviate tired aching legs and swollen feet, ankles and legs
-promote good blood flow from the legs back to the heart.
-prevent pooling and back flow of blood which causes aching legs/feet and may lead to other serious venous conditions (varicose veins/blood clots)

How do they work?

Veins in a person’s legs carry the blood back to the heart.
Calf muscle, when walking, aids as a pump to push the blood through the veins up to the heart.
Because the blood is working against gravity the veins house one way valves which open and close every time the heart pumps, thereby ensuring blood does not flow back down the leg.
When a person sits or stands for a long period of time the calf muscle is not contracting and relaxing, resulting in blood pooling on the valves and pushing on the walls of the veins, causing swollen feet/ankles/legs and in the long term can cause varicose veins or other venous disorders.
Compression socks gently squeeze the vein walls together allowing the valves to close effectively and carry blood efficiently back to the heart.

Please taken a moment to browse our Perks and share this #cause for #seniors with your friends on social media.

Come back here every few days for updates, and follow on Twitter @HealthyFeetClnc ==> thanks, have a good week!
ADVISORY: We recommend that you and/or the person you are donating to consult with their physician prior to utilizing compression socks.

story:
CREATIVE Health

Creative Health began when I became passionate about changing the way we view health. I couldn't look at another magazine dedicated to loosing weight.  And I was frustrated with the gap in nutritional education and access in the US, let alone globally. By first making health attainable at any budget and then approaching it in a a light-hearted and fun manner, I hope to create an alternative route.  

  • I'm a graduate of the Graphic Design and Painting programs at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.
  • I need to raise 1000$ for the initial bulk print of 100 sets of 12 cards.
  • Someday I'd like to see Creative Health in stores, schools, and programs dedicated to making the world healthier and happier.

One 2$ donation makes one card and one card is all it takes to spread knowledge, awareness, and happiness. 

No lies you get some sweet prize(s)

$1000 is a lot! I really appreciate any and all funding. Or social media sharing!

  • I will be able to make 100 sets (of 12 cards)! Sold online launching April 1st. You'll be the first to know. If that is successful, we can prepare for an even bigger launch!
  • I want you to get the thank you you deserve. For every donation, you get an individualized note. From $2 to $100 you can get raps about your name, one of a kind drawings, and super silly dance videos. The top donations get Creative Health sets and inside scoop on special releases. 
  • If we don't make it to $1000, then we print a smaller amount of sets. Creative Health won't let anything stop it!

The Impact

You made me smile. A LOT. But better yet, you are contributing to a project that I believe is very important to a broader population: the people that need to use nutrition as their form of health care, the people that need to stretch their dollar, and the people that need to overcome poor body image.

  • The set includes not only healthy recipes on a budget, but also healthy habits and routines because a happier life can only be created when all pieces align.

Spread the Word! 

Honestly if you're tight on cash, sharing via social media is just as helpful! If you can pass this along to a friend, coworker, or family then it's taking Creative Health one step closer to spreading the word on attainable health. 

  • Indiegogo supplies sharing options, perfect!
  • Secondly, you're great even for reading this far down the description.

In the words of Esteban, "Go do something amazing!"

story:
The Problem: End-of-Life Healthcare Crisis for Americans

Today in America, there is a huge GAP between what people want for End-of-Life care and what they actually receive. This is a humanitarian crisis of massive proportions:

90% of people would prefer to die at home surrounded by the things they love and the people who love them…   But in reality…

80% of people die in hospitals or nursing homes, where they may be attached to machines, hoses, tubes, and surrounded by strangers… a terrible way to die.

Why are millions of Americans suffering needlessly and not dying in the manner they desire? Why are families asked to make uninformed medical decisions resulting in great emotional pain and turmoil? And finally, why are billions of dollars being spent by families, companies and the government on medical interventions that the dying person would never have wanted?

This is all occurring because no one talks about death and dying: the right questions have not been asked and the right documents have not been signed. We plan to educate and activate others by stimulating a discussion on these issues with the goal of shifting the paradigm of how Americans approach the End of Life.

Excerpt adapted from It’s OK to Die by Dr. Monica Williams-Murphy ....
...The paramedic radioed in to the ER “we are bringing you a 70 year-old female patient who has had multiple strokes, is paralyzed and has been in a Nursing home for 10 years. Tonight she has respiratory distress… oxygen and blood pressure are both low.” When they arrived my first glance told me she was dying. “Does she have a DNR (Do Not Resuscitate) order?” I asked as I listened to the fluid filling her failing lungs. “No she is Full Code” came the reply. “Full Code?” I ask as I felt her stiff retracted arm, and body frozen in the fetal position from years of disuse. I felt paralyzed myself, because “Full Code” means they are asking me to shove a breathing tube down her throat and stick a long needle under her collar bone, and shock her if her heart gives out. This seemed wrong. Would she even want more years of living like this? Being rolled over every two hours to ease bed sores, probably not even knowing who is in the room, unable to speak or hear?

The family arrived and I told them, “We are in a critical window, but there are options. “ I explained Full Code, a Middle Ground, or Comfort Care –“providing oxygen and medicines to keep her pain free and restful, and you can stay beside her.” “We want you to do everything you can Doctor” was the reply, a request for the Full Code pathway.

In the ICU the next day, long after visiting hours were over, my patient died…alone. Like this…



Would she have even wanted this for herself? Was she ever asked?
We want to eliminate this type of needless suffering for Americans who are very elderly or who have advanced terminal illness. We can teach people what they need to know and do, to avoid this kind of situation, for themselves and their love ones. We want to teach individuals, and the Nation, how to plan for and manage their own End-of-Life care.

Please understand that we do not support euthanasia/assisted suicide, rather our intention is to educate others on how to be in control of the End-of-LIfe process, and to transform it into a time of comfort, peace and closure for all.

 

Why Does This End-of-Life Crisis Exist?

We hope you are now asking, “Why does this happen? How can this be allowed? How can 80% of Americans die in places they do not want to be?” Dr. Williams-Murphy has identified key cultural beliefs and practices that explain how this crisis developed and the effects they have had on the American experience of death and dying.


  • Death is no longer viewed as a natural part of life. It is now viewed as a medical event that must be managed in institutions (nursing homes, hospitals...).
  • Since most people now die in medical institutions, we have lost cultural knowledge of how death happens naturally and what it looks like.
  • No one talks about death in social dialogue and therefore, no plans are made for the End-of-Life.
  • Most doctors have developed an attitude that losing a patient is a defeat and thus tend to avoid conversations about death and dying as well.
  • Modern living (commuting, moving, computers) has changed the way we relate to each other, creating emotional distance possibly leading us to select more aggressive medical intervention to keep “mother” alive long enough for us to create closure for ourselves.
  • Modern medicine seems to provide technological “miracles.”

All this gives the false impression that we can control or prevent death. We cannot, we can only sometimes delay it... and often with horrendous suffering and burdens:

  • Physical: Breathing tubes, feeding tubes, bedsores, IV lines, infections.
  • Emotional: The patient feels like he or she has become a burden on others, and the family is emotionally exhausted and overwhelmed with complicated medical choices and the work of caring for their loved one.
  • Providers: Suffer a huge guilt burden about whether or not they are making the right decision for their loved one.
  • Negative Financial Impacts: to the family and taxpayers for unnecessary, unwanted and futile medical procedures.

The bottom line is that "It’s OK to Die" will help move our thought processes from High-Tech to High-Touch medical choices at the End of Life.

 

Project:

Eliminating End-of-Life Suffering for Loved Ones

The “It’s OK to Die” organization reaches out to the terminally ill and frail elderly, their families, and their caregivers to inform, educate and guide them in preparing the necessary steps (emotional, financial and medical) so that no American will face the end of their life without their wishes, and directions for THEIR OWN health care being known and carried out. Entering the End-of-Life without such plans can create a perilous time of needless suffering and confusion for everyone, in addition to exacting enormous emotional and financial costs. 

We also educate doctors, caregivers and End-of-Life facilities serving terminally ill or the elderly on the natural process of dying, and outline how to create positive End-of-Life experiences - physical, emotional, social and even financial.

The “It’s Ok to Die” organization openly addresses the culturally sensitive subject of death and dying and teaches how to manage care at the end of life to create a “good death.” We plan to use our book (which details the problems and solutions in America today), training tools, and media outlets to educate all the caregivers and patients we can.

 

Solution: Education and Action

We seek to raise the awareness of ALL Americans about the pressing need to make your peace, make your plans and make them known. We will inform, educate and assist everyone we can in managing the one single event that effects 100% of ALL of us....dying.

There are 10,000 people turning 65 every day in America; 10,000 people closer to the time when they or a family loved one will have to make tough choices about their own End of Life. But all of them can plan to make this period of life a good one for both themselves and their family.

As the book details – Yes, you can plan a “Good Death.” How? By educating all those involved with the process and utilizing Dr. Williams-Murphy’s simple solutions – specifically by:

  • De-mystifying death and dying as a topic of social conversation. This allows people to discuss and create End-of-Life plans without feeling fearful, inappropriate or morbid.
  • Creating death and dying education for and by doctors. This will allow doctors to honestly educate patients about their own mortality and to better help them choose medical interventions that maximize quality time at the End-of-Life.
  • Providing free End-of-Life decision tools to both families and medical professionals (co-created by Dr. Williams-Murphy) including; 1) Personal Self-Assessment Scale (PSAS) - helps families make future decisions about what medical care you want and when you want it, and 2) Fierro’s Four R’s decision tool -  helps you make decisions for loved ones who have lost the ability to make medical decisions for themselves.
  • Helping you to identify when and how to shift from “cure-focused” to “comfort-focused” medicine near the End of Life. When this goal changes, it changes almost all of the actions taken by you, your family, your caregivers and your doctors.
  • Finding ways to harness the power and gifts inherent to the End of Life that are limited at other times of living including: Heightened emotional availability, Relationship healing opportunities, Forgiveness, Closure, Healing and Release (“Six Things That Must Be Said”), Summarizing life lessons, and Leaving a legacy.


All of this moves us closer to creating a “good death” at home, if possible, in the arms of those who love us most. We move from selecting Artificial Life support to choosing Natural Death support (hospice and palliative care services). Here is a true story about someone who used our book as a guide in managing his own End-of-Life choices:

“Recently, an 88 year-old acquaintance of ours found himself in the hospital, with failing kidneys and lungs. The doctors had placed him on dialysis and he was confined to a hospital room on oxygen, connected to monitors and with multiple IVs. Apparently, he had expressed to many family members, “This is not what I want.” But neither he nor his family members knew how to ask for or create any alternatives; nor had any doctors discussed changing treatment goals or asked him what he really wanted for himself. A visitor had brought his eldest son a copy of our book, “It’s OK to Die,” and explained to the son that the book would bring clarity to the situation and help them to make choices that could bring peace to the whole family. According to reports, the elderly gentleman saw his son reading this book and asked to look at it himself. He read it through and then called his doctors in for a conference. He said, “Take all of these tubes out of me, I’m going home. I want a hospice called in.” Next, he gently explained to his family why he made this choice and how he wanted to die in his own home. They agreed to honor his decisions. Once home, his family fed him his favorite meals. His extended family and friends came to his home say their “thank you’s, I love you’s, and good-byes.” Children sat in his lap. He died one week later, in his favorite chair, wrapped in his favorite blanket, in his sleep, with his family at his side. This is how most Americans want to die” - Dr. Monica Williams-Murphy



What we want to accomplish and how you can help!


The “It’s OK to Die” organization has 3 main measurable goals for this project.  We call these “The Three R’s”:

  • REDUCE Patient suffering at the End of Life.
  • REDUCE Family suffering at the end of the life of a loved one.
  • REDUCE Spending by families, organizations and government on unnecessary and unwanted, and often futile medical interventions

Our overarching project goal is to change the End-of-Life paradigm which, presently, is causing needless suffering for millions of elderly and terminally ill Americans, as well as wasting billions of dollars for families and taxpayers.

First and foremost, The "It’s OK to Die" authors want to educate people about their options and help them to create an action plan in order to reduce pain and suffering for themselves and their families. However, a secondary and huge benefit of this information/education will be that End-of-Life care costs will be cut dramatically - for families, providers, insurance and government. Cutting spending on healthcare is not a primary reason for this effort, but it is the natural result of patients being able to control what is done to them (or not) at the end of their lives.

How will we do this? We hope to share the simplified knowledge of End-of-Life care processes and decision matrices developed by Dr. Williams-Murphy, with individuals and organizations who are contemplating, facing, or directly involved in End-of-Life decisions:

  • People currently living with a terminal illness, or who are elderly or infirm
  • Families with loved ones who have a terminal illness, or who are elderly or infirm
  • Doctors and other caregivers who deal with patients who have a terminal illness, or who are elderly or infirm
  • Institutions that render services to the elderly and infirm

So, how will your Pledge be spent? The “It’s OK to Die” organization will spearhead and invest toward End-of-Life education in America by:

  • Providing the book, “It’s OK to Die,” to individuals, hospitals, religious organizations, assisted care facilities/providers, and hospice providers.
  • Set-up and provide training/seminars not only for medical professionals, but also for individuals and groups who want to proactively manage the End-of-Life process.
  • Distribute copies of the book to elected representatives and their staff within relevant departments, throughout the United States including Medicare/Medicaid, Congress and state level officials.
  • Use multiple media outlets (social media, Internet, traditional outlets…) as funds permit, to reach as many people as possible… to let them know there are answers and that they can take control and determine their own path.


Through these actions and awareness campaigns, we hope to transform the discourse in America about death and dying. “Death Panel” conversations will be replaced with conversations about how to choose medical care which promotes peace, closure and even healing at the End of Life
