story:
Short Summary

Hi, 

The Terry Scholar Students Association at The University of Texas is an organization that embraces hard work, leadership, merit, and team spirit. UT Terry Scholars are students who have received a scholarship to attend a world class university based on strong academic and leadership skills. Every year, we raise funds and awareness for a special cause and this year we have chosen to make a child happy by donating to Camp Blessing! 

As Terry Scholars, we have been fortunate to receive a scholarship and believe that every child deserves to be happy as well. No disability should become an obstacle and Camp Blessing is one of the few camps in the nation that provides love, acceptance and fun for children with disabilities and their siblings. 

By donating to our cause, you will be directly raising funds to help a child attend Camp Blessing. With high medical costs, many parents can't afford to send their child to camp and your donation will be a big relief! 

Our goal is to raise $800 and 100% of funds will go directly to Camp Blessing. While our goal is to make a child happy, we won't rest until we see a smile on your face too! We hope you enjoy some of the perks we will offer with each donation! 

Lastly, to find out more information about Camp Blessing, please go to http://www.campblessing.org/

Thank you, 

Terry Scholar Students Association

story:
There’s quite a bunch of lovely places in Europe. Nevertheless we consider ourselves lucky to call one of them our home: the beautiful Black Forest in southern Germany. Also home to great stuff like cuckoo clocks, one of the world’s most popular smoked hams, some weird traditions, and, of course, the famous Black Forest cake. We love it so much that we want to share it with you! (And raise some money to pay for quidditch stuff.) Most of our perks include the Black Forest spirit (Sorry, no ham, but there’s cake!), the others burst of quove and the chance to beat somebody in the face with your name.

Thank you for your contribution to the growth of quidditch in Germany! Danke schön!

Wait - quidditch?! That's right. We play quidditch in the real world (also called "muggle quidditch") and we are by far not the only team. You can find an explanatory section on this sport below our little "Black Forest dictionary."


Who are we?

We, that’s the Black Forest Bowtruckles, one of the several new German quidditch teams. Based in the university town of Freiburg we are mostly students, however, we started as a community team open to everyone. (Trying to get anywhere close to just being mentioned in the university’s clubs or sports program is a bureaucratic nightmare. I’d rather get a Steffan-Danino-bludger right in my face.)


Why do we need money?

Right now all the equipment has been paid for by our captain, but since she needs to eat from time to time as well and there is still some stuff missing, we need money to get our team off the ground (pun totally intended.) All the money that is left after paying our captain her money back and buying all these little things like cones and pinnies (about 300 € in total) will be saved to subsidize future travel expenses and support the formation of the German national quidditch league.


Black Forest dictionary*:

“Schauinsland” (literally: Look-into-the-country): This 1,284 m mountain lies right outside of Freiburg and offers a (surprise!) panoramic view of the Black Forest, Freiburg and the Upper Rhine Plain. If the weather’s fine you can even spot the Vosges in France and the Swiss Alps!

“Bollenhut”: A traditional hat that looks a bit like you’ve got a cloud on your head. Worn by women in the Black Forest, red “Bollen” (balls on top of the head) for the unmarried, black for the married.

“Kuckucksuhr”: Centuries ago, farmers in the Black Forest were bored during the winter (which can be pretty harsh in the higher regions), so they started carving and ended up producing the clocks that have long become a symbol of the Black Forest. The original cuckoo clocks make cuckoo sounds on the hour, but those without sound effects are pretty cool, too. (And affordable.)

“Schwarzwälder Kirschtorte”: Go ahead, read it out loud! Can you taste the cherries? The Black Forest cake is the true taste of our home. Don’t let anyone fool you, no Black Forest cake is complete without cherries (and a good amount of kirsch!) Partly because cherries and chocolate is the perfect match, partly because the red cherries resemble the red “Bollen”. Secret correlations!

* You can find all these Black Forest originals in our perks!


Now tell me about that whole quidditch thing, please.

Quidditch entered the real world in 2005 when students in Middlebury, US, found a way to adapt the Harry Potter sport to a universe where brooms don't fly. Since then both the sport and the community has grown immensely. (Muggle) Quidditch is a co-ed full contact sport that combines elements of handball, rugby and dodgeball. Players have to keep a broom between their legs at all times. Each team consists of seven players: Three chasers who pass the quaffle (a volleyball) and try to score through one of opposing team's three goal hoops, winning 10 points per goal. The keeper guards their own hoops. Two beaters handle bludgers (dodgeballs) which they throw at opposing players to "knock them out." Any player hit by a bludger is out of the game until they touched their own hoops. The team's seeker tries to catch the snitch. The snitch is a neutral player dressed in yellow with a tennis ball attached to their waistband and the sole mission to avoid capture at any means. If the snitch is caught, the game ends and the sucessful seeker is awarded 30 points.

Apart from a most exciting sport, quidditch also means a worldwide community. With hundreds of teams all over the globe and the International Quidditch Association as governing body, quidditch brings people together.


Thank you for helping us to add the Black Forest to this community!

story:
My Dream. My Calling. Let's begin healing the World!

My name is Dr. Brian Jones and I am ready to change the world through a dream.

Allow me to explain why I do what I do. When I was a teenager, I severely injured my lower back. Doctors told me I would never walk again. Through determination, trial and error and with the caring support of various physical therapists I was able to overcome the pain, the symptoms and to learn how to walk, run, and live again. Everything I do has been as a result of the things I have experienced throughout my life. Whether good, or bad, they have all led me to this moment, and this opportunity. My dream is to create a way to help people heal through physical therapy. People all over the world do not get the care they need at the time they need it. We need to make information and proper treatment accessible to anyone from anywhere at affordable costs. I want to be the first to make this dream a reality.

I believe in thinking outside of the usual parameters of healthcare. I have created a brand new approach on how to heal, repair peoples' bodies and get them out of pain. I know we can all live productive and rewarding lives void of pain if given the right way to do it.

The modern medical system is backwards, drugs and surgery first, rehab after. I believe it should be the complete opposite; rehab first, and surgery only as a last resort. It has been my experience that this method can actually fix the issue, and it can all be done without pills, without drugs or injections and especially without surgery.

Not until the laws and practices of medicine are challenged will we be able to truly live a healthier existence. My dream is to help heal those suffering from acute and chronic pain throughout the world. I hope to inspire everyone to make the difference in their lives, for themselves, and for their families and loved ones.

My goal is to create a thoroughly beneficial, yet simple to use app that can be used by anyone from ages 9 to 90. Are you ready to change the world with me? By creating this app, we will have the opportunity to make a difference not only in the lives of people we know, but every single person throughout the world who wants to say NO to pain.

Please believe in me, and believe in my cause. If you are the kind of person who wants to make a difference in the lives of others by helping them regain control of their lives and giving them a way to get out of pain, I have the solution for you. Help me heal the world in contributing to my campaign to create this app!


    What We Need & What You Get

    • I will need 40,000 dollars to pay for production of the video and creation of the app. I have funded everything on my own so far and need your help to make it real.
    • The reason I became a doctor is just as big as helping the people I treat. I want and need to reach a bigger market, a global market. Help me reach the population I know we can. 
    • Unique perks include: resistance bands, T-shirts, my book, stability balls and free subscription to the app when it is designed.
    • If I don't reach the entire goal, I will use the money made so far to make as much progress as I can. Any contribution will go a long way.

    The Impact

    There is nothing out there for people in pain, a guide, or video to go along with.

    • I have created a unique method that takes you step by step through the entire duration of treatment.
    • We know there are many things on the internet, and it's easy to make an assumption that anything we find is the right choice. However, what I have observed with what is out there, often people get hurt or make their injuries worse. 
    • Often people who provide the advice, don't have the qualifications.
    • The world needs something like the Healing Yourself App and I want to make it a reality.
    • Please see the testimonial page on my website to hear real life stories.
    • Believe in me and I will make the change.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't afford a contrition to the campaign:

    • I need folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools or vist my websites:

    https://www.healingyourself.us
    https://www.facebook.com/pages/Healing-Yourself...
story_txt:
My
Dream. My Calling. Let's begin healing the World! 

My name is Dr. Brian Jones and I am ready to change the world through a dream.  Allow
me to explain why I do what I do. When I was a teenager, I severely injured my
lower back. Doctors told me I would never walk
again. Through determination, trial and error and with the caring support of
various physical therapists I was able to overcome the pain, the symptoms and to
learn how to walk, run, and live again. Everything I do has been as a result of
the things I have experienced throughout my life. Whether good, or bad, they
have all led me to this moment, and this opportunity. My dream is to create a
way to help people heal through physical therapy. People all over the world do
not get the care they need at the time they need it. We need to make
information and proper treatment accessible to anyone from anywhere at
affordable costs. I want to be the first to make this dream a reality. 


I believe in thinking outside of the usual parameters
of healthcare. I have created a brand new approach on how to heal, repair
peoples' bodies and get them out of pain. I know we can all live productive and
rewarding lives void of pain if given the right way to do it.
The
modern medical system is backwards, drugs and surgery first, rehab after. I
believe it should be the complete opposite; rehab first, and surgery only as a
last resort. It has been my experience that this method can actually fix the
issue, and it can all be done without pills, without drugs or injections and
especially without surgery. 


Not until the laws and practices of
medicine are challenged will we be able to truly live a healthier existence. My
dream is to help heal those suffering from acute and chronic pain throughout the world. I
hope to inspire everyone to make the difference in their lives, for themselves,
and for their families and loved ones. 


My goal is to create a thoroughly
beneficial, yet simple to use app that can be used by anyone from ages 9 to 90.
Are you ready to change the world with me? By creating this app, we will have
the opportunity to make a difference not only in the lives of people we know,
but every single person throughout the world who wants to say NO to pain. 
Please believe in me, and believe in my
cause. If you are the kind of person who wants to make a difference in the
lives of others by helping them regain control of their lives and giving them a
way to get out of pain, I have the solution for you. Help me heal the world in
contributing to my campaign to create this app!

  What We Need & What You Get 
I will need 40,000 dollars to pay for production of the video and creation of the app. I have funded everything on my own so far and need your help to make it real. 

The reason I became a doctor is just as big as helping the people I treat. I want and need to reach a bigger market, a global market. Help me reach the population I know we can.   Unique perks include: resistance bands, T-shirts, my book, stability balls and free subscription to the app when it is designed. 
 If I don't reach the entire goal, I will use the money made so far to make as much progress as I can. Any contribution will go a long way. 
 
  The Impact There is nothing out there for people in pain, a guide, or video to go along with.  
I have created a unique method that takes you step by step through the entire duration of treatment. 

We know there are many things on the internet, and it's easy to make an assumption that anything we find is the right choice. However, what I have observed with what is out there, often people get hurt or make their injuries worse. 
Often people who provide the advice, don't have the qualifications. 

The world needs something like the Healing Yourself App and I want to make it a reality. 
 Please see the testimonial page on my website to hear real life stories. 
 Believe in me and I will make the change. 
 
  Other Ways You Can Help If you can't afford a contrition to the campaign:  
I need folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools or vist my websites: 
 
 https://www.healingyourself.ushttps://www.facebook.com/pages/Healing-Yourself...

story:
My name is Sue Nicholoy and I am starting this fundraiser to help a young man named Steve Spisak survive. He made the mistake of putting his family and others first over his own dental needs, over many years. He is now faced with very serious health issues if this problem does not get corrected, and very quickly. He has tried all the local charities and they are apparently not equipped to help with this sort of predicament. The emergency dental clinic would not accept him without payment. The ER has turned him away because it is dental.

My faith tells me that others will feel the same way I do. No one should end up dying because they cannot afford dental care in the richest country in the world. If I could foot the bill for the whole cost, I would in a heartbeat.

Please help me show him that there is a very good reason to hold onto your faith.

With much gratitude and wishes for blessing upon you,

Sue Nicholoy

story:
Our online health-tracking tool is already helping people take control of chronic illness. 

Now we want to put it into the hands of even more people by building a companion mobile app. 

To do that, we need your help.

Find out...

The web-based Chronic Wellness Tracker helps people take control of chronic illness.

Did you know that 50% of the adults in this country have a chronic illness? Chronic illness touches all of us in some way or another. And while chronic illness can take many forms, it often leaves people feeling isolated, powerless, and unsure what to do. But people don't have to feel powerless in the face of chronic illness! 

If you have a chronic illness, the more you know about your symptoms, diet, activities... about which treatments work and which do not... the quicker you'll get better.  To help people on their journey to wellness, we created an online tool that makes it easy to gather and analyze this important data. It's a powerful tracking tool that can foster healing through better self-awareness, knowledge, empowerment, and hope. It's called Chronic Wellness Tracker, and you can try it yourself at cwt.ChronicWellnessTools.com.

Now we are bringing the power of mobile technology to Chronic Wellness Tracker, and we need your help. 

Take a Brief Tour of the Web-based Wellness Tracker.

See how our online tracking tool is helping people on their journey back to health.


It’s working! Each day, more and more people are using our website and discovering the benefits of Chronic Wellness Tracker. Let's help even more people by taking it mobile.


With our mobile app, you will be able to take the benefits of Chronic Wellness Tracker with you wherever you go. 

Preliminary designs for the mobile App.

See more design images in our gallery.

What's the next step?

If we meet our $27,000 funding goal, we'll be able to create an iOS mobile companion app to our online tracking tool that will run on iPhones and iPads, and perform some valuable upgrades on the online tracker.  This will allow  us to bring tracking to more of the people who need it most. Tracking is more powerful when people can enter and access their information whenever they want and wherever they are.

If we fall short of our goal but raise at least $15,000, we will build a “lite” version of the app that we can later expand into the full version. If we exceed our goal, our plan is to integrate more of our users' "wish list" feature requests, including a practitioner version. If you help really knock our funding out of the park, we can roll out the app to Android too, thereby reaching even more people.

Chronic Wellness Tracker helps people with chronic illnesses to:

  • improve quality of care - communicate more effectively with healt caregivers

  • empower themselves - make decisions based on real information and take the guess work out of care management

  • save money - eliminate ineffective treatments and supplements and avoid unnecessary appointments

  • save energy - focus their limited resources on high-priority issues

  • save time - accelerate their healing journey

The Story of Lindsay's Journey to Chronic Wellness.

"For more than a decade, I experienced mysterious symptoms that forced me to make significant changes to my life. Without a good diagnosis or a treatment plan, I had no idea what was wrong with me, who could help me, or what I could do for myself. Then I discovered an easy-to-use, incredibly effective way to give myself the knowledge and control I needed to get healthy again.

It's called tracking.

Tracking is all about gathering information that helps us learn more about ourselves and our health. I realized that the more I knew about my illness — how my symptoms reacted to things... which treatments worked for me and which did not... the impacts of stress, diet, therapies, and my activities — the sooner I would get back a sense of control and start making real healing progress.

So I tracked -- religiously. But I quickly realized that a huge part of making tracking effective was having a powerful, easy, and convenient way to do it each day.  I tried everything: I journaled, built spreadsheets, used applications. And while I continued to benefit from tracking, I really wanted ONE powerful, easy-to-use tool. I just couldn't find it.

So I teamed up with some friends to design an online tool that would enable people like me to track their symptoms and other factors that affect their health.  And Chronic Wellness Tracker was born.

If you have a chronic illness, Chronic Wellness Tracker can take the power away from your disease and put you back in the driver's seat. It's helped me on my journey back to health. I know it can help you, too."

Our online tool is already helping:

How Can You Help?

Join the mission to spread Chronic Wellness to people struggling with chronic illnesses.

Please enable me to help others on their journey to Chronic Wellness by clicking on the "Contribute" button now.

Any amount will help, no matter how small.

Whether you are able to contribute or share, thank you so much for your time and support!

In Gratitude - Lindsay Pera

Pledge Gifts

Make the Chronic Wellness Tracker companion mobile app a reality by directly funding our project. Donors will receive recognition (and gifts!) — in addition to the satisfaction of knowing that you will be helping people live happier, healthier lives.

Sponsors

Our Team

Together we can spread the message of Chronic Wellness...

story:
Summary:

My name is Chelsea Gray from Merrickville Ontario. I've been blessed with the most amazing family, friends, and community; but on July 5th, 2012 my life changed forever. On July 5th My father died from colon, lung, and liver cancer. He was diagnosed in April 2012 and was very sick for a very short amount of time. 

Last summer I kayaked the 200km Rideau River (Kingston to Ottawa) with my best friend, Julia, my brothers Robert and Michael and 31 others who have also been affected by cancer. Together we collected  roughly $40,000 that was donated to the Canadian Cancer Society. 

I'm looking for a goal of $1,000 to donate to Kayking for Cancer/ The Canadian Cancer Society. It could make a huge difference to a family, a community, and our country. Kayaking for Cancer has spent 12 years and roughly 95 days paddling 2,404 kilometres to raise over $455,00 for the Canadian Cancer Society!

On the website, http://www.kayakingforcancer.com/index.html , you will be able to see the groups' journey down the Rideau River through the Journal portion of the website. Someone from the Kayaking group will write a reflection on the day on the water and their personal reasons for kayaking. This way you will be able to see how your contribution has helped us help others!

So please donate for in memory of loved one who has either won or lost their fight with Cancer. Donate for the hope that the money could alter someone else's fate with Cancer. Any donation, large or small, is imporatant to the cause and very appreciated.

The Impact:

I have been involved in many fundraisers for Cancer but Kayaking for Cancer has a special place in my heart. Kayaking for Cancer is an amazing foudation that was started by a former guidence counciler at the high school I went to. He has buildt a truly unique way for people all over the Ottawa area to support the Canadian Cancer Society.Last summer kayaking was a fun and adventerous thing to do but it was also one of the best ways for me to grieve. Being active in trying to do something about the disease that took my father away from me gave me a purpose and a way to heal.

To get a further understanding of my connection to Kayaking for Cancer please feel free to read my personal reflection from kayaking in summer 2012, 

http://www.kayakingforcancer.com/2012/day2-page1.html

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't contribute please help me get the word out and share this campaign as much as possible! Thank you all so much, 

Chelsea

story:
Get the Edge!

Get the edge on your fitness goals! We are Active Edge Performance, a little family and some friends who design and manufacture nutritional and athletic health supplements. 

We just completed an upgrade to our best-selling protein, energy and weight loss powder drink mix formulation, BURN 250 NX  (the NX stands for No eXcuses). 

Our Stimulant-Free Energy and Weight loss drink mix is designed to create the following... 

  • Energy - go faster and farther WITHOUT caffeine or stimulants
  • Weight Loss - block carb absorption and increase metabolism
  • Endurance -  supports your long-term energy usage
  • Calorie Burn - increased heart rate leading to more calorie burn
  • Metabolism - speeds circulation
  • Recovery - Speeds muscle repair and less lactic acid build up

In short this new improved version of BURN 250 NX is the daily supplement that will enhance your performance if you take it before you work out!!!

    ALL NATURAL INGREDIENTS  *  SAFE  *  EFFECTIVE  *  MILITARY GRADE


What we need the money for...

We need your help to be able to manufacture a large enough quantity to receive volume discounts on the production. Additionally, we have been told that a soda manufacturer may try to block us from continuing to use the name BURN 250 NX, even though we have been using it for many years.    :-( 

Since we are just a little family business, we cannot afford to get into a legal battle with anybody, so we need your help coming up with a new name.  That is why we are offering you significant discounts off the retail sales price to be part of launching this revolutionary 3-in-1 product. We appreciate any help or referrals you can give us.  If you suggest the name we use there will be additional perks, prizes and promotions featuring you and your friends, as a way of thanking you for your help!


Some of the new additions to the ingredient list are...

Many of you reading this already use and loved our Burn 250 NX drink mix. We have enhanced the formula, adding even more natural ingredients to create more amazing results.

Naringenin. Naringenin is a flavonoid that promotes carbohydrate metabolism, reduces inflammation and strengthens the immune system 

Octopamine. Octopamine blocks fat absorption. 

Beta-alanine. Beta-alanine is an amino acid that increases muscular strength & power output and it increases anaerobic and aerobic endurance.

Alpha Lipoic Acid. Alpha Lipoic Acid, a fat and water soluble, ingredient that helps protect against oxidation stress and helps repair free radicals.


What You Get.

You will get the new formulation of BURN 250 NX at prices substantially below retail price. It is the least we could do to thank you for helping us get the volume discounts we need so as to mitigate the shipping costs to get the product to our customers. 

One tub provides a 30 day supply for the average sized person.  Big muscle men might use 1 and a half to two units per month.

Refer two friends and get a free one for yourself! (see the 3 for $75 option)

If you submit the winning name there will be additional perks, prizes and promotions featuring you and your friends, as a way of thanking you for your help!


Details.

We have a registered nutraceutical manufacturing laboratory standing by so we can have the first units of BURN 250 NX produced within two weeks putting down a 50% deposit. That means, as soon as we get halfway to our fundraising goal, we can start producing the product for shipment to you.  The final 50% has to be paid before the product leaves the manufacturing facility. The fulfillment center is ready and waiting to ship the product to your door.

Depending on how quickly people join in, we could potentially be shipping product to you within 30 days of starting this campaign (October/November).


If we exceed our goal.

If we exceed our goal we can do a larger production run and if we have enough we can then focus on developing our next product. This is something we would like your help with as well. If you could design your ideal health product, what would it be? What benefits are your seeking? We are happy to design something specific for you. The chances are that if you like it then others would like it as well.  This is how we started and how we would like to grow.

We cannot promise to produce every product suggested, but we will consider any ideas you might have and if we end up mass producing a product using your suggested formulation, we will of course give you some product free.


We have been manufacturing and selling athletic health products for over 10 years.

We have been doing this for over 10 years. One of the founders, Allan is a body-builder, Strong Man and Mixed Martial Arts Fighter by day and chemist by night.  He started out by testing all these products on himself.  Ask us about his formulas for adding bulk and brawn!


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you don't want to build muscle, have more energy/endurance or lose weight but you still want to help.  If so, kindly use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign with friends and family who might enjoy the product or video. Like one or all of our pages on Facebook

  https://www.facebook.com/gunsandbunspage?bookmark_t=page

https://www.facebook.com/Burn250?bookmark_t=page

www.Burn250NX.com

Thank you for your contribution!

  https://www.facebook.com/gunsandbunspage?bookmark_t=page
https://www.facebook.com/Burn250?bookmark_t=page
www.Burn250NX.com

Thank you for your contribution!

story:
Bañado Sur - Paraguay – Health, what matters most.

The Health Center is flooded! Help us improve it AMAZING REWARDS!

My name is Emilio Sanchez, I live in Asunción Paraguay, know where it is? Since I started helping people I haven’t stopped, I thank God, I am lucky to have a job, live in an apartment with my wife Alexandra, eat and live well.Unfortunately in my country, rarely (not saying never) people who need it most receive government help, it hurts my heart, seeing so many people who are not lucky enough to have what you and I have, to have parents who support you (I do not have them) and live well, I mainly concerned about the health of women, children and elderly people.

A neighborhood of Asunción (Capital of Paraguay) that the government forgot, forget and will continue forgeting. People like you, like me, but with fewer opportunities and luck in life.

Currently, the Health Center of San Blas in Bañado Sur of Asunción Paraguay go through the worst time, attending to their patients between puddles, which is gradually growing by the flood, the desperate residents organized raffles and food sales to raise funds because they call them "The Forgotten" they strove to lift up, at least a little of their Health Center, as the next closest is 19 miles away. You have a car? They don’t, you have private insurance, they don’t, you have a fridge full of food? they don’t.

We are raising funds to lift up this Health Center, as repeatedly we talked to the government, but the only thing they say is "No budget" but you know what? I look at the title of the main newspaper of my country "They self-assigned millions for fuel in the Supreme Court" for a total of $ 130,000 USD per year! Can you believe it? Fuel! Help us help.


CURRENT Statistics

Esstadisticas current real growth Paraguay River

¿What do I get?

We want to reach the goal to change the lives of these people, with the Hospital they deserve.

The money raised will go to the renovation and improvement of the Health Center of Bañado Sur, here is a list of everything that have to be bought; 

Rewards:

1$Eternal Gratitude! From our hearts to your email.

5$ Thanks for your support! We’ll send to your mail 10 photos in HD of the Health Center, plus 5 pictures of our dear Paraguay!.

HD video! You’ll love it!

25$ You’ll get a mail with a HD video of the Health Center plus a gratitude by mail.

Your name on the wall

79$ Placing your name on the Wall of the Health Centre + sending via email a photograph of the wall in HD.

139$, Get 6 unique cup holders! Made of Ñanduti! Beautiful!

Crafts Paraguay!

179$ Home Shipping of a traditional craft of my Country!, Ao Poi (Square tablecloth 52 x 52 inches) (132 cm x 132 cm). 


199$ Home Shipping of a traditional craft of my Country, Ao Poi ( Rectangular Tablecloth 52 x 70 inches) (132 x 177 cm). 

Ñanduti (Spider fabric)

349$ Home Shipping of a traditional craft of my Country, Ñanduti, Queen of the crafts, made 100% by hand.


Mens Wallet

499$ HomeShipping of 1MENS wallet of AKI, 100% imported cow leather, with belt.



Womens Wallet

499$ Home Shipping of 1 WOMENS wallet of AKI, 100% imported cow leather, with Ñanduti.



Piraju hammock!

749$ Home Shipping of 1 Piraju hammock (delicate fabric) “Paraguay” Written in it.


Got an iPad?

239$ Home Shipping of 1 iPad Aki napa Leather case




1.299$ Home Shipping of 4 AKI wallets (2 for women and 2 for men), 100% imported cow leather. FREE GIFT OF ONE TERMOS WITH YOUR NAME ENGRAVED WITH ÑANDUTI!




¿And if we don’t reach the goal?


We will use the money to renovate everything we can, buy fans, fix the floor or whatever the money help us with, You still receive your order, plus photos and videos.

    ¿Is this project important?

    You would help more than 1,000 families, more than 5,000 people to make their dreams of having a worthy Health Center for them actually come true. This is the first project we did through crowdfunding, we hope that the dreams of the children come true, thus to do good to them and to you, ¿Wouldn’t you feel butterflies in the stomach just by seeing those guys with such joy? Imagine, a Health Center with a nice floor, painted and plastered walls, fans for the comfort of the community, just think about it.

    ¿Is it really possible?

    YES IT IS! We have many hard-working people! Mainly in the community, some are bricklayers, others electricians, we have a whole team behind it waiting to buy materials to repair and / or build the Health Center! I know it is challenging! But hope is the last thing you lose, a bit makes a difference! I am TOTALLY CONVINCED THAT THIS WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH YOUR HELP! Your contribution will achieve to make this world a better place!

    You cannot give?

    Help us make this possible! Share with your friends! Family! If you Paraguayan relatives, neighbors, co-workers! It all helps!

    It is an endless chain, you share, your friends do it.

    I leave you with these two sentences;

    "Be supportive and you will change the world"

    "If one of our goals was to improve the quality of life of poor people, I feel that we would see less poverty on the planet."



    THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

story:
We are helping moms regain their core confidence after pregnancy and birth so they can be Stronger Mummies with Flatter Tummies

The Bellies Inc system uses our Core Confidence exercise program during pregnancy, and then again postpartum coupled with our revolutionary support top - The Ab Tank - that combines light compression with adjustable abdominal wrapping.   It is the most comprehensive maternal core system out there!  We struggled with mummy tummy ourselves and saw client after client unhappy and unable to lose their 'pooch' no matter what they tried!  We learned that it is a actually a condition called diastasis recti - a condition that affects most pregnant women yet that no one talks about or checks for!  The most frustrating part is that it can be minimized during pregnancy and restored postpartum with the first 8 weeks being the most critical.  


Recovery Starts While You Are Still Pregnant!

Rather than waiting until baby is born, we are preparing women for their recovery while they are STILL pregnant with our innovative core confidence exercise program used in pregnancy and again in the first 8 weeks postpartum.  


What Makes The Bellies Inc System Unique?

Our system is the only one that combines preventive exercise, restorative exercise AND our revolutionary support top - The AB Tank.  We have you covered from the inside out with a comprehensive system that delivers results!

Your complete system includes

  • an online preventive and restorative exercise program
  • 2 AB Tanks (so you always have 1 to wear while the other is being washed)
  • 1 AB Wrap 
  • 1 Wash bag (for the AB Tank that needs washing)

Special Indiegogo Pricing

The Bellies Inc system will sell for close to $200 but by pre-buying through our Indiegogo campaign we are able to offer you big discounts starting at just $63!


How Does It Help?

Our revolutionary AB Tank combines a cool, comfortable layer of light, targeted compression that helps heal the stretched, weak connective tissue with a fully adjustable wrap that helps realign the separated muscles.  It is lightweight, breathable and barely noticeable under clothing.  Designed to fit under the bust, it allows for easy breastfeeding while keeping you covered and confident and supported.  The best part is that it doesn't roll, or bunch but rather moves with you as you move allowing you freedom from bulky, boxy binders that confine you!

When you couple the AB Tank with our core exercise program, you will be prepared for birth and optimized for healing postpartum so you will be a stronger mummy with a flatter tummy!

The AB Tank is ideally designed for use in the first 8 weeks postpartum and we are often asked 'will it help me if I had my baby 2 years ago?'  For women who have had their children years ago, the AB Tank and Wrap may offer some support if they have a very large separation and/or very weak connective tissue.  Booking an assessment with one of our trainers as well as a pelvic floor physiotherapist are great options for you.  And don't forget about our Core Exercise Program that you can start on right away!  



Help us disrupt the prenatal fitness and wellness world for the better!



OUR GOAL - $10,000

  • 100% of all funds raised will go to finalizing our design, packaging, production costs, inventory and distribution, as well as marketing.
  • We are proudly Canadian and have sourced our fabrics and materials almost entirely in North America.  We will be manufacturing in Canada which allows us to better manage quality, timing and production.  Keeping sourcing and production close to home was important to us and was important to the moms we polled in our market research but the power of the internet and our strong affiliate network allows us to distribute worldwide.  
  • The perks we have created allow anyone to join us on our mission and take part in something BIG!  Perks for you, perks for the pregnant women in your life, and perks just because you think we have something important to share!  


Who We Are

We are Julia Di Paolo, Kim Vopni and Samantha Montpetit-Huynh and we are on a mission to abolish the Mummy Tummy!  For the past 3 years we have been working to create a system to help women prepare their bodies for birth and get their body back postpartum so they can prevent the dreaded after baby belly!

In 2010 we were 3 moms working independently in prenatal and postpartum fitness and physiotherapy all recognizing a huge void in the products, services and information available to women struggling with their bellies. Learn more here.

 

In 2011 our paths crossed and Bellies Inc was born - a unique partnership that combines our personal and professional experience from the last 10 years.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE SHARE SHARE!!!! We understand not everyone can donate but everyone can share!  PLEASE share our campaign with coworkers & friends, post on FB, IG, Twitter, Pinterest, forward links in emails, and use the handy Indiegogo "share" tools!  Moms to be need our help to become stronger mummies with flatter tummies.  We need YOUR help to spread the campaign and create some great buzz!  We are on a mission to abolish mummy tummy and your support will help make our mission a reality!  

PLEASE click on the Facebook link below and "LIKE" the Bellies Inc page - and please ask your friends to do the same!

FOLLOW us on Pinterest and Twitter @BelliesInc. Help us continue to build our fan base!

VISIT our website at www.belliesinc.com and take a look around then sign up to join our mailing list!

Thank You so much for your support, your shares, and your belief in us - we couldn't do it without you!  We are on a mission to abolish mummy tummy for good and giving moms and moms-to-be the gift of confidence!


Special Thanks

Sheena Repath - For more than we can say!! 

Kathy Marliss and Drew Mastromartino – For the videography

Brenda Knight - For helping us beautify the designs and making sure they fit!

Nadine Woods of Mayana Genviere - for providing us with some special perks!

Jordan Hellyer  - for the awesome website!


FAQs:

When will my product be ready?

We are targeting end of September for delivery for all finished goods. We will post updates as our campaign progresses but are confident that we will meet our target delivery time.

When do I get to pick my size and colour? 

We will send out a link once our campaign has been completed where you will be able to pick your desired size and colour.

Can I wear the product when I'm pregnant?

The AB Tank stands for After Baby (and it was cool that it also made the acronym for abdominals!) and is designed to be worn immediately after babe is born for the first 8 weeks postpartum.  The fit and function is not as applicable for pregnancy.

Can I wear the product if I had my baby 2 years ago?

The AB Tank is most effective immediately postpartum, however, some women who continue to have very stretched, weak abdominal muscles and connective tissue can benefit from wearing the AB Tank while doing the restorative exercise program.

Do you plan on making additional colours and styles available?

Yes! We have plans in the works for additional colors and a lot will depend on feedback from the campaign and as we launch the product.  Our staple colours are black and white - the ultimate layering colours but we do realize that some women want colour!  We'd love your feedback - what colours do you love and think we should offer?  What are your thoughts on additional styles?  Let us know what you think!

story:
A dear friend of many in Melrose, Massachusetts, Kristen White, made the following pitch to help raise funds for a specialty bicycle to help her daughter, Isabella, navigate her world in some of the ways the rest of us can.  Despite her significant mobility challenges due to Cerebral Palsy, Isabella fights every day to use special walkers and a mobility chair to get around her house. 

But when she seeks to join her friends or family to ride a bicycle, she has put herself at great risk on adapted traditional bicycles (think Teva sandals mounted to pedals to secure her feet), a problem that became painfully apparent recently when a bump in the pavement led to a fall, flat on her face.   Izzles dedicated parents are committed to giving their daughter every possible advantage despite the things they cannot change.  

Here was Kristen's pitch to friends to create a raffle of items to support this cause, a great idea for sure, but one which, with some community support, we can add to this endeavor and maybe help do them one better:

In her campaign for raffleable items, Kristen said:

"Izzles and I found a bike that is perfect for her at AbilitiesExpo a few weeks ago.  It's built for people with disabilities -- and unlike the one drawback of her older DIY model -- it CANNOT tip over (center of gravity is too low in the new one).  Tipping over is very problematic when you've got limited motor abilities and your feet are strapped onto the pedals -- unfortunately, we learned that the hard way.  Izzles and I started to brainstorm hard about how to come up with the $3855.60 to buy the  bike.  That's a big amount and those aren't dollars we have sitting in the checking account.   We decided to start with a Yard Sale.  Then we came up with the idea of asking friends if they had stuff they wanted to get rid of and might be willing to have us sell it.  Then we got the idea from a friend to add some raffle items."

As we all know, a raffle is a lovely idea, but through this online campaign, we can help this cause even MORE directly by delivering our good-will in a very direct, material and helpful way! 

Please help us help Izzles and Kristen change the things they CAN, by contributing towards a specially designed and constructed bicycle that will help Izzles share the joy of moving about her world like you and I can.  This will help her not only now, in her last years of high school, but as she bravely ventures forward into a college career, away from home, in the next couple years.  

This is ONE courageous young woman and ONE devoted family who wants the mobility for her child that the rest of us have the good fortune to take for granted every day of our lives.  Donate $25, $50, $100 or more to help bring Izzles both the navigation of her world and the sharing of these experiences, but also the knowledge that a caring community is behind her, supporting her in all of her endeavors.

Note --- As more than the usual expenses will be incurred as a result of Izzles going away to college (e.g. adaptive equipment, assistive technology, personal care assistants), any funds raised above and beyond our targeted goal will be of immense help in those challenging arenas as well.

story:
Leaders Inspiring Future Endeavors (L.I.F.E.):

HGC Lions F.C. Sports Program
  • My name is Carlos A. Miranda and I am a Youth Development Team Leader working for the Hector Garza Residential Treatment Center. I work with underprivileged youth as a mentor, coach and life skills instructor.
  • The faces of the residents in this picture are covered in order to protect their identities based on the HIPPA laws and regulations that the facility upholds and follows. Only with consent from their county we are allowed to publish their image,
  • With your help we can help change their lives.

  • HGC Lions F.C. Soccer Program

    of

    Leaders Inspiring Future Endeavors

    Leaders Inspiring Future Endeavors's HGC Lions Soccer Program partners with Lions F.C. Soccer Club, San Antonio Scorpions and St. Mary's University Women's Soccer Program to provide soccer, fitness education and mentorship to underprivileged youth all over the state of Texas who reside in the Hector Garza Center.

    Lions F.C. allows the youth of the Hector Garza Center to experience the culture of club soccer in the U.S. by providing professional soccer coaching and the usage of Pride Park (Lions F.C. Soccer Complex) to establish a remarkable experience that will last forever in their lives. Board Director and Lions F.C. senior coach, Joe Shafer, has spearheaded this movement along with Carlos Miranda to provide soccer coaching for the residents.

    The San Antonio Scorpions is a professional soccer team part of the North American Soccer League. The San Antonio Scorpions organization have provided outstanding support for this program in many ways such as free admission to the games for the residents, recognition for the residents who participated in the HGC Lions F.C. soccer team, free clinics and coaching by their professional coaches and players and tours of the Toyota Stadium. L.I.F.E. is looking into expanding and strengthening our relationship with the San Antonio Scorpions organization in order to provide underprivileged youth a chance to experience organized soccer.

    St. Mary’s University Women’s Soccer Team Head Coach, Corwyn Ritch, has been very enthusiastic about being part of this program. He provided 5 scholarships to his overnight 3-day ID soccer camp where the selected residents participated in practices, drills and coaching done by the head coaches of St. Mary’s University, Our Lady of the Lake University, The University of Texas in San Antonio, and University of the Incarnate Word. Coach Ritch has also expressed the possibility of free admission to St. Mary’s University Women’s Soccer Team games, clinics and mentorship by the college players and the possibility of recruitment if a child has the talent to play at the collegiate level.

  • Specific Objectives and Purposes of the HGC Lions F.C. Soccer Program

    The specific objectives and purposes of this program shall be:

    1.  To provide instruction in the discipline of soccer and a different experience to the lives of the youth who reside in the Hector Garza Center. The experience of organized sports can provide a different perspective in their lives as well as structure.

    2.  To use soccer and other organized sports as a means to help them focus on the treatment and education programs of the charter school that they attend while residing at the Hector Garza Residential Treatment Center (HGC). To provide some motivation and something to look forward to while they reside at the HGC. Soccer as an incentive for good behavior, successful discharge and good grades.

    3.  To sponsor the participation of the residents in a renowned charter school league representing the accredited charter school they attend while residing at the HGC.

    4.   To acquire and provide equipment, uniforms and facility improvements that would nurture and enhance the instruction of the discipline of soccer.

    5.  To expand our relationship with numerous soccer clubs and organizations in the state of Texas that would provide their support for this program.

    6.  To form a scholarship fund that will facilitate the membership of a resident or ex resident in any soccer club or organization in the State of Texas. Selected residents that would have a successful experience with the program and successful discharge from the HGC would acquire the opportunity to continue their endeavor in their place of origin.

    7.  To achieve that a resident involved in the HGC Lions F.C. soccer program acquires a soccer scholarship or any sort of scholarship to a university or college based on their involvement in the program, their talent or ability in the sport and their willingness to succeed in their endeavor. Our program offers underprivileged youth the opportunity to be exposed to multiple soccer organizations that can provide instruction, coaching, mentorship, networking that will increase the possibility of any resident to be recruited by a college or university soccer team.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking into expanding our programs into flag football and volleyball for the residents of the Hector Garza Center.
  • The Texas Charter School Academic and Athletic League (TCSAAL) flag football and volleyball leagues start September 9th. 
  • Deadline for the payment of the league is August 8th. 
  • You will get the satisfaction of helping underprivileged children something to look forward throughout their temporary stay at the Hector Garza Center. 

The Impact

L.I.F.E focuses on improving communities by making (recreating) better citizens. Our mission is to inspire the leaders of the future generation that will have a positive impact in our society by teaching them leadership skills and values such as teamwork, work ethic, respect and overcoming adversity.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Leaders Inspiring Future Endeavors (L.I.F.E.) is the first nonprofit organization in the city of San Antonio that services underprivileged/at risk youth from all over Texas by using soccer and other organized sports as a means to help them focus on the treatment and education programs of the charter school that  they attend while residing at the Hector Garza Residential Treatment Center (HGC).

The HGC is a temporary home for 133 children ages 11-17 who are under the Juvenile Probation Department (JPD), Child Protective Services (CPS) and sent  to the facility by their appropriate counties all over Texas.

Residents at the HGC receive education from an accredited school system that is contracted on a year to year basis that is located within facility grounds but does not sponsor any extracurricular activity for its students.

L.I.F.E. seeks financial resources/support for the extracurricular athletic programs of the charter school at HGC that directly benefit the treatment and education of the youth at the HGC. The residents represent the accredited school system of the HGC by enrolling them in a renowned organized charter school league that hosts competitive sports tournaments with other charter schools all over Texas.

Treatment, education and sports are the main tools that are used in our organization to provide an environment that promotes healing and change in the lives of the youth that reside within The Hector Garza Center, attend the accredited school system of the residential treatment center and will make a positive impact as leaders for the communities of Texas.

story:
Our Story

It is heartbreaking when you see your loved ones age and slowly lose their independence.  They become more and more reliant on special services and products.  Trying to find these services can be difficult for a family who wants their elder relatives to age at home gracefully.  Services can be unreliable, and only the best should be satisfactory for our loved ones.  This inconvenience forces many families to send their aging parents or grandparents to nursing homes, assisted care facilities, or relative’s houses.

Seniors don’t want to leave home.  According to the American Association of Retired Persons (AARP), almost 90% of people over the age of 65 wanted to spend their days at home.  Nursing homes don’t have to be the answer.  Not only are they expensive, but 94% of people in the US think it is important that their parent age at home.

“Though all the services may be available, Aging in Place is difficult because the services are not organized into an easily managed, systematic whole.”

                                                                                                 - MetLife Aging in Place Study

Our mission at AmelioCare, a social enterprise, is to give seniors the independence they need to stay at home.  We are the platform that will allow seniors and their families to connect with the products and services they need.  Simply login to our site and you are immediately exposed to the highest rated local health services and businesses. We provide the online, one-stop-shop for curated and reviewed products and services, specifically tailored for the elderly.

Businesses and services that list with AmelioCare will be reviewed by consumers and rated by AmelioCare employees.  Only those businesses and services that meet a minimum quality requirement will be approved.






Who We Are

We are a group of talented high school students at MIT, with skills ranging from marketing and finance to management and web development. We have all had experience working at or starting our own companies. We took this opportunity to make a genuine difference and solve a prominent problem in our society. 


What We Need

In order to launch this platform, we are asking for $5000. These funds will allow us to program the backend and database of the website. Here is the breakdown of funds:

  • $3000 - Sofware Development
  • $1000 - Marketing
  • $500 - Incorporation
  • $500 - Web Hosting and Database Storage 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    This project is something very meaningful for us. There are a couple ways that you can help us get the word out:

    • Share the Indiegogo campaign on social media sites like Facebook and Twitter
    • Email your friends and family the link to this campaign

story:
Short Summary

My name is Matej Bodul, I am the vice president and the co-founder of Zagreb Bulldogs Lacrosse Team from Croatia. We began our work in 2011 as a small group of lacrosse enthusiasts and throughout the years we grew into a team which successfully plays against and collaborates with other regional lacrosse teams (Budapest BLAX, Belgrade Zombies, Ljubljana Olimpija and Zagreb Bulldogs). Through this successful collaboration the teams decided to found a regional lacrosse league to promote lacrosse in this part of Europe. Because lacrosse is a genuine team sport in which players work together as one, we believe this initiative will help to bridge the gap and improve the relations between countries in this region. Lacrosse in this region is still developing and the support it can gain from sponsors and contributors is minimal, therefore, to achieve our goal we require financial support from contributors who believe in our vision.

What We Need & What You Get

To achieve this we need a minimal financial support. Because the average travel distance is around 300 kilometers (190 miles) the majority of the 15 000 USD we require would be used to cover travel expenses of each team competing in the League. Without these funds, all costs, from travel expenses and tournament fees to food and stay, have to be covered by the players themselves. This poses a serious problem due to a global and regional financial crisis and may take a toll on the player's morale. Each contributor, whether they donate 10 or 10 000 USD, will have their name written on the League's website "Wall of Gratitude", but larger perks (larger than 100 USD) will get signed photographs, T-shirts or jerseys and a personalized thank you card. Even if we do not reach our goal, all of the accumulated funds will go towards covering the most necessary player's expenses, such as travel expenses, food and stay, depending on the amount of funds accumulated.

The Impact

All regional lacrosse projects began with a small group of lacrosse enthusiasts. At first the teams did not have a proper place to train, nor even the basic equipment, but they were propelled by the player's enthusiasm and love for the sport. Due to generous donations from foreign lacrosse teams and other lacrosse enthusiast, we have been able to continue promoting this sport in the region, but we rely on further donations and your support to achieve our ultimate goal of founding the regional League.

Previous Projects

In January 2014, after a period of planning with our Slovenian and Serbian colleagues and in order to improve relations, increase cooperation and deepen the bond between these teams, a mixed team of Slovenian, Serbian and Croatian players called "Balkan Stars" was created and performed in "New Years Cup" in Budapest. The project was a success. We managed to field 20 players who, despite having different backgrounds, played as one and enjoyed it. We hope that this campaign will help create fertile ground for future projects such as these.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you support our goal but are unable to financially contribute, you can still help us! Spread the word because your word counts! The more people we reach, the closer we get to achieving our goal and the further we promote this "fastest growing sport in the world".

story:
As we ramp up production, there is still a limited time to pre-order a SunSprite! Head to SunSprite.com.







SunSprite is the first wearable device that tracks your daily light and sun exposure. Use it on its own to measure bright light, or sync it with your smartphone to measure UV index and to deliver a personalized set of goals and tips to make sure you get the right amount of bright light to support your healthy lifestyle.

SunSprite is a leap forward in wearable technology. It's completely solar-powered. No cords or plugs. No batteries to replace. No essential cable to forget in a hotel in Des Moines.Wear SunSprite anywhere with its advanced flexible magnetic clasp. We made the magnets strong enough to go through even the thickest of winter jackets (we live in Boston, so we know about this). Just clip it in a place that gets the same amount of light your eyes do, and let SunSprite do all the work.




Getting bright light at the right time of day is clinically proven to boost your energy and help you sleep better. See Bright Light & the Human Brain below for the science behind SunSprite and bright light.

SunSprite’s dual sensors measure the brightness of both visible and UV light so you can make sure you’re getting the right amount of light — enough visible light to be healthy while avoiding too many harmful UV rays. SunSprite's LED display (as well as its smartphone app) can tell you if the light you're in is bright enough to be beneficial.

On top of this, bright light has been linked to proper eye development, reduced incidence of ADHD, lower blood pressure, reduction in body fat, and strong Vitamin D levels.

You might be asking yourself: Can’t my eyes measure brightness?

Every morning’s brightness is different. And the pupils in your eyes constantly adjust to the light levels around you – this is how you can see things in both daylight and starlight. Unfortunately, this adaptability makes your eyes a bad judge of brightness. SunSprite makes it effortless to track all your light exposure – from bright, sunny days to sunset hikes with your pup.





Watch our CTO Kasey geek out about the amazing technology behind SunSprite.


On top of all that, we also have a wicked cool app. It was developed by Raizlabs, the same team that crafted RunKeeper. The SunSprite app is accessible on iOS-devices (iPhone 4S or newer). And don't worry Android users, your app is coming next!  Check out a few screenshots to see how SunSprite gives you the 360 bright light experience.



Light works through our eyes. (This is different from how vitamin D is produced, which is by UV light reaching our skin.) When bright light enters the eyes, it stimulates specialized receptor cells in the retina that have connections to the suprachiasmatic nucleus in the brain – the “master pacemaker.” From there, the effects spread – more widely than doctors and scientists once thought.

Bright light sets the rhythms of our bodies, our minds, and our lives. When those internal rhythms are out of sync with our day, we feel “social jet lag.” But it’s not just a feeling. “Circadian synchronization” improves sleep, mood, alertness, cognitive performance, and well-being.

Scientific studies over the last 30 years have concluded that light therapy is just as effective as antidepressant medication not only for seasonal depression (SAD) but also for non-seasonal depression. And further research has found that bright light may also benefit a wide range of medical conditions including insomnia, ADHD, Parkinson’s disease, and dementia.

Light improves the health of the healthy, too. Those positive effects on sleep, mood, alertness, cognitive performance, and well-being apply to everyone. In addition, a recent study found that adding morning bright light to a weight control program helps reduce body fat and appetite.


(Quick clarification -- the Suprachiasmatic nucleus doesn't control all your hormones, just a lot of them.)

Light is easy to get – if it’s bright enough, you only need 30 minutes a day. And because the beneficial effects of bright light come through your eyes, you don't even need to be outside. Small lifestyle changes, like eating your breakfast while facing a sunny window, can make all the difference.

For a more in-depth look at the hard science behind bright light and its benefits, check out the White Paper written by our medical co-founders, who are Associate Clinical Professors at Harvard Medical School who recommend bright light to their patients in their private practices.



We dream of brightening the lives of as many people as possible. But to do this, we need your help.

We’ve already done a lot on our own. We’ve finished design and development of SunSprite, and we have a handful of real, working prototypes (you saw them above!). We’re ready to send our designs off to a factory in the USA to be mass-produced, but we need to cover the up-front costs of producing each SunSprite. That’s why we’re asking for your support and contributions. 


We’re also asking for your feedback. We want to know how we could make SunSprite even better. We believe we have a great product, but we know that early adopters on the cutting-edge, like you, can offer suggestions that help bring SunSprite to the next level. So send us an email, post a comment, send us a carrier pigeon, or all of the above. We promise we’re listening. 


If you share our vision of making people healthier and happier using both nature and technology, please share this page with your friends and family to help us reach – and exceed – our goal. Bright light’s health benefits can help anyone, and we can’t wait to make the world a better place.



Here is what we have left to do: 

  • Finish factory tooling at our US factory (~8 weeks) 
  • Factory pilot production (~2 weeks) 
  • FCC Certification (several weeks)
  • Volume production (2 weeks) 
  • Order fulfillment & logistics (2 weeks) 
  • Shipping (1 week)
  • Delivery (mid-2014)


 

We are GoodLux Technology, a team of doctors, engineers, and designers that want to improve health on a global scale by re-imagining the intersection of technology and nature.  



Head to our FAQs page to learn more.




If you have questions, we can answer them. If you have comments, we want to hear them. And if you just want to say hi, well, we’ll say hi right back. Shoot us an email at info@sunsprite.com

Light works through our eyes. (This is different from how vitamin D is produced, which is by UV light reaching our skin.) When bright light enters the eyes, it stimulates specialized receptor cells in the retina that have connections to the suprachiasmatic nucleus in the brain – the “master pacemaker.” From there, the effects spread – more widely than doctors and scientists once thought.


Bright light sets the rhythms of our bodies, our minds, and our lives. When those internal rhythms are out of sync with our day, we feel “social jet lag.” But it’s not just a feeling. “Circadian synchronization” improves sleep, mood, alertness, cognitive performance, and well-being.



Scientific studies over the last 30 years have concluded that light therapy is just as effective as antidepressant medication not only for seasonal depression (SAD) but also for non-seasonal depression. And further research has found that bright light may also benefit a wide range of medical conditions including insomnia, ADHD, Parkinson’s disease, and dementia.


Light improves the health of the healthy, too. Those positive effects on sleep, mood, alertness, cognitive performance, and well-being apply to everyone. In addition, a recent study found that adding morning bright light to a weight control program helps reduce body fat and appetite.

(Quick clarification -- the Suprachiasmatic nucleus doesn't control all your hormones, just a lot of them.)Light is easy to get – if it’s bright enough, you only need 30 minutes a day. And because the beneficial effects of bright light come through your eyes, you don't even need to be outside. Small lifestyle changes, like eating your breakfast while facing a sunny window, can make all the difference.


For a more in-depth look at the hard science behind bright light and its benefits, check out the White Paper written by our medical co-founders, who are Associate Clinical Professors at Harvard Medical School who recommend bright light to their patients in their private practices.







We dream of brightening the lives of as many people as possible. But to do this, we need your help.



We’ve already done a lot on our own. We’ve finished design and development of SunSprite, and we have a handful of real, working prototypes (you saw them above!). We’re ready to send our designs off to a factory in the USA to be mass-produced, but we need to cover the up-front costs of producing each SunSprite. That’s why we’re asking for your support and contributions. 



We’re also asking for your feedback. We want to know how we could make SunSprite even better. We believe we have a great product, but we know that early adopters on the cutting-edge, like you, can offer suggestions that help bring SunSprite to the next level. So send us an email, post a comment, send us a carrier pigeon, or all of the above. We promise we’re listening. 



If you share our vision of making people healthier and happier using both nature and technology, please share this page with your friends and family to help us reach – and exceed – our goal. Bright light’s health benefits can help anyone, and we can’t wait to make the world a better place.


Here is what we have left to do: 


Finish factory tooling at our US factory (~8 weeks) 
Factory pilot production (~2 weeks) 
FCC Certification (several weeks)
Volume production (2 weeks) 
Order fulfillment & logistics (2 weeks) 
Shipping (1 week)
Delivery (mid-2014)

 
We are GoodLux Technology, a team of doctors, engineers, and designers that want to improve health on a global scale by re-imagining the intersection of technology and nature.
 



Head to our FAQs page to learn more.















If you have questions, we can answer them. If you have comments, we want to hear them. And if you just want to say hi, well, we’ll say hi right back. Shoot us an email at info@sunsprite.com

story:
We already have the fully equipped lab space and all the technical instruments needed to design and complete this product launch. We also have well established links with manufacturing and supply line companies both here in Australia and overseas. We aim to have a Beta model up and running in the second quarter of 2014, with the goal of being fully live by September.


Also works with Google Maps....

What we are using your money for. Your donations will help us bring this technology from the test bench into the modern smart phone and integrate our app with the emerging BT4 devices.

You will not be disappointed with the vast array of applications and integration into social media...


What’s Next?

As a campaign contributor your funds will go directly to the product development and commissioning cycle.
We already have the fully equipped lab space and all the technical instruments needed to design and complete this product launch. We also have well established links with manufacturing and supply line companies both here in Australia and overseas. We aim to have a Beta model up and running in the second quarter of 2014, with the goal of being fully live by September. Our experienced team has been hand picked to ensure this product line is completed on time and on budget.
Your funds will be used in the development and implementation of our technology on the smart phone platforms, primarily Apple and Android. And simultaneously enabling us to expand the Base Station network throughout the world. Any excess funds will roll into the development of personal Bluetooth 4 monitors and the incorporation of these products into the first release of our App.

The Team at E-PAFF are dedicated to keeping the lead time to the launch of the App as short as possible, while still delivering an incredible peace of technology that is years ahead of the competition. As first funders your contribution will put you ahead of the rest and enable your entry into this market at a reduced cost than non funders of the E-PAFF system, in short you will receive value for money with a real working system. You will then see the extra benefits the E-PAFF system will offer in your life, "if it saves you on one speeding fine then you will be miles ahead".

The Team at E-PAFF thanks you for your support.


Simply select the Perk that fits you
and then Donate NOW

story:
Who We Are:

The Carrizal Water Initiative is a joint effort between two non-profit organizations, FUPAC (http://www.fupac.org/) and UT for REED (http://sites.google.com/site/ut4reed/aboutus), a student organization at The University of Texas at Austin.

Project Goals:

The two organizations will be assisting the Dominican community of Carrizal this August to establish a sustainable, gravity-flow aqueduct and accompanying health and sanitation campaign that will serve to remedy Carrizal’s current water situation. To accomplish this, the following tasks will be central to the project:

1. The construction of a gravity-flow, PVC aqueduct water network

2. The installment of on-site clay filtration systems to remove water-born pathogens

3. The implementation of health and sanitation workshops in the community

Ensuring Sustainability:

Emphasis will also been given to the social infrastructure of Carrizal such that the project will be sustained beyond our organizations' presence in the region. With this in mind, we will also focus on the following:

1. The establishment of a standing water committee

2. The inculcation of a feeling of ownership by the community

3. The training of a group of local plumbers

4. The creation of a bank account to manage funds needed for upkeep

5. The establishment of a monthly quota for the water system’s use

Ultimately, the standing committee will develop a broader role in the community and elect a board of directors to make decisions regarding other environmental issues; it will also encourage a feeling of community responsibility for the system. Thus, through the implementation of the pipe system, the health/sanitation campaign, and the standing committee, FUPAC and REED hope to create a long-lasting, comprehensive water solution for the region.

story:
Our Story

According to experts from the University of Minnesota and the Mayo Clinic, one in three Minnesota adults is either diabetic or pre-diabetic, and one in four is obese.  The CDC reports that adults with disabilities have an even higher rate of obesity.  The team of researchers believe that even modest increases in daily activity could help people lose weight and improve their health.  Disabled adults may not have access to recreational activities, and they or their caregivers may need instruction and reminders on proper nutrition and lifestyle choices.

Angie and Ryan Green have created a fun and informative 30-day Wellness Challenge designed specifically for adults with disabilities living in group homes.  They have consulted with a number of field professionals to put together a customized, engaging, hands-on experience.

Every free session for a group home with four residents includes:

  • $350 worth of handouts, positive behavior tracking displays, a blender, and 60 servings of free healthy shake product for group home residents and staff,
  • pre- and post- evaluations to gather information, and
  • Kickoff and Awards parties with fun prizes!

Laura Green (blue shirt in the picture) is our inspiration.  She is Ryan's older sister.  Family is her utmost priority, she has a wonderful sense of humor, and is an accomplished bowler.  She competed in the World Special Olympics in China!  She was recently diagnosed with diabetes.


The Impact

We want to offer this free resource to 10 group homes in Minneapolis, Minnesota - each home to four residents. That means we can touch the lives of 40 adults initially, and equip a similar number of staff members to keep the excitement, rewards and nutrition going.  


We know at the end of these 10 free sessions we will have gathered enough pre- and post- data, success stories and connections that will enabled us to seek a permanent funding source through a foundation.  We will be able to expand the number of sessions, the locations we reach, and add an online kit package for purchase.  


What We Need & What You Get

Each class contains $350 worth of materials, supplies and prizes.  We also need to put together promotional materials and account for IndieGoGo fees.  Our funding goal is to be able to put on 10 classes.  If we don't reach that exact target, we will use your hard-earned money to put on as many classes as we can.  


We sincerely appreciate your consideration of our idea and appreciate your donation.  We can't thank you enough!  As a small token of our appreciation, we will give you a full instructional guide on the 30-Day Wellness Challenge so you may share it with someone special in your life, or someone in your community whom may gain a benefit from this program.  You also have the option of receiving personal recognition on class materials.  


Would you like to spread the excitement about wellness to special needs adults in your community?  Join us as a Team Collaborator and let's work together to touch the lives of people across the country!


Other Ways You Can Help

Do you like what you hear?  Please consider sharing this campaign with your friends - it just takes a minute and you can use the share tools!

story:
Hey Everyone, My girlfriend Chris has taken the incredibly brave first steps to getting clean and  sober.  She's struggled all her life and is really responding well to her in-patient treatment.  She has huge support from the local music community and they wanted to know how they can help, so I set this up so anyone can contribute to the day to day expenses she has.  

She is currently uninsured, and will be paying the whole thing off herself, but, she has great friends, and  great support and you'll really be helping save her life.  

If we get enough to cover some cash so she can be more comfortable while she's inside, great!  If we get enough that will help her continue on to Sober living and support her while she makes this transition, and maybe help pay some medical bills, even better!  Every dollar helps!
