story:
Meet Orlando..

 Orlando Mendoza is a current undergraduate majoring in Biology (Pre-med).  He is dynamic, charismatic, and a natural leader. He is ambitious in the best sense—he has goals much loftier than many would expect of a young man of his background. He is highly interested in public health and infectious diseases (HIV, Malaria, and MDRTB) in understanding the biological, social, political, and economic determinants of disease around the world. He initially became interested in global health through a course from Paul Farmer, and envisions working for the United Nations World Health Organization as a traveling doctor one day. He is both humbly and passionate about building a global community. Orlando resolves to meet each challenge with resilience, passion, and hard work. He shows great tenacity and ingenuity in overcoming the obstacles he has faced, they have broadened his perspective, and given him the confidence that he need to surpass whatever awaits him.  Orlando would like to thoughtfully explore the challenges of implementing HIV treatment and prevention in rural areas of Africa, a topic on which he is sincerely intrigued by. The primary goals of Orlando’s endeavors are not personal gain, but service to others. Likely because of the many challenges Orlando faced as an adolescent, he has a holistic view of global poverty, and he easily grasps the interrelatedness of health disparities here in the United States and around the world. Orlando will let no obstacle come between him and his dreams.

Location: Muhuru-Bay Division, in Nyatike District, Under Migori County in Kenya

Did you know…?

Diarrhea kills 2-million children per year- UN, WHO

One child dies of a preventable death every 30- seconds.

Soap usage can reduce diarrhea rates from 30-60 percent…

 

ABOUT: â€¯One major challenge to the rural development in Kenya is the death rate which often comes as a result of HIV & AIDS. 

FACT: â€¯Men are more prone to stigma than Women. â€¯ 

THE IDEA: â€¯A group of 30 women, surprisingly have their own empowerment group, and they are all HIV positive and are all widows taking care of orphaned children too.

WHAT DO THEY DO FOR A LIVING? Being that they are all coming from along the lake, they practice Village Commercial Sex Work with fishermen and anybody who has thirst for sex. They have to exchange their bodies with fish so that they are able to bring food on the table. They use their income from sex to rear chickens, make Mary-go-Round contributions, and buy food.  

HOW DANGERIOUS IS THIS? In a month, they can have sex with a minimum of 5 different people and max of 27. They rarely use a condom because most fishermen still believes in myths about condom use. They are not alone, after having heart-to-heart discussions with them, we have realized that there are many more women and girls like them who are not in their group but exchange their body for food. 

WHAT DO THEY WANT TO DO WITH THEIR CHICKENS? They have so far managed to buy 41 chickens, and they hope to be able to sell the chickens and start up a sustainable business in the future once the number of the chickens grows high. These are local breed chickens, and they are just locally kept without proper care since they cannot afford to start up a reasonable chicken project because of the poverty situation.  

POTENTIAL SUSTAINABLE PROJECT: After several meetings with them, we did market research on several business options which could sustain their family needs, so they can stop the sex for food exchange, which risks life of everyone in the community.   

THEIR PROPOSAL: â€¯We need your help to purchase soap making mold and equipment that will be used to start a soap making project. Your funds will buy local merchants in Kenya for the 30 women and enable them start up a sustainable project. â€¯We plan to spend weeks with the women to train them on how to make good products. We also plan to help them with marketing their products too, and then leave the equipment for them to use to provide themselves an income for their family. 

HOW CAN YOU MAKE A DIFFERENCE NOW: â€¯We need to raise $7,500 in order to buy mold that has the capacity of making 200 bars soap a day. These women have agreed to sign an agreement to quit sex once they have this project and they will also create employment to 10 women after every 6 months plus take their girls to Secondary School. 

Expenses

        One Motor Soap Machinery  (1,000 soaps/day)  $ 2,200.00

+      One manual mold (200   soaps/day)

         Kenya Intellectual Property   Institute (registration for branding)   $ 800.00

                          + Kenya Bureau of   Standards (stamping registration)

              Packaging Materials (i.e.   cartons, wrapping paper, renting a   $   800.00

                                         Product space, stationary, painting of space) 

             Training materials (including:   training manuals, soap mixing   $   700.00

                                 materials,   soap mixing ingredients; start-up cost)

                                                                              Airfare transportation   $ 3,000.00

                                                                                                Total           $ 7,500.00

 

OUR TIMELINE FOR RAISING THIS MONEY: â€¯30 days and I know we can make this difference with your kind and humble support 

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T MEET OUR MONETARY GOAL? â€¯These women will continue their sex for food exchange and keep on infecting many people with HIV and AIDS, the project won't get funded, and we won't be able to start this sustainable business idea. We’re afraid we will have an entire infected community, and this is why we need your help now. 

WHAT IF WE MEET THIS GOAL? â€¯We will purchase the mold and equipment supplies, start off the training by June 14th to June 19th of this year and start our first implementation by 21st of the same month. I will keep the records for a few weeks; our partner MOSIKO will help the women for two months, since I will return to the US, and we will oversee any potential challenges to be addressed before occurrences. 

  1. Focus on women and gender equality.
  2. Encourage community ownership and invest in a social entrepreneurial-led plan.
  3. Build economical sustainability through the use of a system of multiple benefits.
  4. Strengthen and promote key leadership organizational skills with the villagers and service-based groups.
  5. Decrease HIV/AIDS rates.
  6. Incorporate strategic coordination and integration.
  7. Develop metrics, monitor progress and evaluate.
  8. Strengthen research and innovation.

During the implementation of our project, I will provide a course to educate the Muhuru-bay community about the origin, causes/effects of HIV/AIDS, and provide informative materials about safe sexual behaviors.

YOU SHOULD HELP: â€¯We both know the risk of having a sick, poor, and begging society. This is a risk we cannot let our world face in the future; our children and our children’s children need a future free from poverty and beggars. 

Thank you for making a difference, we look forward to hearing from your positive response. Feel free to contact me directly with any question that may arise at: omendoza1@live.com

 

Visit our website to see more pictures and learn more about us: www.wix.com/omendoza1/thesoapproject

story:
Dear friends,

We are a group of students from the College of William and Mary, and we are working to raise funds to assist a Peace Corp volunteer by the name of Ryan Browning in installing water storage tanks for the community of Agua de Luis, Dominican Republic. This storage tank can hold up to 10,000 liters of rainwater for families without access to clean water. Every dollar donated will go directly to buy materials, not to any administrative or overhead costs. All project labor will be donated by members of the community. Citizens of Agua de Luis have been working to raise their promised portion of the investment, and we are now trying to help Mr. Browning raise the remaining $3000 necessary to complete the project. Furthermore, we want to use kickstarter to fund $500 for a part of $3000 we want to raise, which is almost one water tank for one family. As we will be visiting this community, we would love to be able to bring a donation with us to help accomplish this wonderful project.

Current Community Status:

Agua de Luis (“Luis’ Water”) consists of roughly 90 families and around 400 residents.  The population is a mix of both Dominicans and Haitians.  Located 18 kilometers north of the nation’s principal highway and 20 kilometers south of the Atlantic Ocean, Agua de Luis is a community without water, electricity or a paved road, yet still able to sustain its economy through agriculture.  The revenue generated from selling dairy milk and harvesting tobacco are the main sources of income.

The community endures a lack of a permanent, sustaining water source.  In this dry climate, families depend upon capturing rain water during the brief rainy season each winter.  In order to capture the rain, community members utilize their available roof space and have put up both zinc and plastic gutters to direct the flow of water to large, above ground cement tanks.  During the late 1990’s a European development organization named Prolino built numerous 5,000 liter tanks for individual households.  However, many families still lack a large storage tank thus rendering their existing system ineffective.

Project Objectives

Our proposed plan is to build ten (10) 10,000 liter tanks for ten (10) families that currently do not have a means of storing rain water.  Each benefiting family will provide 5,000 pesos (US$128) and a portion of the work brigade.  In addition, the community’s water committee will provide the framework for planning and implementation.  Local masons and skilled labor will be trained in ferrocement technology by current Peace Corps Volunteers. Building one tank takes 5 days, thus resulting in 2 solid months of construction to complete all ten tanks.

Project objectives include providing a means of storing large quantities of rain water to be used for human consumption as well as agricultural, cooking, bathing and cleaning purposes. Another objective involves training local masons and skilled labor how to work with ferrocement technology as a means of augmenting their work potential.  We are aiming at achieving sustainability by implementing this project through the community’s self run water committee. The committee has been meeting monthly for the past year and has already begun collection payments from the 10 families.   

Progress to Date:

A 3-month Peace Corps Community Diagnostic was completed upon Ryan's arrival to Agua de Luis, based on interviews and appropriate observation techniques with 90 families.  The diagnostic provided significant information regarding the current water use, access to water, methods of collecting rain water as well as the potential effects of composting latrines, cement floors and environmental education.  By broad consensus it was agreed that rain water catchment systems are the community’s greatest need.

In order to carry out the various water related projects that were mentioned during the Diagnostic, a community wide Water Committee was formed.  Meeting once a month in the local community center, members have overseen the completion of 40 Bio-Sand Water Filters provided for by Rotary International as well as the installation of 80 rain water catchment systems which utilize 3” PVC pipes.  The construction of the aforementioned tanks remains the Committee’s first and most important goal.

The Committee has begun to collect monthly payments from the beneficiaries which are deposited in a dedicated account.  Local masons attended the construction of a similar rain water storage tank in a neighboring community to better gain an understanding of ferrocement technology.  Various local NGOs have agreed to observe construction as a possible means of future implementation should the demand be there.  

Category                                   Price ($RD)              Price ($US)

Sand, Gravel & Cement                           $50,830                $1303.30

Construction Materials                          $82,323.75           $2,110.85

Plumbing                                           $7,495                  $194.05

Skilled Labor                                     $55,000                $1,410.20

Labor (donated by community)                     $75,000               $1,923.08

Beneficiary Contribution                        $25,000                $641.03

Total                                            $295,648.75          $7,582.51

Labor (donated by community)                  -$75,000              -$1,923.08

Beneficiary Contribution                        -$25,000               -$641.03                              

Solicited Funds Total                             $195,648.75          $5,018.40 

P.S. Main description is written by Ryan Browning who is currently in Agua de Luis working on the project.

story:
NOTICE

We had accidentally set up this campaign in USD and can't change it back to CAD. We created a new one as it represents a barrier for most people in Canada.

To donate to this campaign, please go here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/healthcare-for-deepan--4/x/4581521#/

Thanks!

Justice for Deepan Team

story:
Short Summary

Like hundreds of thousands of other people living in Canada, Deepan is being denied healthcare because of his immigration status. As you know, Canada refuses to recognize Deepan's citizenship, and is attempting to cast him out of his home. Because Canada ties healthcare to immigration status, he finds himself among the ranks of those that are either denied healthcare entirely, or that must battle with a bewilderingly complex bureaucracy to obtain even the most basic coverage. Even though the Federal Court ruled in July of 2014 that the government's 2012 retrenchment from refugee healthcare was "cruel and unusual", immigration status is still used to deny healthcare to Deepan and more than half a million other people excluded from status in Canada. 

Deepan is, of course, fighting this arbitrary withdrawal of a right that he has exercised for more than 23 years in this, his home country. However, it is a long and uphill battle and, in the meantime, Deepan has no coverage and no safety net. 

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking you to give the gift of health by contributing to the purchase of health insurance for Deepan for one year. Insurance for someone in Deepan's strange and precarious position costs approx. $2200 per year. But that doesn't cover things like blood work, prescriptions, and other services not related to emergency situations. So we are asking for a bit more, just in case Deepan needs to go and see a doctor within the next year. In total, we are hoping to raise $2650  to be added to another $350 we've already raised. 

For every contribution of $25 or more, Deepan will send you (or a person of your choosing) a personal thank you on a holiday greeting card. Making a donation in someone else's name makes a great and meaningful gift for those you love. Cards will be sent as soon as possible after your donation is made. 

The Impact

Deepan’s campaign provides an opportunity for us to speak out against the cruel practice that now prevails in our country to deny those in need medical services based on immigration status. We encourage you to give the gift of health to Deepan this holiday season and to join us in trying to protect those that have been deprived of health care by our government. 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Endorse this statement to demand that Deepan’s citizenship be immediately restored: http://www.justicefordeepan.org/ 

2. Forward this campaign to your friends! Like our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/JusticeForDeepanBudlak... follow us on Twitter (@Justice4Deepan)!

3. Donate to the legal defense fund within your means. Sign up to give a regular contribution every month: http://www.justicefordeepan.org/what-you-can-do...

story:
Project Johnson is the name we’ve given our campaign to renovate Johnson Park in Grandville, MI. Once the host of a World Championship for disc golf, Johnson Park has suffered over the years from theft, littering and a lack of course updating. While being one of the more challenging layouts in the Grand Rapids area, the course itself lacks the basic amenities of a modern disc golf course.

GRDGU (Grand Rapids Disc Golfers Unite) is a club and online community of disc golf players, distributors, and fans in the greater Grand Rapids area. Since 2014, GRDGU has been running our own summertime traveling league, tag league, and other special disc golf competitions. We can be found at http://www.grdgu.com

We need funding! We estimate that for 18 new baskets, solid surfaces for tee pads and a few renovations that need to be done to the course to ensure the best result for not only the park but for the residents surrounding the course we will need approximately $18,000. Any funding past our goal will be put in the park's official account used for upkeep and course maintenance. While $1,000 a hole seems steep, we have to factor in other costs such as all the merchandise, Indiegogo's 5% cut, as well as 5% which we have agreed to pay to Johnson Park for various fees.

 Any contribution to the cause is going to be a huge help. Even if it is only $1. But if you can give more, we have awesome donation size based prize tiers that include Mini Markers, getting your name placed on a donor board, Sweatshirts, Hats, Discs and if you’re really interested, we can name a hole after you or your business.

We at GRDGU are confident that by starting this campaign, the only risks would be slight time delays. We have invested many hours and have had conversations with the great people who run the Kent County Parks Department and the people in charge of Johnson Park specifically. We have been assured that the project is green-lit and all we have to do at this point is raise the necessary money to get it done.

Basket Prices -

Baskets: $400.00 x 18 = $7200.00

Locking Collar Assembly: $15.00 x 18 = $270.00

Anchor Assembly: $25.00 x 18 = $450.00

Concrete (Approx. 1 cu.ft. Per. hole): $4.00 x 18 = $72.00

Powder Coating: $80.00 x 18 =$1440.00

Number Plates: $20.00 x 18 =$360.00

Handling Fee: $500

Total Basket Costs: $10,292.00

Tee Pad Prices -

Concrete (Approximately 34, 60 lb. bags):$75.00 x 18 = $1,350

Forms:$15.00 x 18 = $270

Tee Sign/Posts costs: $ 60 x 18 = $1080

Total Tee Pad Cost: $2700

Installation Labor Estimates -

Clearing Fairways (Estimated): 12 hrs.

Baskets: 4 hours each (estimated): 4 hrs. x 18 =72 hrs.

Tee Pads: 8 hours each (estimated): 8 hrs. x 18 =144 hrs.

Signage: 1 hour each (estimated): 1hrs. x 18 = 18 hrs.

Total Installation Labor Hours: 246 hrs, Cost: $0 (volunteer help from local clubs)

Possible Additional Items -

Donor Signs/ Bench: $350

Trash Cans (to keep course clean): $540 ($30 x 18 holes)

Obstacles for course (elevated basket):  $480

Equipment Rental for Installation:  $390 ($195 daily)

Total: $1760

Merchandise for Indiegogo Perks - $1454

5% percent donated to Johnson Park - $900 (if $18,000 is raised)

5% percent fee for indiegogo- $900 (if $18,000 is raised)

TOTAL ESTIMATED COSTS: $18,006.00

If the goal isn't met, the amount of money raised will be donated to the already existing Johnson Park Disc Golf Fund. Our backers will still receive the merchandise perks that they qualify for. However, the "Pin" and "Sign Sponsors" perks will not be paid out as they can only exist upon completion of the course renovation. In other words, we can't put baskets up until we have all 18 ready to install, so your money will be held in the fund along with all of your information for use when the installations are completed. Also, a new campaign will begin until we meet our goal and we will continue to campaign for this until it is funded 100%.

If you can't help financially, don’t worry. We’re eternally grateful if you can give even just one dollar. Seriously, something as small as one dollar can make a great difference to this project. However, we do understand not everyone can give money. That is okay. If you can’t help by donating money, tell your friends. Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or any other social media. If you don’t participate in social media, tell your friends about the project. The more people who know about this, the better, and word of mouth goes a long way in our community.


Thank you for reading, sharing, donating and your overall support.


Sincerely,

All of the members of GRDGU,

Brandon Braisted, Scott Stacey, Alex Schackow, Chadwick Smith and Cory Whitten GRDGU and Project Johnson Directors

story:
Dear All,

My name is Wekem Raymond Avatim. I am 38 years old. I am from Ghana, West Africa. I am in the USA for 4 months thanks to a US State Department funded exchange program. I work with ECO City Farms learning sustainable agricultural to take back home to help rural farmers to improve their practices. I have been living in Hyattsville, Maryland since August 2014 and plan to return home at the end of November.

About one month ago, I received the painful news that my 20 year-old brother, Kwotuo Avatim, was thrown from a motorbike while on an errand. Roads in rural Ghana are notoriously in poor shape with lots of large potholes. It was one such pothole that caught the wheel of the bike on which he was riding and my brother was badly injured. I am told the accident has impacted his spine with multiple fractures.  He is now paralyzed from the waist down and has been hospitalized for close to 4 weeks.  Since the accident, Kwotuo has experienced no relief from his suffering. The care he received has been minimal.  Just recently, he was transferred by car almost 400 miles to the country’s second biggest hospital, the Komfo Anokye Teaching Hospital.

Since the accident, Kwotuo has been unable to urinate or defecate due to his paralysis. He has not been administered medicine. The doctors now give us two options. Either we:

(1)  pay a minimum of $3,000 US dollars to cover only the cost of operating on him immediately, or

(2)  have him discharged as is. 

The required $3,000 does not include expenses related to his hospitalization and medication.  There is no health insurance policy that covers these expenses.  I have been the head of my family since my dad passed away 2 years ago. My family is unable to meet these costs and are looking to me to provide the support. However, I cannot afford this much money.

The doctors state that my brother Kwotuo has a 50-50 chance of being able to walk again after the operation, but that at least he will be able to perform basic bodily functions. I am seeking support from you to enable my family meet the cost of his operation that will at least enable him to recover sufficiently to be able to freely urinate, go to toilet and sit up. My family and I are grateful for any support you can offer.

Sincerely,

Raymond

Meet Wekem Raymond Avatim, Director of Livelihoods and Food Security Development at SEND-Ghana, currently Agricultural and Food Systems Associate, ECO City Farms, Maryland

Raymond has over eight years work experience in managing and coordinating livelihood security initiatives in rural communities Northern Ghana. As the Director of Livelihoods and Food Security Development at SEND-Ghana, his work involves the design, development, and implementation of initiatives that strengthen and empower local communities to drive their own development processes and build resiliency to climate change.

Raymond focuses on building the organizational capacities of community institutions (family-based farmer co-operatives and credit unions) to ensure sustainability in areas that include: agriculture production and market access, food security, community nutrition security, gender-based programming and women initiatives (gender model families and micro finance), climate change adaptation, partnership building and networking, peace animation, reproductive health and participatory approaches to rural development.

Raymond has dedicated his entire lifetime to helping others.  Today he and his family need your support.  His brother was injured since Raymond has been living here in Hyattsville, MD and studying/working at ECO City Farms, in order to transfer this knowledge to subsistence farmers in Ghana. 

ECO City Farms is conducting this campaign to raise $4,000 immediately. Please contribute generously what you can. All proceeds will go toward Raymond's brother's care. Thank You.

Teaching Hospital. 
Since the accident, Kwotuo has been unable to urinate or defecate
due to his paralysis. He has not been administered medicine. The doctors now give us two options. Either we:
(1)  pay a minimum of $3,000 US dollars to cover only the cost of operating on him immediately,
or 
(2)  have him
discharged as is.  
The required $3,000 does not include expenses related to his hospitalization and
medication.  There is no health insurance
policy that covers these expenses.  I have been the head of my family since my dad passed away 2 years ago. My family
is unable to meet these costs and are looking to me to provide the
support. However, I cannot afford this much money.
The doctors state that my brother Kwotuo has a 50-50 chance of being
able to walk again after the operation, but that at least he will be able to
perform basic bodily functions. I am seeking support from you to enable my
family meet the cost of his operation that will at least enable him to recover
sufficiently to be able to freely urinate, go to toilet and sit up. My family
and I are grateful for any support you can offer.
Sincerely,
Raymond
Meet Wekem Raymond Avatim, Director of
Livelihoods and Food Security Development at SEND-Ghana, currently Agricultural and Food Systems Associate, ECO City Farms, Maryland

Raymond has over eight
years work experience in managing and coordinating livelihood security
initiatives in rural communities Northern Ghana. As the Director of Livelihoods
and Food Security Development at SEND-Ghana, his work involves the design,
development, and implementation of initiatives that strengthen and
empower local communities to drive their own development processes and build
resiliency to climate change. 
Raymond focuses on
building the organizational capacities of community institutions (family-based
farmer co-operatives and credit unions) to ensure sustainability in areas that
include: agriculture production and market access, food security, community
nutrition security, gender-based programming and women initiatives (gender
model families and micro finance), climate change adaptation, partnership
building and networking, peace animation, reproductive health and participatory
approaches to rural development.
Raymond has dedicated his
entire lifetime to helping others.  Today
he and his family need your support.  His
brother was injured since Raymond has been living here in Hyattsville, MD and
studying/working at ECO City Farms, in order to transfer this knowledge to
subsistence farmers in Ghana. ECO City Farms is conducting this campaign to raise $4,000 immediately. Please contribute generously what you can. All proceeds will go toward Raymond's brother's care. Thank
You.

story:
Hi everyone,

My name is Rebecca and I created this campaign to:

1) Get rid of the stigma that comes with Mental Illness 

2) Raise money for the Brain and Behavior Research Foundation 

This foundation says states that "100% of all donor contributions for research are invested in NARSAD Grants leading to discoveries in understanding causes and improving treatments of disorders in children and adults, such as depression, schizophrenia, anxiety, autism, and bipolar, attention-deficit hyperactivity, post-traumatic stress and obsessive-compulsive disorders". Here is a link to there website for more information: 

https://bbrfoundation.org     

Feel free to email me at:

embraceyourbeautymark@gmail.com

story:
From the sleep lab

In 2007 a group of volunteers would participate in a world first sleep trial. Their experience would change their lives forever.

Once poor sleepers, these volunteers would experience dramatic improvement. They were able to fall asleep sooner and have less wakefulness across the night.

Published research from the scientists demonstrates that on average, users experienced a: 

  • 28 minute reduction in time awake across the night,
  • 30 minute reduction in sleep onset latency,
  • 67 minute increase in total sleep duration across the night.

 

Join the community  

The sleep conditioning technique used has been designed into a small smart ring called Thim. The same University sleep scientists whom carried out these trials were so passionate about these results – they worked along side our team to bring Thim to the world.

What started as an experimental sleep trial in 2007 is now the worlds most advanced wearable for sleep. Sleep well tonight, get the most from tomorrow.

More than sleep tracking – better sleep  

When ready for bedtime – place Thim on any finger. Thim will emit a soft vibration to gently wake you after 3-minutes of sleeping.

This process is repeated, providing a series of short 3-minute naps. It’s this process of falling asleep and then waking which conditions you to sleep better – as demonstrated in two University trials. In the morning , most users do not remember being woken. This is because drifting between the earliest stages of the sleep cycle are subtle.

These naps are delivered during the first stage of your sleep cycle – typically the first hour of bedtime. After this, you’re able to enjoy a long nights rest.

This conditioning program is a simple technique used by sleep clinics for over 10 years. Our team worked with Professor Leon Lack to imbed this program into a wearable device which you can use in your own home.

 

Sleep tracking 

Thim detects the onset of sleep to the nearest minute. No other wearable device comes close. The world first application of sleep re-training demands accuracy. Thim delivers. 

Thim emits a soft vibration each minute. When you feel this vibration you respond by making a subtle movement with your finger. This tells Thim you are awake. When you fail to respond, Thim knows you've fallen asleep. This method of tracking sleep onset (time taken to fall asleep) is proven to be as accurate as the equipment you would find in a sleep lab. And is much more accurate than popular sleep tracking devices which rely on actigraphy alone. 

One popular sleep-tracking wristband was cited for misjudging sleep onset (the beginning of stage 1 sleep) by 15 minutes; with such inaccuracy the current crop of wearable devices are simply unable to facilitate sleep re-training. These applications demand to-the-minute accuracy. Thim delivers.

 

Beautiful design

 

 
 

We've blended the latest in sleep science with organic design. We wanted this technology to represent the ability to disconnect and dream. Thims incredible design includes:

  • 100% silicone band for those with sensitive skin
  • 4X bands so you can select the perfect fit
  • Premium polycarbonate housing 

 

Your sleep dashboard  

Thim connects to your smart phone via Bluetooth low energy technology. This allows you to program your device. It also allows your sleep data to be transferred from your device to your smart phone in real time. 

Specifically, your dashboard will show: 

  • Sleep onset latency (time taken to fall asleep each night) 
  • Stages of sleep and their duration 
  • Frequency and duration of waking episodes 

The Thim App calculates your sleep score so you can track your progress. You can also share you raw sleep data with your health care professional. The Thim App will be available free of charge. 

 

Smart alarm

Waking up in the morning during a light sleep stage is a more pleasant experience than waking from a deep sleep stage. When Thim senses you’ve entered a light stage of sleep – Thim will wake you up. 

Here's how your new Smart Alarm feature will work. Open the Thim App in your smart phone and set an alarm window before you go to bed. For example, if you need to wake up by 8:00am, you might like to set an alarm window of 7:30 – 8:00am. If you are in a light stage of sleep at 7:30am, Thim will wake you up. If however, you enter a light stage of sleep at 7:55am – Thim will only wake you then.

The Smart Alarm can be used in conjunction with the Sleep Re-training feature. That is, you may undertake 1-hour of sleep re-training between 10pm and 11pm, and then use your Smart Alarm in the morning to wake up. 

 

everyone is talking about Thim... 

 

Features 

 

 

From scientific research which started in 2007

 

Poor sleep leaves you feeling tired and lethargic. This can impact your relationships with friends and family, as well as career success. It is unfortunate that so many in our community are unable to live the life they aspire to because of an inability to fall asleep and stay asleep. 

Professor Lack and his colleagues went in search of a new way to improve sleep. One which would be simple and effective. Their research showed that sleep re-training can reduce time taken to fall asleep by 30 minutes and increase time asleep by almost 70 minutes (Harris et al, 2007 & 2012).

But despite these breakthrough findings, sleep re-training was only used by experts. Expensive lab equipment was needed to pin point the moment someone would fall asleep to begin counting down from 3-minutes. This made sleep re-training too expensive. Popular sleep tracking devices were inexpensive, but inaccurate.

The researchers compared the accuracy of sleep lab equipment to someone physically responding to a tone. They found that a tone was accurate for determining when you enter Stage 1 of your sleep cycle. This finding allowed our team to work with Professor Lack to design a new wearable device for sleep. 

“… sleep re-training is expensive. Many people who need it can’t afford it...Let’s hope this Australian study stimulates the creation of such home (sleep re-training) programs.”  Harvard Health (Skerrett, 2012)

 

Our previous work 

Professor Lack has been our a friend and collaborator for a long time. In 2012 we worked together in designing the Re-Timer light therapy glasses. Re-Timer has received worldwide acclaim and been featured by many major news outlets.

“I think they are a break through... I’m a huge fan” - Dave Asprey, Bulletproof founder & New York Times bestselling author

 

Your team

We're a balanced team who love bringing the latest in sleep science to the community. We did it in 2012. Now we're back to do it again.

 

 

The journey 

 

All too often advancements in science are left in the lab. Not this time. This is a chance for pioneering research to make its way into the hands of the community.

What better place to seek support than through a community based platform. It’s up to the people. You can help us ensure this breakthrough does not remain hidden inside scientific journals forever. 

Thank you for your support.

Leon, Vera & Ben.

story:
Trust us, not every type of diabetes is the same and Unfortunately, Diabetes, still doesn't have a cure yet so th
e only option for people living with diabetes is to manage their diabetes in a much better way.

We understand how difficult the diabetes management process is, especially for children with Type 1 diabetes, people with visual impairment, hearing impairment and senior citizens so we created Diabeto, a complete management system which will help people living with Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes to get better insight and take necessary steps to live a better quality of life!

Yahoo: https://in.specials.yahoo.com/news/diabeto--a-startup-that-beats-diabetes-in-an-innovative-way-122546499.html

Intuit: http://smallbusinessindia.intuit.in/interview-business-profile/featuring-diabeto/

The Hindu: http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/bluetooth-device-to-track-blood-sugar-levels/article3904651.ece

Indian Express: http://www.newindianexpress.com/lifestyle/health/article1416199.ece?

Business Today: http://businesstoday.intoday.in/story/indian-start-ups-braving-odds-to-develop-world-class-medical-equipment/1/189640.html

Business Standard: http://www.business-standard.com/article/technology/how-low-cost-med-tech-will-transform-india-113061801192_1.html

Your story: http://yourstory.com/2014/07/diabeto-alpha-testing/

More press coverage here


Diabeto is a complete diabetes management system which consists of a non-intrusive bluetooth powered accessible hardware device that enables the transfer of blood glucose readings from your Glucometer into a smartphone. These readings are then stored securely on a cloud server for easy access to your data, anywhere, anytime!

Your can access this data on smartphone application (Diabeto mobile application), website application and also on pebble watch. 


Diabeto System

Diabeto is a combination of,

1. Diabeto hardware which transmits readings from the Glucometer into smartphone.*

2. A smartphone application which gives detailed trends and insights about your Diabetes. These readings are securely pushed onto a secure cloud server.

3. A web application/interface which pulls the readings from the cloud server and give detailed insights similar to the Diabeto application. The web application is useful for remote monitoring by parents and healthcare practitioners.

4. A pebble watch display for remote monitoring The readings are pulled from the Diabeto cloud server thus making your data easily accessible from anywhere. 

* In case of Accuchek Glucometer users, one needs to buy another hardware Infra red jacket called Diabeto IR Jacket

Easy 

Using Diabeto is super easy! After taking your blood glucose reading from your Glucometer. Switch on your Diabeto using the power button. Plug it in the Glucometer, start the Diabeto application and voila, the readings are synced wirelessly from the Glucometer into your smartphone.

What's more, it has a smaller footprint and a beautifully thought ergonomic design and can be easily carried around with you in your pocket or Glucometer pouch.

Beautiful

Design is as important as technology to us! Rather, its usable, functional design which is appealing to every age group was the top priority. That's what we came up with (And this is not just an idea, below are the actual images of the alpha testing prototypes which were shipped to alpha testers across the world)


Simple

Diabeto system comes with a free mobile application which gives you deep insights on your data. Diabeto application is the heart of the Diabeto system.

We have designed the Diabeto application keeping the UX and UI elements to be simple and yet intuitive for children as well as senior citizens. With the application, you can track, your mood, food, medication (Insulin intake), physical activity and relate it to your blood glucose levels which are transferred automatically from the Diabeto hardware.

Diabeto application automatically plots beautiful graphs which would give you an idea on your trends over the week, month, year. Also you can select custom dates and generate PDF reports which you can email to your healthcare practitioner for his opinion.

We have alpha tested the iOS application and You can use the iOS application even without the Diabeto hardware and yes, its completely free. Our team is working hard on the Android application and we are actually coding it as you read this sentence! Diabeto would be compatible with iOS and Android.

The mobile application pushes the readings to a secure cloud server which are then accessed securely with an easy to understand web application. The web application gives insights on Glucose trends over a period of time along with other parameters captured in the mobile application.

Moreover, one can access readings from the application and cloud server directly onto a pebble smart watch. This is extremely useful for remotely monitoring children's diabetes by parents or healthcare practitioner.


Secure

Diabeto cloud storage backend uses industry standard SSL technology to encrypt and secure Diabeto's data. Moreover, the data is encrypted before being stored at backend cloud server. In addition to the cloud security, here are some salient features about the system (In accordance to HIPAA compliance),

1. Secure access to Diabeto data on mobile phones via unique user identification.

2. Encryption of all the data which is stored on mobile devices as well as cloud server. The Diabeto hardware birdie is just a transmission device and no data whatsoever is stored on the hardware device.

Diabeto IR adapter

For awesome people using Accuchek range of Glucometers, we have designed another cool piece of hardware to transmit the readings from the Glucometer via Infra Red protocol. The Diabeto IR adapter plugs into Diabeto birdie device and then transmits the readings wirelessly to the Diabeto mobile application.



Currently, we are compatible with 25 Glucometers which are popularly available all over the world. However, trust us, we are working on making your favorite Glucometer compatible with Diabeto. If you have question about Glucometer compatibility, do not hesitate in getting in touch with us. Here is the list of the compatible Glucometers.


Diabetes doesn't discriminate and hence we have studied the accessibility and tried to make Diabeto hardware accessible so that it can be used easily by,

1. People with visual impairment.

2. People with hearing impairment.

3. Children (With Type  1 Diabetes).

4. Senior citizens.


We were learning accessibility with the help of our friends at Barrierbreak, the leading firm for accessibility testing in India.  The awesome folks at Barrierbreak did a detailed review of the hardware and suggested us changes to make it more accessible and we have finished incorporating 90% of those changes in the Diabeto birdie. You can check the video featuring Priti Rohra, Head of Accessibility at Barrierbreak here,



The hardware accessibility would include the hardware plus the packaging. We would be working on software mobile accessibility and web application.

We have been helped and benefited tremendously by the open source community. We wanna do our bit and give back and hence have decided to make Diabeto hardware open source which means the schematic, design files and bill of materials would be open source. You can download the files right now in here.

Developers? We are not leaving you behind...

You guys have a kickass mobile application but...you want to integrate accurate readings from Glucometer into your application, Worry not, we are also working on Diabeto API so that you can integrate readings from Diabeto hardware onto your awesome mobile application.
For Electronic Health/Medical Record (EHR/EMR) companies, hospitals and institutions which want to use Diabeto in remote settings or in your organizations, Diabeto API is going to do wonders.


We have been researching on Diabeto since 2.5 years. Since then we have been sketching, prototyping, hacking hardware, 3d printing and trying to write code on a daily basis. Yes, even on weekends! (Well, almost every weekend)


We have designed and prototyped 3 versions of Diabeto and recently, we also shipped two batches of Diabetos (We had received 223 applications from 22 countries) which were compatible with iOS applications. Partly, the alpha testing was assisted by University College London, UK and ChiMed. The testers helped us with bug testing and reporting and gave us valuable feedback on Diabeto iOS application. This is the final 3d file of Diabeto prototype casing hardware which was shipped to alpha testers.


And here is the final prototype packaging with prototype quick start guide and prototype manual and of course the actual Diabeto prototype hardware.

And here is an alpha testing video of the iOS demonstration. All credit goes to our awesome friend Erin Little who heads a not for profit organization Sucre Blue which is dedicated to provide affordable medical care to people living with Diabetes in India.


We already have received CE (Class 1a device) certification for Diabeto but to be able to bring Diabeto in USA, we need to file for a FDA (Food and Drug Administration) 510(k) premarket notification and that's where you come in the picture. If you live in the United States and pledge for Diabeto, you will be eligible to take part in the research study and give feedback about Diabeto. This research study will happen in the framework of clinical studies. You will receive an invite for the clinical study and would be eligible for the same ONLY IF YOU OPT-IN. For each study, you will be contacted and you will have to sign a informed consent form.

The first steps for the research study would involve the following,

1. We would send you information about the study and informed consent form.

2. After you review the information and only if you sign the informed consent form, you will be eligible to take part in the research study and ONLY then you will receive Diabeto hardware device from us.


Timeline


Technical Specifications

There are more than 346 million people living with Diabetes and unfortunately even our parents are living with Diabetes. We started working on Diabeto to make the lives of our parents better. We are a mix of passionate geeks with varied experience ranging from pharmacy, management, coding and scaling previous startups.

Remember, yousendit.com? (Now Hightail) Amir was the co-founder of yousendit.com and Shreekant was the 5th employee at yousendit.com while Hemanshu has successfully heading marketing at a ticketing startup in India. We have experience in creating and scaling startups and have come together to fight for a common cause - Diabetes!





In late 2012, we had received $30,000 from a private angel investor and $40,000 grant from the government of Chile as a part of Start Up Chile program. Team Diabeto has bootstrapped and invested the rest of the money from individual savings and bank loan. We plan to use the Indiegogo money in the following way,


And when we reach our goal, our biggest inspiration, Diabeto Rockstar would be super happy and hence we have included his smiley pic in the infographic to support him and make Diabeto a reality!


We have been researching, prototyping, testing and repeating the entire process since 2.5 years. We have been even backed by the Government of Chile. We owe a lot of our success to them. Yes, medical device research takes time since we have the responsibility to deliver a quality product which is subject to research, testing and certification.

The following are the challenges which we would be facing in the near future,

1. Regulatory challenges:

We already have carried out testing and have obtained CE certification for the hardware device and we can legally sell in Europe, UK, parts of Africa and Asia.

The product has received Class 1 certification for CE and we are fully aware that we need to file for FDA 510(k) pre-market notification in order to sell Diabeto to USA. However, we already have identified regulatory experts who can help us with the filing. Moreover, we have a few hospitals who are ready to help us with the accessibility testing, the data of which would be submitted to the FDA. Aqnd also not to forget, we are going to file the 510(k) pre-marketing notification with your help (Do take part in the study if you are in USA, without signing the consent form, we cannot ship Diabeto to you).

2. Manufacturing challenges: 

We have launched the Indiegogo campaign in order to enter into the manufacturing phase. The manufacturing would involve creating molds and tooling to manufacture Diabeto casing and different parts. This process is complicated and hence there might be a delay in the manufacturing process. We are completely aware of this process and situation and hence we have been taking various steps to mitigate this delay and delay risk by following ways,

1. Adopting Total quality management techniques (TQM processes) and Lean manufacturing processes.

2. We have already identified the manufacturing partners which are locally accessible to our entire team. Thus, we would personally inspect the whole manufacturing process and also make sure that the testing and quality check is carried out in our presence. 

We are here to provide a quality product in your hands and our main goal would be your 100% satisfaction. So if there are speed breakers in the delivery process, we would make sure to mitigate the errors/delay and deliver a quality product in your hand in the given time schedule.


Share our Diabeto story and earn $ credit 

So you have pledged for your awesome Diabeto but you still wanna give back and share your good karma by spreading the word about Diabeto and eventually spread awareness about Diabetes. Don't hold back, sharing is caring and its super simple! When you become the Diabeto backer and share the links on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Google plus, Instagram, Tumblr etc) and when people buy Diabeto from your shared link, you will get dollar credit back. In fact, you can even get all your money back which you pledged for Diabeto. Sharing the word is super important to us and to the community, if you wanna really see Diabeto fly, you won't hold back and will share this campaign with your friends, family and relatives.

Click here to know more about the referral program and get $ credits


1. What is Diabeto application and how will it help me?

Diabeto application is the heart of Diabeto and it will not only help you manage your diabetes in a much better way but also help you lead a better life by taking control of your diabetes.

2. How much does the Diabeto application cost?

As of now, the Diabeto application is free and it will always be free for users who have already downloaded it.

3. Is my data secure if I lose my phone?

Yes! The main purpose of Diabeto application is that your data needs to be secure and safe because data is king. Moreover, we use industry standard safety protocols to encrypt your data and transmission is secure too.

4. I don’t see any support phone number for calling?

Unfortunately, we only have email support for now and you can email us to support@diabe.to and we promise we will get back to you as soon as possible. Trust us!

5. I don’t have Diabeto hardware, can I still use Diabeto application?

Yes! You can still use the Diabeto application to manually log your blood glucose readings, however, keep in mind that your accuracy will be hampered because of manual error.

6. My glucometer doesn’t work with the Diabeto application…

There are minimal chances that your glucometer is still not compatible with Diabeto. For a list of compatible Glucometers and how to operate them, check the section “Compatible Glucometers” in the side menu of the application iOS application also here is the list for your quick reference

1. Accuchek Aviva plus

2. Accuchek Compact plus

3. Accuchek Nano

4. Bayer Breeze 2

5. Caresense N

6. Caresense N Pop

7. Contour TM

8. Contour TS

9. Contour Next EZ

10. Glucocard Vital

11. Glucocard 01

12. Mendor

13. One touch Ultra 2

14. One touch Ultra Easy

15. Reli-On Confirm

16. Reli-On Prime

17. Freestyle Lite

18. Bayer Contour plus

19. Accu chek aviva nano

20. Accu chek performa nano

21. Accu chek performa

22. Accu chek active

23. Accu chek ultra mini

24. One touch ultra mini

8. Does Diabeto hardware work with my diabetes application which I am already using?

Since we will be releasing the Diabeto API, it would be totally possible to take readings from your fav. Diabetes application (other than Diabeto) with the help of Diabeto hardware.

9. Where are you guys based?

We are a startup based in India and US.

We are sure, you would be having more questions and you can absolutely reach us at contactus@diabe.to and we promise that we would get back to you within 48 hours. Moreover, the entire list of FAQs can be found in here

We are entering into a business of helping others and we have been inspired by many cool people who already are giving their time and money to people living with diabetes in order to make their lives better. One such non-profit organisation is Spare a Rose. You can read their full story here.

As a part of Diabeto Karma campaign, for every Diabeto which you buy, we are gonna donate $5 to Spare a Rose until 17th February 2015.


We have come a long way and this wouldn't have been possible without you! Yes, you, you awesome Diabeto supporter, we know you are gonna support us and bring a smile on people living with Diabetes!

In addition, we would like to thank a few awesome people who have been with us along this journey with us and have supported us: Our families, without you, this wouldn't have been possible, Sudhir Jain, Shruti Jain, Mahesh Pawar, Simone Beg and Salim beg, Vincenzo Bruno - you have been a guiding star and simply amazing, Begonia Ochagavia and the entire crew at Startup Chile - without you, we won't have reached this far, Jubin Mehta, Alok Soni and awesome guys at YourStory, Laura a.k.a Ninjabetic, Annabel Astle, Renza Scibilia, the entire crew at Tidepool, Anool Mahidharia for helping us with everything Hardware, Amir Butt for the constant motivation, Joe Chawki for being such an inspiration, Dominic Furniss, Aisling O'Kane, Fariat and all the awesome people at University College London and Chi-Med - thanks for your support during the alpha testing phase. You guys rock! :)

Lets make Diabeto a reality!
story_txt:
Trust us, not every type of diabetes is the same and Unfortunately, Diabetes, still doesn't have a cure yet so the only option for people living with diabetes is to manage their diabetes in a much better way. We understand how difficult the diabetes management process is, especially for children with Type 1 diabetes, people with visual impairment, hearing impairment and senior citizens so we created Diabeto, a complete management system which will help people living with Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes to get better insight and take necessary steps to live a better quality of life!



Yahoo: https://in.specials.yahoo.com/news/diabeto--a-startup-that-beats-diabetes-in-an-innovative-way-122546499.html
Intuit: http://smallbusinessindia.intuit.in/interview-business-profile/featuring-diabeto/
The Hindu: http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/bluetooth-device-to-track-blood-sugar-levels/article3904651.ece
Indian Express: http://www.newindianexpress.com/lifestyle/health/article1416199.ece?
Business Today: http://businesstoday.intoday.in/story/indian-start-ups-braving-odds-to-develop-world-class-medical-equipment/1/189640.html
Business Standard: http://www.business-standard.com/article/technology/how-low-cost-med-tech-will-transform-india-113061801192_1.html
Your story: http://yourstory.com/2014/07/diabeto-alpha-testing/More press coverage here





Diabeto is a complete diabetes management system which consists of a non-intrusive bluetooth powered accessible hardware device that enables the transfer of blood glucose readings from your Glucometer into a smartphone. These readings are then stored securely on a cloud server for easy access to your data, anywhere, anytime! 
Your can access this data on smartphone application (Diabeto mobile application), website application and also on pebble watch. 






Diabeto System
Diabeto is a combination of,
1. Diabeto hardware which transmits readings from the Glucometer into smartphone.*
2. A smartphone application which gives detailed trends and insights about your Diabetes. These readings are securely pushed onto a secure cloud server.
3. A web application/interface which pulls the readings from the cloud server and give detailed insights similar to the Diabeto application. The web application is useful for remote monitoring by parents and healthcare practitioners.
4. A pebble watch display for remote monitoring The readings are pulled from the Diabeto cloud server thus making your data easily accessible from anywhere. 
* In case of Accuchek Glucometer users, one needs to buy another hardware Infra red jacket called Diabeto IR Jacket


Easy 
Using Diabeto is super easy! After taking your blood glucose reading from your Glucometer. Switch on your Diabeto using the power button. Plug it in the Glucometer, start the Diabeto application and voila, the readings are synced wirelessly from the Glucometer into your smartphone. 
What's more, it has a smaller footprint and a beautifully thought ergonomic design and can be easily carried around with you in your pocket or Glucometer pouch. 







Beautiful
Design is as important as technology to us! Rather, its usable, functional design which is appealing to every age group was the top priority. That's what we came up with (And this is not just an idea, below are the actual images of the alpha testing prototypes which were shipped to alpha testers across the world)






Simple
Diabeto system comes with a free mobile application which gives you deep insights on your data. Diabeto application is the heart of the Diabeto system.





We have designed the Diabeto application keeping the UX and UI elements to be simple and yet intuitive for children as well as senior citizens. With the application, you can track, your mood, food, medication (Insulin intake), physical activity and relate it to your blood glucose levels which are transferred automatically from the Diabeto hardware. 
Diabeto application automatically plots beautiful graphs which would give you an idea on your trends over the week, month, year. Also you can select custom dates and generate PDF reports which you can email to your healthcare practitioner for his opinion.


We have alpha tested the iOS application and You can use the iOS application even without the Diabeto hardware and yes, its completely free. Our team is working hard on the Android application and we are actually coding it as you read this sentence! Diabeto would be compatible with iOS and Android.The mobile application pushes the readings to a secure cloud server which are then accessed securely with an easy to understand web application. The web application gives insights on Glucose trends over a period of time along with other parameters captured in the mobile application. 




Moreover, one can access readings from the application and cloud server directly onto a pebble smart watch. This is extremely useful for remotely monitoring children's diabetes by parents or healthcare practitioner.
Secure


Diabeto cloud storage backend uses industry standard SSL technology to encrypt and secure Diabeto's data. Moreover, the data is encrypted before being stored at backend cloud server. In addition to the cloud security, here are some salient features about the system (In accordance to HIPAA compliance),1. Secure access to Diabeto data on mobile phones via unique user identification.
2. Encryption of all the data which is stored on mobile devices as well as cloud server. The Diabeto hardware birdie is just a transmission device and no data whatsoever is stored on the hardware device.


Diabeto IR adapter
For awesome people using Accuchek range of Glucometers, we have designed another cool piece of hardware to transmit the readings from the Glucometer via Infra Red protocol. The Diabeto IR adapter plugs into Diabeto birdie device and then transmits the readings wirelessly to the Diabeto mobile application.





 

Currently, we are compatible with 25 Glucometers which are popularly available all over the world. However, trust us, we are working on making your favorite Glucometer compatible with Diabeto. If you have question about Glucometer compatibility, do not hesitate in getting in touch with us. Here is the list of the compatible Glucometers.









Diabetes doesn't discriminate and hence we have studied the accessibility and tried to make Diabeto hardware accessible so that it can be used easily by,
1. People with visual impairment.
2. People with hearing impairment.
3. Children (With Type  1 Diabetes).
4. Senior citizens.


We were learning accessibility with the help of our friends at Barrierbreak, the leading firm for accessibility testing in India.  The awesome folks at Barrierbreak did a detailed review of the hardware and suggested us changes to make it more accessible and we have finished incorporating 90% of those changes in the Diabeto birdie. You can check the video featuring Priti Rohra, Head of Accessibility at Barrierbreak here,The hardware accessibility would include the hardware plus the packaging. We would be working on software mobile accessibility and web application.











We have been helped and benefited tremendously by the open source 
community. We wanna do our bit and give back and hence have decided to 
make Diabeto hardware open source which means the schematic, design 
files and bill of materials would be open source. You can download the 
files right now in here.







Developers? We are not leaving you behind...
You guys have a kickass mobile application but...you want to integrate accurate readings from Glucometer into your application, Worry not, we are also working on Diabeto API so that you can integrate readings from Diabeto hardware onto your awesome mobile application. For Electronic Health/Medical Record (EHR/EMR) companies, hospitals and institutions which want to use Diabeto in remote settings or in your organizations, Diabeto API is going to do wonders. 

We have been researching on Diabeto since 2.5 years. Since then we have been sketching, prototyping, hacking hardware, 3d printing and trying to write code on a daily basis. Yes, even on weekends! (Well, almost every weekend)

We have designed and prototyped 3 versions of Diabeto and recently, we also shipped two batches of Diabetos (We had received 223 applications from 22 countries) which were compatible with iOS applications. Partly, the alpha testing was assisted by University College London, UK and ChiMed. The testers helped us with bug testing and reporting and gave us valuable feedback on Diabeto iOS application. This is the final 3d file of Diabeto prototype casing hardware which was shipped to alpha testers. 
And here is the final prototype packaging with prototype quick start guide and prototype manual and of course the actual Diabeto prototype hardware.

And here is an alpha testing video of the iOS demonstration. All credit goes to our awesome friend Erin Little who heads a not for profit organization Sucre Blue which is dedicated to provide affordable medical care to people living with Diabetes in India.


We already have received CE (Class 1a device) certification for Diabeto but to be able to bring Diabeto in USA, we need to file for a FDA (Food and Drug Administration) 510(k) premarket notification and that's where you come in the picture. If you live in the United States and pledge for Diabeto, you will be eligible to take part in the research study and give feedback about Diabeto. This research study will happen in the framework of clinical studies. You will receive an invite for the clinical study and would be eligible for the same ONLY IF YOU OPT-IN. For each study, you will be contacted and you will have to sign a informed consent form. The first steps for the research study would involve the following,1. We would send you information about the study and informed consent form.2. After you review the information and only if you sign the informed consent form, you will be eligible to take part in the research study and ONLY then you will receive Diabeto hardware device from us. 
Timeline







Technical Specifications











There are more than 346 million people living with Diabetes and unfortunately even our parents are living with Diabetes. We started working on Diabeto to make the lives of our parents better. We are a mix of passionate geeks with varied experience ranging from pharmacy, management, coding and scaling previous startups.
Remember, yousendit.com? (Now Hightail) Amir was the co-founder of yousendit.com and Shreekant was the 5th employee at yousendit.com while Hemanshu has successfully heading marketing at a ticketing startup in India. We have experience in creating and scaling startups and have come together to fight for a common cause - Diabetes!






































In late 2012, we had received $30,000 from a private angel investor and $40,000 grant from the government of Chile as a part of Start Up Chile program. Team Diabeto has bootstrapped and invested the rest of the money from individual savings and bank loan. We plan to use the Indiegogo money in the following way,


And when we reach our goal, our biggest inspiration, Diabeto Rockstar would be super happy and hence we have included his smiley pic in the infographic to support him and make Diabeto a reality! 
We have been researching, prototyping, testing and repeating the entire process since 2.5 years. We have been even backed by the Government of Chile. We owe a lot of our success to them. Yes, medical device research takes time since we have the responsibility to deliver a quality product which is subject to research, testing and certification. 
The following are the challenges which we would be facing in the near future, 
1. Regulatory challenges:
We already have carried out testing and have obtained CE certification 
for the hardware device and we can legally sell in Europe, UK, parts of 
Africa and Asia.
The product has received Class 1 certification for CE and we are fully aware that we need to file for FDA 510(k) pre-market notification in order to sell Diabeto to USA. However, we already have identified regulatory experts who can help us with the filing. Moreover, we have a few hospitals who are ready to help us with the accessibility testing, the data of which would be submitted to the FDA. Aqnd also not to forget, we are going to file the 510(k) pre-marketing notification with your help (Do take part in the study if you are in USA, without signing the consent form, we cannot ship Diabeto to you).
2. Manufacturing challenges: 
We have launched the Indiegogo campaign in order to enter into the manufacturing phase. The manufacturing would involve creating molds and tooling to manufacture Diabeto casing and different parts. This process is complicated and hence there might be a delay in the manufacturing process. We are completely aware of this process and situation and hence we have been taking various steps to mitigate this delay and delay risk by following ways,
1. Adopting Total quality management techniques (TQM processes) and Lean manufacturing processes. 
2. We have already identified the manufacturing partners which are locally accessible to our entire team. Thus, we would personally inspect the whole manufacturing process and also make sure that the testing and quality check is carried out in our presence. 
We are here to provide a quality product in your hands and our main goal would be your 100% satisfaction. So if there are speed breakers in the delivery process, we would make sure to mitigate the errors/delay and deliver a quality product in your hand in the given time schedule.



Share our Diabeto story and earn $ credit So you have pledged for your awesome Diabeto but you still wanna give back and share your good karma by spreading the word about Diabeto and eventually spread awareness about Diabetes. Don't hold back, sharing is caring and its super simple! When you become the Diabeto backer and share the links on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Google plus, Instagram, Tumblr etc) and when people buy Diabeto from your shared link, you will get dollar credit back. In fact, you can even get all your money back which you pledged for Diabeto. Sharing the word is super important to us and to the community, if you wanna really see Diabeto fly, you won't hold back and will share this campaign with your friends, family and relatives.
Click here to know more about the referral program and get $ credits

manage your diabetes in a much better way but also help you lead a

3. Is my data secure if I lose my phone?Yes!
 The main purpose of Diabeto application is that your data needs to be 
secure and safe because data is king. Moreover, we use industry standard
 safety protocols to encrypt your data and transmission is secure too.


4. I don’t see any support phone number for calling?Unfortunately,

support@diabe.to and we promise we will get back to you as soon as 
possible. Trust us!

 You can still use the Diabeto application to manually log your blood 
glucose readings, however, keep in mind that your accuracy will be 
hampered because of manual error.

story:
Hi my name is Linda Frenzel- I am 51 and been blessed with good health my entire life. Although now I have had a bad year with my health- I began the change-(you know the dredged female change) while I was on my 3rd mission/volunteering in Moshi Tanzania.  I had no idea what was happening to my body- but it was gross, painful and I thought I was losing my mind.  I was not blessed with children. I was married for over 16 years and my husband and I tried everything to no avail. Unfortunately- we got divorced in 2006 after almost 20 years of a wonderful life-marriage together. In 2012 I began volunteering as a teacher in the villages below Mt. Kilimanjaro Tanzania– and it changed my life.  I sold and donated all my materialist items to return in April 2014. I am extremely passionate about the students, teaching ESL (English as a Second Language) the community and their love.

Around mid Aug. 2014 I began to get sicker and sicker- As time progressed I started seeing Doctors there – in (Moshi)- they advised many different remedies-medication and such to no avail. As you can imagine OB/GYN are not used and/or available in this small town. After finding a Doctor I saw an OB/GYN 2 times then he insisted I go to Dar Es Salam, and I was fortunate enough to make it to a hospital in Dar Es Salam- (largest city in Tanzania) about Jan. 12, 2015 and there with sonograms they found my uterus to be 3-4 times the size it should be (endometriosis) . As well as my uterus was covered and wrapped in fibroids.  This was in Jan. 2015 I had to return to the states. Between Insurance- having to find work to live and moving to Toledo with a friend that would take me in to care for me and help me get through all the Doctors, testing, procedures, a home to live in and care for me. I of course had to find work.  And I did, with in just 3 weeks of being here in Toledo.  It is not a great job, it is long long hours for little pay. But it is a job…The Biggest problem--- is I started my job April 24, 2015- and it has no insurance (which I have on my own and pay the monthly premium ) I am asking for help for co-pays (the medical-hospitals for 4 surgeries- hospital (St. Luke’s)- the co-pays are getting to be over - 7 thousand and the bills from the Doctors, hospitals- Doctors after care have left me flat broke- worse I am know having this sweet women pay for me.

I need to be able to feed myself- co pays, meds, and help out with rent- my friend has gone beyond the call of duty for any friend--- she gave me her room cause it has an upstairs bathroom, and helps in so many ways.  I AM SO THANKFULL TO HER.  I know how blessed I am this women has taken me in and cares for me.

I am not a big computer, internet, social media (I am not on any social media groups)- but my friends grandson told me about this site so I thought I would try and see.  I am reachable linda_frenzel@yahoo.com and can be googled to see that I am a real person!!  All I can say is thank you for taking the time to read my story.  I am painfully aware there are many others that need help more than me. But desperate times--- call for desperate measures.  I am not medically able, nor allowed through my Doctors to return to work till maybe around Aug. 17th, but I will never make enough money to pay for my medical bills, medicine or myself for months.

Sincerely,

Linda Frenzel

Linda_frenzel@yahoo.com



  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
CAMP METABOLIC!!

 

Camp Metabolic is run by Accessible Lifestyles Unlimited, a 501(c)(3) non-profit dedicated to creating programs to allow those after paralyzing illness or injury to enjoy the best in active fun and pursue fitness goals. Camp is a place where anyone after a paralyzing injury or illness can come and live the dream, an active lifestyle. We rent an Easter Seals camp in Boulder Creek, CA., where we bring the best of adapted activities to a beautiful setting amongst the California Redwoods.

We have cycling, kayaking, scuba diving, tennis, basketball, weight lifting, sailing, an FES cyle, dancing, and everyone's favorite, YOGA!!! Yes, even the macho guys like it; ask Mark Wellman, the first guy to climb the peaks in Yosemite as a para- he loves it. AND he brings his climbing wall for the most excellent fun. We also have delicious, nutritious food and we make it easy to count your calories.

We enjoy the music of live singers/songwriters by the fireside, as well as fun in nearby Santa Cruz.

We have done this for the past three years (2010, '11, and '12) but didn't have the money to pull it off in 2013. We are looking in this initial campaign to find our down payment to Easter Seals due in December.

We are open to ANYONE with a paralyzing injury or illness attending, and we would LOVE to get the word out. The only requirement is that they get their doctors permission to attend Camp Metabolic, and that  they bring everything they need to take care of themselves for 8-9 days,. We live in a summer camp setting. We can arrange for personal care assistants but will not pay for them.

There is a lot of understanding within our group. There is also a lot of mutual encouragement for all of us facing the challenges ahead. Camp is designed to help people learn how to live better after their paralyzing injury or illness.

We have created this camp before, and we can do it again with your support.

Email us for testimonials from people who have attended camp.

See our website- www.campmetabolic.org

"Are you tired of not having many exercise outlets created for YOU? Of having to adapt to a world that doesn't understand being on a roll, ALL THE TIME! Where you wheel the line instead of toe it, and the few times it does occur, you SIT corrected, not stand? 

 

Welcome! Join your brethren and sisters at CAMP METABOLIC, a one week residential experience designed to improve the fitness of wheelchair users and the paralyzed. We have collected training equipment specially made for the spinal cord injured, people post stroke and polio, and others who have to incorporate paralysis and the use of a wheelchair into their daily lives. Come work out and spend the rest of your time enjoying the following activities:

 

 

  • Sailing
  • Weight Room
  • FES Cycle
  • Vita Glide (aerobic exercise)
  • Tennis
  • SCUBA...In Pool Only
  • Wii Games
  • Yoga
  • Dance
  • Writing Workshop
  • Archery- Possible
  • Badminton
  • Basketball
  • Cooking Demonstrations
  • Movies
  • State Park (accessible trails.)
  • Table Tennis
  • Swimming
  • Fireside Music ...."

story:
My name is Ryan West. I'm 27 years old. I love America, my fiance, my dog, and the LSU Tigers...

...but I hate cancer.

The first week of summer was full of excitement; LFO's Girls of Summer was booming on all the street corners, Obama was spying on all our cell phones, my "Hipster Ass Hipster House for rent" Craigslist ad was going viral, and I was dealing with a swollen testicle that I thought was only larger due to a collision with my bi-curious dog. I thought wrong.

After subsequently losing most of my dignity going doctor to doctor talking about my no no place, and several professionals saying that this abnormal growth was not natural, I had my right testicle removed and was promptly diagnosed with testicular cancer, or as doctors call it "the bad balls". Not only was my nut in trouble, but the cancer has spread.

The support so far has been amazing however the battle has just begun (I didn't want to sound cliche but there was no way around it).

The next 4 months will probably be the hardest of my life, with chemo treatment after chemo treatment. With fingers crossed, this will hopefully mean no more surgery and hopefully then, I will be cancer free.

In the meantime, my fiance Sara and I need your help. I will be out of work for the next 4 months and the medical bills are already piling up. We are hoping to raise as much money as possible to help us out with expenses during this difficult time.

Will you help us beat cancer?

Created with love (and my approval) by Adam Chapman. ALL proceeds going directly to me, Ryan West.
