losing our independence, being bedridden and unable to take care of ourselves?
Wayne is a man of strong Faith, he reads and prays regularly. Wayne is an
educated and intelligent man who is aware of his long-term health needs and is
eager to learn how to manage them with the help of God and his friends. His
positive spirit is not letting this get him down!
Please
help us raise money for Wayne. Be a contributor!
If this is practical for you please make contributions via PayPal (instead of by credit card) because the funds are received immediately and result in lesser charges we need to pay.If
you live in Canada and prefer making a contribution by cheque, please contact
Bob at rleblanc195@gmail.com .
If
you live in the USA and prefer making a contribution by check, please contact
Cher at WayneBelizeTeam@gmail.com
.
                                    Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you just can't contribute, but
that doesn't mean you can't help:

PLEASE spread the word and make
     some noise about our campaign. We would love it if you would share this
     with everyone you know in your family, school, church, and community!
Please remember Wayne and this
     effort in your thoughts and prayers.
Indiegogo has sharing tools -
     share on Facebook, through email, Twitter.
                                     How Will All of This
Be Managed?
Funds will be held in a separate US
account and used only for Wayne’s benefit. Funds will be disbursed for monthly
expenses, and as needed to make one-time
purchases. Cher will be accountable to Wayne’s Team for the disbursement and
accounting of all funds for as long as they last. Wayne’s Team is a collection
of professionals who are also personal friends committed to this endeavor.
Lovingly and with Great Appreciation, Wayne's
Team
#WayneBelizeTeamHello All:Wayne writes poetry and here is one of them:THE SAME OLD BENCH
 
 I saw you look for me
then you shake your head.  Wondering where did I go?
 
I am still here sitting
on the same old bench, watching the Passers by chit- chatting as they trod
along.
 Some
greet me with a smile.
 
Others say hi, hello, how are
you today?  
Above my head under this
magnificent, flamboyant tree, as I Sat gazing into the horizon I heard the
beautiful sound of a Lark. She sang with such a sweet refrain.
 
Melodiously she harmonized
with the same serenity that I felt Inside, making me feel good to be alive.
 
Sitting here, resting my
bones pondering on the issues of Life, searching for solutions,
 
My mind reflects on some of
yesteryear’s wise saying:
“Knowledge hidden from the
wise and prudent will be Revealed to the babe and sucklings,- the pure of
heart.”
 So
for reasons more than one, 
When you pass this way looking
for me, 
Don't be amazed if you find
me here, 
Sitting on this same old bench

Watching the passers- by.
 Sometimes
you might even catch me gazing into the sky 
On this, same old bench.

story:
WOHOO - Melissa got a surgery in Calgary for FREE on the 30th of April, 2014!  That means we will be refunding all contributions within 15 days of March 21, 2014.  Thanks to everyone who contributed!

Hi! I am Melissa Easton's spine, and my name is Bulgie! Unfortunately, I've been hurt pretty bad and I need a surgery in Vancouver. It's super expensive, which is why I started this fundraiser. 

If you're in Calgary, visit the Event Page by searching "St. Backtrick's Day Fundraiser" in Facebook for event details. If you want to learn more about Melissa's story, please read below to learn more or donate now! 

You may know Melissa because you went to high school together, played volleyball at Trent University, attended youth groups in Ontario or Calgary, work with her as she expands young minds with the joy and mystery of math & science, traveled with her to Romania, Russia or Mozambique, or biked around Lake Ontario with her. If you know her, you probably like her, and you've probably seen her do something very sweet and selfless for the people around her. 

As Melissa's spine, I know how hard she works to stay curious and excited about work and life. It ain't easy being the spine of a multitasker! However, something you may not know is that over the past year, Melissa really overdid it. While training for climbing Mount Kilmanjaro in Tanzania. Melissa hurt me pretty bad. But, being Melissa, she tried to tough it out. Over the next months, she worked and played through the pain, as she has with all other previous injuries. 

Well, then she actually climbed the darn mountain and things got worse, Melissa sought chiropractic and physio care, but it wasn't until she finally got the results of the MRI in December 2013 that she realized that the injury was on the verge of becoming a neurological emergency. I technically have a herniated disc towards my end parts (L5-S1), and another bulging disc (hence, the nickname) just above that. Luckily, the doctors intervened, and told her to rest me completely and to get ready for surgery and rehabilitation. 

But, while the Canadian health care system has many perks, wait times for these kinds of surgeries is not one of them. Melissa has been on the waitlist for surgery in Calgary for three months, and officially started long term disability this month. She heard from the surgeon this week that she won't get a surgery date until at least several months from now. That means she won't be back to work until September 2014, and living on the long term disability wage is going to be very challenging. 

If you know Melissa, you know she misses moving! She misses her classroom and the amazing kids in it, she misses spending her Alberta winters running and hiking, she misses playing for real with her niece Vera and her nephew Brodie. She misses jogging, and road trips, and helping out with her friends, family and church community. At the most basic level, she misses being able to grocery shop, tie up her shoes easily, carry her purse and function at even half of her regular pace. She misses a pain free life. 

So, an expensive alternate has emerged over the past two months. This plan gets her back to work the fastest, gets her off long term disability and back into the classroom where the Province really needs people like Melissa. Melissa is a math and science teacher to kids in grade 6-9. And she is really, really good at it. Her salary is paid by the province. So is her long term disability. But, the province, and the community, suffers when good, otherwise healthy, teachers are not working. Especially when Melissa is that teacher who is always planning special trips for the students, staying late to help with special projects, participating in school leadership. She is all in, all the time, and now she needs our support. 

This plan involves a $12, 000 surgery at a private centre in Vancouver, and that fee doesn't include accommodation or transportation from Calgary. The surgery is known as a microdiscectomy and is scheduled for March 26, 2014. That leaves us exactly two weeks to help support Melissa in her efforts to become pain free and get back to normal living sooner, rather than later. - See more at: http://www.crowdrise.com/melissaeaston/fundraiser/ashleywhite1#sthash.sP2tZxbN.dpuf

Where does the $12,000 go?

  • The funds raised will help pay for Melissa's spine surgery (microdiscectomy) in Vancouver.  This does not cover accommodation, transportation, food or rehab. 

The Impact

  • Two kids get their aunt back. 
  • Dozens of kids get their teacher back. 
  • A team of volleyball players get their coach back. 
  • Your friend Melissa gets her groove back. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Got a place to stay in Vancouver? Email Melissa!
  • Got a line on cheap travel between Vancouver and Calgary? Email Melissa!
  • Can help Melissa post-operatively with life's necessities? Email Melissa!

I am so grateful for your support, and may we all advocate for improved access to necessary surgeries!

Thanks a lot! XO,

Bulgie.

story:
invisaband: the all natural mosquito repellent bracelet has been successfully funded!  Look for it in a store near you or click below to buy yours online! 



Click here to buy invisaband now!





natural mosquito repellent for everyone


invisaband is an all  bracelet that  guaranteed to stop you from getting mosquito bites!

Lotions and sprays are messy and leave you feeling icky. Not to mention the harsh and toxic chemicals, such as DEET, that other products may contain. invisaband is something better. Something natural and non-toxic that can effectively keep mosquitoes away. The active ingredient, geraniol oil, disrupts a mosquito's ability to sense you. Now you can become invisible to mosquitoes!



invisaband is made from a microfibre band that you can wear around your wrist, ankle  or even attach to your backpack, hat, pant loop or stroller. The adjustable clasp and sizing holes make it one size fits all. Plus, it’s quick and easy to put on.

The unique breathable microfibre design of the band allows for an on going “gradual release” of the active ingredient.


This was important since other materials such as plastic or silicone don’t allow for this “slow release” mechanism. With invisaband, you will get more than 120 hours of mosquito protection from each band. Plus, you will receive a resealable airtight pouch to store them in.


Each package of invisaband comes with five bands that are each reusable for more than 120 hours. You can buy yours today at www.invisaband.com!


Have you ever wondered why people have been planting geranium flowers in their window sills for generations?

It’s not just because they look pretty. It turns out mosquitoes and other insects don’t like hanging around the geranium flower.

One of the oils that can be extracted from the geranium flower (you guessed it!) is geraniol. Geraniol is a natural essential oil that has been studied to be more effective at keeping mosquitoes away than citronella and in some cases, even DEET!

“It’s the first effective alternative to products containing DEET, the most widely used active ingredient in insect repellents now on the market,” said Jerry Butler, entomologist with University of Florida’s Institute of Food and Agricultural Sciences. “After relying on DEET-based products for more than 40 years, this is a breakthrough that should revolutionize the market.”

Geraniol was granted "generally recognized as safe" (GRAS) status by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) in 1965.

Other generally regarded as safe substances include things like caffeine, vinegar, calcium, coconut oil, salt and many more. 

invisaband is made with 30% geraniol oil.


  • invisaband is the next generation of mosquito repellent. With no toxic chemicals, it’s better for you and for the environment.

  • It’s quick and easy. Just put on an invisaband and you’re good to go! No more wasting time slathering on sticky lotions or breathing in sprays. No mess. No fuss.

  • It’s reusable. The resealable pouch lets you use invisaband for over 120 hours.

  • Most importantly, it works! There are many natural repellents on the market today, but few prove to be effective. Geraniol, on the other hand, has been studied for a number of years showing proven efficacy in repelling mosquitoes. 



    • Well, if you love the great outdoors, invisaband is for you! Perfect for
    • Sports: Weather your watching or playing, don't get caught outdoors without one! 
    • Traveling: Since there's no liquids to invisaband, it's the perfect travel mosquito repellent! Next time you go anywhere tropical (or anywhere at all, for that matter) don't forget to pack some light weight invisabands!
    • Camping: Well no kidding! Love the great outdoors? You'll love invisaband too!
    • Late Night Walks: One of the inspirations for creating invisaband was that my parents would take late night walks together each night. However, they'd always come home to complaining about the darn mosquitoes!
    • And much more! Since invisaband is so versatile, you can attach it to your backpack, stroller or anything else! We've even see some fly fishers attach it to their hat!




    Don't you hate it when you buy something and it turns out it's not for you? Worse still, you can't get your money back. 

    Well, we don't want you feeling that way. invisaband is a different type of product and we are a different type of company. 

    We know that no mosquito repellent works 100% of the time for every single situation or person. But we always want to make sure you are 100% happy with our product.

    If, for whatever reason you're not happy with your invisaband, we'll give you your money back.  Just send the package back and get in touch. 

    That's unheard of in the mosquito repellent market! But it shows you we are that confident in our product! 

    We know you will be happy with invisaband!



    We need to guarantee our manufacturer a large quantity to be able to mass produce invisaband and make it available across the United States. 




    In return for your contribution, you will be getting exclusive discounts and will be able to buy invisaband before it's available in your local store.





    Buy your natural mosquito repellent bracelets today!

We need to guarantee our manufacturer a large quantity to be able to mass produce invisaband and make it available across the United States. 





In return for your contribution, you will be getting exclusive discounts and will be able to buy invisaband before it's available in your local store.












Buy your natural mosquito repellent bracelets today!

story: My good friend and colleague, Robinson Michelot, told me last September that he needed surgery for a painful hernia. At that time, I had just sent English/Creole dictionaries to Haiti for the school he so generously runs for Haitian children. I knew he was unable to get the surgery at that time, due to financial constraints. But when he reached out to me again this month, NINE months later and still suffering the pain from this hernia, I said that I would make sure we got it taken care of. This would not happen in the U.S. and it upsets me so much that he can't access the healthcare he needs in Haiti. $650 is really not a lot to get this guy feeling good again and in his top capacity to help other Haitians in need. I'm hoping this campaign can raise the needed expenses quickly! We already have the hospital and doctor lined up for this. We will keep current updates on Robinson's surgery here, until he is back on his feet again! Thank you for your support!!!

story:
of the population cannot swallow pills and tablets


people over the of 65 cannot swallow pills and tablets


"Many young people also cannot swallow pills and tablets".

You may be surprised how many people you know, of all ages, have difficulty swallowing pills and tablets.

The current solutions involve time consuming manual crushing and adding jam to mask the bitter task of pills and tablets. This increases the risk of contamination and that not all of the pills or tablets will be consumed.

There has to be a better way!



My name is Keith Dobson.

I am a registered nurse and I have spent my working life caring for people. This led me to spend the last 10 years finding a better way to liquefy pills and tablets to address the major issue of medication non-compliance.

To learn more, please watch the following video.



 myLiquitab rapidly liquefies tablets and pills

 To see the unit in action, please watch the following video. 

We are in the final stages of production preparations and need your assistance to launch myLiquitab to provide a viable solution to the problem of people not being able to swallow solid dose medication. 


How does myLiquitab work?

myLiquitab uses a combination of ultrasonic energy
and other technologies to rapidly liquefy pills and
tablets resulting in a pleasant tasting liquid
which is much easier to swallow than
solid dose medication.











Features

Spill Proof


Has large, easy to use controls.


Includes a variety of flavours.


Removes the need to deal with gritty, unpleasant tasting crushed pills and tablets.



Provides a hygienic environment.


Benefits

Easy to use

With large control buttons. Removes the need to manually crush tablets, thus avoiding wrist strains.


No cross contamination

By providing a closed environment and using a purpose designed beaker.


A flavour of your choice

Masks the bitter taste of pills and tablets.


Easy to clean






















Keith is the founder of myLiquitab.

He is registered RN Div 1 (general nurse) and Div 3 nurse (psychiatrically trained). During his training, 'some many years ago', liquid medication was freely available for the treatment of a range of medical and psychiatric patients.
Non-compliance was, as it appeared, a less obvious problem than it is today. As a trained nurse who was taught about ensuring the patient consumed their prescribed medication, for Keith medication compliance remains at the centre of patient care.

Keith emigrated to Australia and practiced as a nurse and has held many senior positions as Director of Nursing in many clinical areas.

Michael is a Chartered Accountant with over 28 years experience gained with major accounting firms and listed companies. For the last 8 years, he has worked extensively with early stage companies to assist them commercialising their technologies.

Michael joined myLiquitab in June 2015 to focus on building the production and logistics enablers to take myLiquitab to market.



Ian has been at the forefront of the engineering profession with over 30 years with experience in both mechanical and electrical streams, and has been involved with engineering innovation throughout his career, with significant international experience. Ian has also been involved in manufacturing, procurement, and setting up lines for manufacturing. 

Ian was one of the first investors in the Company, and remains passionate about the Company taking a leading role around the world in medication management.



David has more than 30 years of experience in creating, growing and managing businesses. These have been in the Information Technology area including software development and the people business. 

He has a particular strength in the areas of finance and governance. David has been a Director of Vision Australia, MGGS and the Acclaim Awards.


Ian is principal of McDonald, Slater & Lay, Solicitors and Consultants, in Melbourne. He is a Member of the Law Institute of Victoria and a Fellow of the Society of Certified Practicing Accountants. He was awarded a Member of the Order of Australia (OAM) for services to Rotary and the Arts. 


Keith Dobson, Director
       kdobson@myliquitab.com 		Michael van Uffelen, Director
       mvanuffelen@myliquitab.com

ABN 49 121 790 770
LIQUITAB SYSTEMS LIMITED

myLiquitab. A better solution for the whole family.
myLiquitab is a Trademark of Liquitab Systems Limited.
© Liquitab Systems Limited.
